text:
Very appealing looking beer, clear golden with visible carbonation and a little white head. What I didn't expect, but perhaps should have given it's from Schlenkerla, was the smokey finish. Interesting palate, give it a go!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at home. Clear golden body with a medium white head. Smoke, hay, malt. Great smoked lager.

500ml bottle. Pours clear yellow with a long lasting white sea foam head, nice lacing. Smells like a campfire and toast. Tastes of grass and wheat with a delicious lightly smoked finish. Nicely balanced, really enjoyed this.
I expected a lot more smoke in this one. The result is a good, but average dortmunder with crisp and refreshing bitterness.
Greetings from Bydgoszcz, Poland to all Beer Geeks and Hopheads around the world!

0,5 l bottle. Clear golden in the glass, one finger white head. Defintive smoke on the nose. Taste starts also really smokey, some malt in the background. But really easy to drink. Very tasty for a Helles.
Na zdrowie, Salud, Kampai, Prost, Skaal, Zivjeli, Fenékig, ?? ????????, Na zdravi.
Waldhonigfarben im Glas mit gut haltender Schaumkrone. Malzig fruchtiger Antrunk, leichte Rauchnoten und Säure im Körper, schöne Hopfenbittere im Abgang. Sehr harmonisches Bier aus Oberfranken.

Golden clear beer with longlasting small white head. Aroma is skunky at the beginning, after it goes softer, herbs and malts. Taste is crispy light bitter, light smokey, yeast. Nice full flavoured light beer.

Off white head quickly left cover on slowly effervescent, golden body. 
Sweet floral aroma. 
Medium bodied, smooth on the tongue & very sharp & prickly on the back. Crisp & clean. 
Very subtle flavours of wheat, yeast, hops, floral, sweetish, pine & a slight bite on back. 
This is how a lager should taste.
Bottle from getrnkemarkt. Aroma of strong wood fire. Taste is lighter smoke, some light grapefruit. Very passable and would be very nice if ice cold or cold keg. Not my favourite helles though.

500 ml bottle. Medium gold pour is clear and bright. Topped by a large frothy white head that offers nice clinging lace. Fragrant herbal hops and sweet malt with a very subtle smokiness. Earthy, sweet malt dominates upfront. Notes of sweet nutty grain, spicy hops and sauerkraut make for a refreshing character. Outstanding light grassy hops in finish.

Pours golden clear with long lasting creamy white head and with high carbonation. Aroma: pilsner, crisp, bready malt notes, hint of dms, bacon (smoked).
Flavor just follows aroma with crisp, corn, white bread like malt notes, gentle diatecyl, low level of DMS, gentle smoked (bacon-like) notes, floral, spicy notes of hops. Finish is dry. Body is moderatebmedium, texture soft, carbonation is high?
21-03-17 // 500ml bottle. Pours a clear golden beer with a solid white head. Taste is smooth, light malty and grainy, some herbal grassy hop notes, light smokey touch. Overall a really good Helles.

Zapach średnio intensywny, słód, szynkowa wędzonka, dym, chleb, zioła. Kolor złoty, klarowne. Piana średnio obfita, drobna, średnio trwała, lekki lacing. W smaku umiarkowana słodycz, niska pełnia, słód, zboże, zioła, dym, wędzonka. Goryczka niska, wysycenie średnie.

Bottle, many thanks to SinH4! Clear gold with a big, white head. Slightly grassy, cereals, warm citric notes, with a subtle hint of smoke. Light sweetness with medium bitterness, a bit tart. Body is light to medium, with lively soft carbonation and a subtle smoky finish. 
Hell of a good lager. I dont even know what more to write. This is a great beer.
Lovely lager, not as heavily smoked as their other beers, but very enjoyable nonetheless.

Im not describing the beer since there are plenty of faithful descriptions here.
I just want to say that in my opinion this is a great, original helles, refreshing and beautiful to look at (that head!). 
I routinely buy this from Schlenkerla ecommerce and it always comes in good conditions (never bought it in summer though - I live in Italy).
Bottle, 50 cl. Decent, overall quite smooth. The smokiness appears mostly in the finish.

Bottle->lager glass. Very slightly cloudy gold with big frothy white head. Aroma has slight smoke, some floral and earthy notes. Taste is moderately bitter and smoky malt, flora and earth, hint of citrus. Ok, though I prefer the bolder smoked beers from this brewer.

16.9oz bottle - nose is skunky straight out of the bottle, but in a good way. Other aromas include lemongrass, honey and feed grain. Sip adds strong wheat aromas and subtle smoke. Wife says inquisitively, "Is this smoke-y?" I get a lot of lemon zest in the finish to which my wife replied, "I get a lot of gross." A solid beer.

W aromacie czysty profil dymny, co jak na popłuczynową wędzonkę 9 (warzone bez słodów wędzonych) jest szokujące. W smaku lekkie, intensywnie wędzone, dymne, żadnych nut szynkowych. Bazą jest jednak tylko helles, mdły, bez goryczki, z ledwie zarysowaną zbożowością. I tak nieźle!

Butelka z datą: 03/2017
AROMAT: Dosyć intensywny. Słodowe. W tle delikatna nuta wędzonki (aromat wędlin).
SMAK: Słodowe. Przyjemny posmak wędzonki. Spore nasycenie. Goryczka średnia, raczej krótka.
WYGLĄD: Barwa słomkowa, idealnie klarowne. Piana średniej wysokości, nietrwała.
OGÓLNIE: Całkiem smaczne piwo z legendarnego niemieckiego browaru. Choć powiedzmy sobie szczerze, że gdyby nie ta wędzonka byłby to kolejny nudny jasny lager.

Ar: Very faint smoke, with a ham/bacon hickory note; some light clean bread, with hints of herbal noble hops. Ap: Pale gold, crystal clear; large white head with great retention, cap of mousse with a trail of chunky lacing on the glass sides as the head slowly subsides. T: Lightly smoky, with a phenolic edge; smoke phenols combine with moderate bitterness and herbal hop flavor, lending a fairly lean, bitter edge; lightly doughy malt; very clean fermentation profile; no sweetness, cracker malt flavor throughout. P: Light body with medium-high carbonation; finish is dry. O: Fun take on a helles--with the smoke element; the smoke is just on the borderline of unbalancing the beer, given the phenolics, but it does stay in balance overall; the helles beer underneath is nice, quite clean and with a nice backbone of fresh pils malt.

Pleasant beer. Nice aroma - for me caramel/floral but mildly so. Golden, frothy, appearance. Pleasant but not a wow taste - medium sweetness, medium bitterness (id prefer a stronger malt taste) Good palate. medium body, creamy, lively. Very drinkable - Id like to try it draft.
Clear golden, long lasting white head. Clean grainy aroma with smoky notes. Crisp, medium carbonation, clean grainy, malty taste with a bit of smoke. Great beer. And helles is not my favourite style.

Bottle. Clear golden beer, average white head, decent lacing. Aroma of smoke, malt, bread. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter, malt, bread, gentle smoke, herbs, light metallic. Light to medium body, thin texture, average carbonation. Good smoked Helles.
Great beer from a great town Benburg, surprisingly enough there is no smoked malt in this lager !!

Aroma is slightly smoky, herbal, perfume, wheat, earthy hops, different. Appearance is golden, white head, slightly hazy. Taste is perfume, smoke, earthy hops, herbal, interesting. Mouthfeel is light body, light carbonation, smoky herbal aftertaste. Overall, its weird and interesting, unlike any beer Ive ever tasted, and certainly a unique Helles. Its worth trying. This brewery makes interesting beer all around.

Pale golden, clear; pours with a thick, white head which leaves very nice lacing on the glass. The aroma is smoke (smoked ham, smoked cheese, charcoal) and malts. The taste is malty, bready with distinct smokiness, The bitterness is average, hoppy; the beers medium-bodied and very drinkable. A good combination of a classic malty lager and smoke.

Butelka 500m. Kolor złoty, klarowny do bólu, piana biała, drobnopęcherzykowa, ładnie osiada na szkle. Aromat łagodnej wędzonki, słodów a w smaku dochodzi łagodna goryczka ze słodem w tle. Bardzo dobry lager, wysokie wysycenie . Na podniebieniu przyjemne,dobrze ułożone i doskonale pijalne piwo.

Flasa z beershop.sk. Bledo zlta farba, biela pena. Vona sladova, jemne zaudena, trosku saponat. Chut sladova, trosku travnatej chute, jemne zaudenost. Dochut bylinkova, zlahka horko-zaudena. Lahko pitelne.

Bottle (1 pint 0.9 oz). Pours clear, pale gold color with off-white head and lacing. Smoke and grass aroma. Smoke and grass flavors. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a 16 OZ bottle into a pint glass at the World of Beer in Pooler, GA. The appearance is a clear golden yellow with a large white head. The aroma is grass and grains with some smokey notes. The taste is grass, grains and some bread. An average beer.

From tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a clear golden with a big white head. Aroma has a light but prescent smoke, pilsner malts, slight grassy EU hops, pretty clean. Taste is crisp, subtle sweet, light bitterness, quite a bit of smoke. Light, crisp body and a medium high carbonation.

Bottle from total wine west Richmond Pours clear pale golden with a large white head. Lightly smoked peat aroma along with grasses and perhaps leaves. Flavor is smoked peat, grasses, autumn leaves, earth, wood. Tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
16 ounce bottle. Smell like yeast Light yellow in color. Lightly carbonated. Little fizzle on the tongue. Pretty good for the style.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2017 Butelka 0,5l. Aromat przyjemny, wędzony ze typowym dla jasnych lagerów słodowym, delikatnie siarkowym tłem. W smaku głównie słód, delikatna wędzonka. Wysokie nasycenie. Przyjemny, ziołowy finisz, goryczka zaznaczona.

Ar: Mila, lagerowa slodowsc, przyjemne nuty wedzone. Subtelnie bardzo jest w aromacie.
Wyg: Rasowy lager, totalnie przejrzysty i klarowny, fajna biala, srednioziarnista piana.
Sm: Wysoko wysycone, mocna lagerowa slodowosc podbita delikatna nutka wedzonosci. Swietny lager, ale nie obca mu typowa leciutka lagerowa siarka, z wyrazna siarkowa goryczka, ale jest ok.
Pos: Lagerowa goryczka, minimalnie zalega. Odrobinka wedzonosci ze slodem w tle.

Piwo klarowne w kolorze zlotym z obfita biala sredniopecherzykowa piana. W aromacie niezbyt intensywna wedzonosc, troche ziolowe plus slody i typowe nuty lagerowe. W smaku lekko wytrawne z niska goryczka i wysyceniem na wysokim poziomie. Lekkie i pijalne jednakze spodziewalem sie wiekszej wedzonki.

Bottle. Nice, balanced, but not very intensive aroma- smokyness (smoked sausage) in the first place, then noble, continental hops notes (very herbal) and light bread maltyness. Pale, clear with white head and classy lacing. In the taste, the smokiness is also present, but goes away after couple of minutes. Apart from that, therere bread maltyness and delicate, herbal notes from the hops. Bitterness barely noticeable. Too much CO2 for me, but its typical for this style. All in all, positive surprise for a Helles.

500 ml bottle bought at Running Beers booth at HKCEC in Wan Chai during The 14th Hong Kong Food Festival.
Looks: Clear golden yellow colour; Two-finger head with crumpety white foam which lasts for 3 minutes; Excellent sticky lacing with fizzy carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant full lager malt, with moderate chopped bacon, light honey, strong floral, molasses, thick bread, fair lemon and strong grass.

Taste: Mid to light sweet lager malt, with light bacon, light ash, strong floral, molasses, strong herbs, strong dough, lemon, close to strong bitter hops and strong grass.

Body: Mid to light body; Dry, crisp and very slick palate.

Mouth Feel: Full lager maltyness in a solid background, very slick and smooth. Bacon smokiness and ash is a lot less potent than other Schlenkerlas smoked beer proper, but still tasty and notable. Strong herbal floral with moderate molasses. Very doughty with strong lemon to round. Very nice!

Hoppiness: Strong floral, fair lemon and strong grass in nose. Strong herbs, strong floral, lemon and strong grass in taste; Bitterness is strong for a lasting, close to high astringent herbal malty finish.

After Taste: Dry. Very hoppy and bitter to mouth.

Comments: This one has the Schlenkerlas rauchbier influence, the smoky, well-cooked bacon comes as a fairly light touch. Its rich doughty malt and very herbal grassy hoppiness make it a truly special Helles. Highly recommended!

500ml traditional bottle from Capital Market in Salem OR
$4.99
Pours a darker golden colour with a lovely frothy/bubbly 3/4 inch off white head.
Aromas of slight smoked cheese/ meats..some hops discernable .and crackerish malting.
Very smooth creamy drinking beer..with that hint of smoked meat in the back ground but forever present. Slight bitter hop/smoke end. Great.
Excellent smooth mouth feel..great stuff.
Just a wonderful example of a Helles lager..and the hunts of smoke only add to the pleasure for me.
500ml bottle. Aroma of sweet malt, yeast and some smokiness. The flavour is similar. More sweet than bitter and lightly smoky. Smooth and softy carbonated. Great lager.
Flaska. Gul öl med vitt skum. Doft av gräsighet, lätt örtighet och rökighet. En torr helt okej lager som lyfts av lätta trä och rökiga toner.
Great helles. Aroma of smoke. Pours clear golden with big foam. Taste of malts and smoke. Not so drinkable but well done.

Pours perfectly clear, golden colour with a sizeable white head. Aroma of grain, slightly metallic and herbal with a whiff of smoke. Semi-dry with lively carbonation, a distinct bonfire smoke flavour and solid malty backbone. The bitterness is quite strong, herbal. The smoke notes are quite unique and fit the beer well. I am not a fan of Helles style of beer. Thus, easy drinking and solid as it is, the beer simply isnt my prefered kind of choice. Still I value the quality of the brew.

Barwa złocista, idealnie klarowne. Piana dosyć obfita, zbita, drobna, trwała i ładnie zdobiąca szkło. W aromacie daje o sobie znać subtelna nuta wędzonki, która jest obecna również w smaku, poza tym aromat słodowy. W smaku dobrze współgrają ze sobą nuty wędzonki i słodu. Piwo średnio wysycone, przyjemna, wyraźna acz krótka goryczka. Dobrze pijalne piwo.

500 ml bottle. Pours clear golden with a rich white head, with a good-looking lacing. Aroma of light smokiness (think smoked ham) and hints of malt. Taste is smoke and malt, medium sweet, medium to low bitterness. Smoky finish of medium length. Medium body, crisp texture, high carbonation. Refreshing clean profile combined with a very high drinkability. Brilliant!

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2017 Aroma is dominated by huge smokiness in the kind of fresh smoked ham. Also hints of maltiness and bit of tartness. Pale golden in the glass with dissipate rocky head. Lovely smokiness, bit of woody and broil notes. Moderate tartness with fresh hopiness is also noticeable. Malty base in the background. Fizzy carbonation, long smokey finish. It reminds me an imperial version of polish Grodziskie. Like father, like son. Good work.

Pours clear pale gold. Aroma is malts and light hay, and hint of smoke. Taste is malts, hay, and light bitteness in balance with fresh grass and a bit of smoke. Very nice beer. One of the best flavoured helles cause it doesnt go bananas in the experimentation but still ads a twist.

Wysoka, zbita piana. Z butelki bardzo subtelna, kiełbasiana wędzonka. Ze szkła to samo + nieco wyraźniejsza słodowość. W smaku wędzonka ginie kompletnie pod wyraźnym, ziołowo-metalicznym nachmieleniem. Wysokie nasycenie, goryczka fajnie zaznaczona. Takie hellesy można pić na litry.

Aroma: malty.
Apperance: pale, clear, white nice foam.
Taste: malty, medium bitterness
Palate: avrage carbonation, little bitter finish
Overall: highly drinkable

Piwo idealnie klarowne, bardzo jasne, grubaśna śnieżnobiała piana, zdobi szkło. Aromat - czysty, słodowy, subtelna wędzonka, w tle minimalna kukurydza. Smak - bardzo przyjemna, lekka wędzoność, drewno, jasne słody, nawet jakaś goryczka jest. Posmak - słodowy, lekko chmielowy. Bardzo przyjemne i pijalne piwo!

Aroma: smoked, corn, grain, 
Taste: light bitter, light sweet, corn, herbal, smoky, some sweet, malty notes

Idealnie klarowne, jasnozłote z obfitą, białą pianą; opada umiarkowanie szybko, całkiem niezły lacing. W aromacie słodowe, czyste, chlebowe, przyjemna szynkowa wędzonka, bardzo delikatna kukurydza z tyłu. W smaku na wielki plus brak typowych wad, masła, diacetylu, dmsu etc, jest bardzo czysto i słodowo. Goryczka niska, wędzonka dobrze dopełnia to piwo. Wysycenie średnie, nie jest wodniste, bardzo pijalne.

Bottle. Mildly malty nose, with light smoke, somewhat earthy, creosote. Clear light orange/amber color, frothy head. Malty flavor, gentle smokiness. Some umami-like and woody notes develop in mid palate ... and, as it warms, those intensify. Thin-medium body, light carbonation. Very nice, The smoke is there, but its more of an accent than a main feature.

50cl bottle. Golden color. Smells and tastes malty and a bit like a ham sandwich, subtle bread and meat, but there is also a hoppy crispness. Balanced malt sweetness, a bit metallic (could be the bottle though). Overall nice and sessionable, probably prefer the Märzen.

Clear daark yellow, white lasting, lacing foam head. Great aroma for this style and nice bitter taste. Some smoke there too, propbably infused by the brewing process using the same kettles as their Rauchbier. Very, very nice. (Velp 201611)
Tyűhaaa! Az igazi smoked íz hellesbe ültetve, igazi hiánypótló darab. Gyönyörletes. Nagyon harmonizál. Szájteljes szotyiíz. Habos söröm. Mindennapi sör. Kar hogy itthon ilyen nincs.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017  Rami Rami is drinking a Helles Schlenkerla Lager by Schlenkerla ("Heller-Bräu" Trum) at Osiedle SzaserówNieprzegieta wedzonka, mowili, bedzie pan zadowolony... Wszedzie klamio! Dobrze, ze bambergowy slod wedzony w miare przyswajalny... bo zdominowal ewidentnie to piwo, malo hellesa zostaloOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Bottle
Aroma-bread, grass, smoke, 
Appearance-pale, clear, white foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, lightly sour, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, lively, long finish, 
Overall-very good
Butelka. Aromat wędzony, szynka. W smaku wysycenie wysokie. Klarowne, jasne, piana się utrzymuje.
Nice and crisp beer. Clear yellow with a lacing white head. Very drinkable. Great for the style.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
0,5l Flasche. Gelbes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Typisch malziger Geruch für ein Helles, schmeckt auch erst so, dann kommt eine dezente Rauchnote dazu. Das Bier wirkt harmonisch und süffig.

Data ważności: 03.2017 
 Kolor:  Słomkowy, wpadający w żółty.
Piwo jest całkowicie klarowne. 
 Piana:  Biała, kremowa, dość puszysta.
Pieni się mocno, ale opada szybko do chmurki.
Na koniec pozostaje średnia obrączka.
Lacing na szkle całkiem niezły. 
 Zapach:  Jest dokładnie tak jakbym czytał podręcznik BJCP.
Czysty słodowy, przyjemny aromat. Trochę ciasteczek, trochę zboża, trochę chleba.
Jest wyraźny zapach słodu pilzneńskiego.
W tle coś na kształt lekkiego DMS (bardzo łatwo się pomylić), ale w tym stylu to dopuszczalne, bo ten aromat wynika z tego właśnie słodu.
W dalszej perspektywie muśnięcie wędzonki.
 Smak:  Genialny, czyściutki, gładki.
Wyraźna chlebowa nuta wsparta ciasteczkami i przypieczoną skórką.
Dominują smaki zbożowe i słód pilzneński.
Średnia goryczka, czysty słodowy finisz. Szlachetne chmiele praktycznie niewyczuwalne.
Podobnie jak w aromacie na ostatniej prostej delikatna wędzonka drzewno-ogniskowa.
Lekkie, gładkie, wchodzi jak woda.
Dobre i niezobowiązujące. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Jest to pierwsze moje piwo w stylu Helles / Dortmunder.

Ostatnio zacząłem uzupełniać swój profil na RateBeer i zobaczyłem, że mam piwa z ok. 70 stylów na 77 możliwych.

Gdyby każdy Lagar smakował jak ten, polubiłbym z pewnością ten gatunek.
Wyraźnie słodowe z dominującym słodem pilzneńskim.
Ciasteczkowe, chlebowe, tostowe z delikatną wędzonką ogniskową w tle.
Czysty słodowy smak.
Dla mnie spox.

Clear golden with a white head. 
Aromas of smoke, charcuterie, hops, bread and grain. 
Herbal taste with smoke in the background. Malt and grain.
Lättdrucken och med en tydlig rökton i smaken. Lite annorlunda men positiv upplevelse.

Pours an almost clear golden with a medium frothy white head. Aromas of rye bread, smoke, minerals, herbal and floral notes. Taste is smoky and herbal with moderate fruity and floral notes. Mouthfeel is light bodied with medium carbonation.

Golden, perfectly clear, very small head. Aroma: malt, butter, smoke, bit of hops. Light body, medium sweetness, medium bitterness. Quite a lot of smoke notes in flavour, clean malty profile, hoppy finish.
Bottle @home. Clear golden with a white head. Earthy and spicy notes with clean maltiness, bread, caramel. Throughout a gentle dry smokiness. Slightly sweet and smooth mouthfeel. Nicely Balanced.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear golden blond beer with small carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: pils malt and caramel notes balanced with smoked notes. Taste: light body with pils malt and smoked hit. Very nice easy drinkable. Perfect beer. Good attenuation. Tasty and drinkable. Aftertaste: caramel and smoked malt. Good.

Draft at Brauhaus Schmitz. Clear gold pour with an abundance of white foam. Clean, solid, gentle smoky flavor from top to bottom. Modest blonde caramel malts underneath. Works quite well. Not overpowering.

Great presence, looks super nice in the glass. In aroma - clear, smoky notes typical for the brewery. Pleasant one, but not so intense as I would expect. Taste has a lot of malty notes, but just after them there is pleasant smoky notes. Still - not that intense, but well balanced, well put all together. Its not as amazing as other Schlenkerlas beers, but still good one. Its more classical approach to the style, with polite smokiness.
Flaska från SB. Blekorange/gul med vitt skum. Doft och smak av pilsnermalt, lite brödiga toner, blöt kartong och honung med fina, subtila röktoner. En klassisk oktoberöl med en släng av rök.

Kolor: słomkowy, klarowny.
Piana: obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, trwała.
Zapach: słodowy, zbożowy, wyraźny aromat wędzonki, lekkie nuty chmielowe, ziołowe.
Smak: średnia pełnia, wyraźne nuty słodowe, zbożowe, wyraźne nuty chmielu, wędzonki, średnia goryczka.
Wysycenie: średnie, w kierunku wysokiego.

Bottle into mug. Medium-pale yellow, fine white retained head.Grain noise, hint of smoke. Light grain taste (heavier than wheat, not quite corn), with light smoke in the mid palate, and finishing with just a bit of hops that clears out the pallet. I like the smoke in this one -- it doesnt overwhelm and the hops balance it out nicely.

Bottle at Blackfriars. Pours clear golden with a large white head which largely remains and laces the glass on descent. Aroma is straw, hay and a modicum of smokiness. Taste is butter, straw, caramel sweet and a nice compliment of smoke. Buttery mouthfeel.
500 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear golden with white head. Light smoky, light grain and malt. Dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Smoke, malt, hops, grass.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Sweet malt, smoke.
Flaska från SB. Ljust gul med vitt skum. Rökig doft. Lätt i smaken med trevlig rökighet.
@ Havregatan 20160923. Bottle (500 ml) from Systembolaget. Malty, woody and smokey, bacon, burnt wood, sweet, medium body with a watery o oily texture. The finish is dry, malty and smokey.

golden clear, medium long-lasting white foam; malty aroma with some hoppy grass, some smoky notes; medium bitterness, light+ sweetness; medium body, moderately thick feel, average carbonation, long bitter finish;
Overall: nice drinkability, nice aroma, no flaws,

Draught from a warm bottle, no glass available. Some smoke, but rather mellow. Super crisp, still hinting at the fact this brewery is famous for smoked. Due to temperature rather heavy, but probably the carbonation kills a lot of that. Will have to try again.

Jasnozłote, klarowne piwo o dość obfitej pianie, która zdobi szkło i pozostaje do końca w formie warstewki na powierzchni. Aromat słodowo-wędzony. W smaku wędzone, słodowe, lekko ziołowe. Goryczka średnia. Ogólnie ciekawe jasne, ale wędzone piwo, wędzonka wyraźnie wyczuwalna, ale nie tak mocno jak w innych piwach z tego browaru, które piłem, pijalne.

Bottle at home, 11th September 16. Pours clear, light straw colour. Aroma is yeast, malt, slight smoke. Taste is refreshing and complex, citrus, malt, biscuit, some sort of smokiness. Really very good

Goldgelb klar mit weißem Schaum. In der Nase getreidig, würzig und leicht rauchig. Letzteres ist bemerkenswert, da kein Rauchmalz zum Einsatz kommt, sondern die leichten Raucharomen ausschließlich darauf zurückzuführen sind, dass die gleiche Anlage und Kessel benutzt werden, die auch beim Brauen der Rauchbiere zum Einsatz kommen. Das Bier ist überraschend hopfig würzig und angenehm malzig. Der leichte Rauchgeschmack passt hier hervorragend.

It finely compliments the aroma of a refined Helles. Taste is pretty full for the style. The very soft and elegant herbal bitterness balanced out by a neutral semi-sweet dough taste. Malt dominated but hops neither absent nor timid at all. Somewhat bitter finish and aftertaste. Light to medium body, refreshing, lively carbonated. Incredibly Moreish! This one is a very elegant, refined, top of the line Helles. Maybe not "exciting" but its as good as the style can get. I never thought I would rate so high a beer of a style I usually considered "boring".

Bought a 500 ml bottle at Total Wine for $5.49. The beer has a pleasing golden color with a minimal head of white foam. I was not able to detect the subtle smokiness that the brewery claims is present. However, I found the overall sweetness and light body very pleasant and refreshing. The only thing deterring me from drinking this regularly is the price.

0,5 bottle purchased at Johnny Off L. in Rome-Italy, consumed in Serbia. BB11/2015, I think it is a fresh batch. Pours a clea golden color, very clean with a solid tick white cap. Nose: a crash of malts along with a predominant hops aroma, a bit grassy but also kind of zesty. Clean nose, quite fresh. Tons of bread crust. Mouth: surprisingly clean although in a bottle, knowing Franconia beers do not bottle that good. Perfect carbonation going on the soft side, crispy body, clean and drinkable. A frizzy aftertaste, a bit peppery on the bitter side. Malts all around. Next time if fresh I will try to buy more bottles.

Classica lager tedesca colore biondo cristallino con schiuma bianca. Al naso note maltate con leggero sentore affumicato. In bocca leggera e piacevole con un sapore molto particolare affumicato che comunque rimane leggero e non invadente. Birra consigliatissima x gli amanti del genere "rauch".

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2016 Bottle. Pours clear, gold with good white head. Aroma is malt and light smoke. In taste malty and smoky with light herbal bitterness. Light bodied, medium carbonation, dry finish. Nice.

Bottle 0.5l. Clear light golden-yellow with small white head. The aroma has notes of sausage, earthy with some graininess. Bitterish flavor, a bit smoked, earthy with notes of sausage, some graininess and grassy hops, dry, lingering grassy bitterness. Lively carbonation, light to medium-bodied. Nice.
Pours light gold with a thick white head. Aroma of smoke, biscuit, and malt. Taste follows, great smoke presence but not over the top. I absolutely love this beer.

Flaska från Saveur Bieré. Smak och doft av humle, malt, citrus, hö, gräs, metall med toner av honung och torv. Fruktig, rund och len, jämna fina smaker med fin röktouch. Lätt beska, lagom sötma. Gott!

50cl bottle at home. Clear golden with a medium white soapy head with a nice lacing. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Medium bitterness with subtle smokey sweetness. Grass, malts, very subtle smoke, yeast and citrus. I hoped for a bit more smoke, but this is a quality lager.

Bottled sample at Beers 2015. Carbonation is medium. Color is medium-light orange-brown. Aroma of caramel malt, very very slight smokiness, but it can be felt. Hops are very gentle. Just slightly sweet and very gently bitter. Strong malt flavors. A very nice amber lager, but nothing special.
Bottle at beers2015. clear gold with a white head. very delicate smokiness in the nose, delicate bitterness and smoke in the mouth. Light body, smoky finish.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2016 Bottle. Clear straw golden with a stable white head. Aroma - malt, hay and light smoked bacon notes. Taste of sweetish malt, herbs, smoky, medium bitter finish, quite balanced and not very dry. Medium bodied, smooth and easy drinking, goes well with food.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml brown bottle. Colour is yellow, clear. Small white head. Nose has light smoky notes. Taste has smoked malts and grass. Some lingering grassy bitterness and lingering smoke. Soft mouthfeel. Quite a nice lager, good bitterness and the smoke adds a nice dimension to the beer.

500ml Bottle - Golden with a white head. Malty and slightly smoky aroma with notes of lemon and hay. Notes of ginger, lemon, honey and some faint smoky hints can be detected in the taste. Very refreshing.
Clear golden color with medium white head. Nice smokey aroma with malts and grass. Smooth malty taste with average carbonation and little bit of smoke. Awesome beer, very unique

L:
-pours a clear golden with a small to medium,foamy,white head
-high carbonation visible
S:
-grassy,floral,spicy,honey,very faint smoke
T:
-spicy,grassy,metallic,faint smoke,zesty
-too hoppy for a Helles
F:
-medium to high carbonation
-light body
O:
Fantastic Malt Base.
The smoke is very faint,so non-Rauchbier Fans dont have to be scared about trying this.
Bottle from Beltramos in Menlo Park, CA. This is a smoked salami sandwich beverage made specifically for Kowalski and me.

Unique approach. Juxtaposition of mild helles style with no malts but grainy, grassy notes and cereal backbone and campfire smoke. Smells like a campfire with liquid smoke. Heavy smoky notes with light malts, cereal notes a bit of grassy and floral notes. Lingering smoky notes and ashtray.
bottle shared with Rockley. pale yellow, frothy white head that retains nicely and laces thickly. big meaty smoke aroma and flavour, clean pale malts i terrific balance.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle from Blackrock cellar. Pours clear gold with lively bubbles. Lasting foam head with lots of lacing. Quite the looker. Aroma is sweet honey, smoked ham, floral, wood earth. Flavour is sweet honey, saltiness from the smoke background, floral finish. Quite creamy mouthfeel with a gentle carbonation. Lasting oak light smoky finish. Interesting beer and despite unusual flavour is very drinkable.
(bottle) hazy yellow golden colour with a small white head; aroma of caramel, then smoke, then earth, then honey; slick palate; balanced flavour; solid
Color palido muy claro con espuma blanca de buena formacion y persistente. Aroma levaduras, algo de ahumado y notas ligeras de malta, en boca igual que en aroma.
500ml bottle. Clear pale golden color with white head. Aroma is malty grainy, grassy, light hoppy, smoked notes. Sweet and bitter taste. Light thin to oily body with soft to average carbonation.

Pours a clear yellow color with a medium sized white head. The aroma is unfortunate somewhat skunked, lightly roasted barley, and some breadiness. The taste is smokey but very faint compared to their smoke beers. There is some hop bitterness but faint.
Im Glas wie ein typisches Pils, in der Nase leichtes Raucharoma. Im Trunk malzig mit sanfter, dezenter Rauchnote. Kurz danach bitter-herb. Sehr schöne Komplexität.

500ml bottle pours a hazy golden color with a finger of white head that settles to leave some spotty lacing on the glass. Aroma is smoky with some grains and grass. Taste is a grassy hop bitterness with a grainy malt sweetness finishing with some smoky sensations on the palate. Light bodied with decent carbonation. Overall, a quality lager beer with some added smokiness that adds a little character to a basic lager.

0,5L bottle from Hopfen and malz, Berlin! Pours a nice and clear color with a nice head. Aroma is grassy, bread-like and pleasant with a hint of smoke to it. Flavor is quite interesting and bready, with flavors of light malts, corn and spicy herbs. Has a slight smoky finish to it that makes this beer stand out. Really delicious!
Bottle. Mostly clear golden pour, with a white head. Grain, corn, mild smoke, some sweetness, and grass. Ok, but Im not liking it too much.

500ml bottle, BB Dec 2015, 4.3%. Pale orange, sparkling, clear, small foamy white head with no retention. Aroma is metallic, cardboard, lager malts. Body is medium, tingly carbonation, pretty smooth. Taste is lager, toffee, soft smoke, salty, some metallics, enduring musty bitterness. The smokey saltiness brings this up over most lagers for me. Drinkable, tasty stuff.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2015 Bottle. Pours crystal clear yellow with white head. Aroma is really german pils at first. Light corn, slight metallic, earthy hops. Sweet malts and just crisp. Some really subtle smoky notes in there as well. Taste is really light, fresh and crisp! Then finish is quite dry, rather bitter, earthy and spicy hops. And then smoked bacon! My new favourite lager!

Bottle. 

Sweet on the nose, like classic German pils. Jawohl! 
Light scent of smoke in it, but really subtle. 

So nice and easily drinkable.. Quite a bit of smoke, but so smooth! Gets smokier as it heats up.. Aw yisss!

Fresh malty, slightly roasty with nice smokey undertone. Fresh malty and dry body. Nice and intense. Full round and malty-intense with a decent smoke. Great intense with a malty-dry and nice smoked aftertaste.
Bottle. Yellow golden color, big white head. Aroma of cream, grain and malt. Taste of grain, creamy malt and subtle smoke. Subtle, elegant and quite taste for a lager.
Una lager con un pizzico di affumicato. Una birra pulita, piacevole, beverina. Nulla di complesso o rivoluzionario ma una birra interessante per ucciddere la sete e la monotonia.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2015 16.9 oz bottle, shared with friend, poured into tulip glass

Aroma: smoke, some noble/spicy hops

Appearance: golden, white head

Taste: sweet with light bitterness

Palate: light body, lingering smoky finish

Overall: A very nice smoked helles. The smokiness is great and not overpowering. You can still taste the Helles and the smoke compliments the style. Well balanced for smoked beer. Very drinkable.

Pours murky yellow with a foamy cap that offers little in the way of lacing. First sip comes off an naive as I was unaware that it had smoked essence to it. A tad thin, with some interesting leafy hop notes & a mineral touch.  Drill deeper into the bottle & realize its a unique take on the style with a lot of character. I dont love it, but Im glad Ive had it.

Pours a clear amber, slightly darker than golden. Normal head volume, lacing and retention.

Light nose that is slightly sweet biscuit. Underneath is a subtle smokiness that is more campfire like in nature rather than bacon.

Light medium bodied, barely, with a texture that approaches smooth. Above normal carbonation with a bit of effervescence in the middle and a nice prickly burst in the finish.

The outstanding flavor profile is intense, a bit complex and very well balanced. It begins with a mixture of flavors that slowly separate into a mild oak like smokiness over a subtle sweet biscuit. In the middle, it becomes rather crisp and becomes dryer towards the finish. A slightly bitter smokiness lingers.

Aroma: light smokey, grain and bread malts, light caramel. Appearance: clear gold, massive, frothy, white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: intense grain malts again, caramel, slightly dry finish. Overall: quite a nice Helles with the benefit of some smoked flavours. Bottle from Utobeer, London Bridge.

bottle, 05lt. Found at Valentin - Curious Biekneipe, Volos.
The aroma is classic malty Lager, with a small hint of smoky.
The same goes for the looks, deep golden with white foam.
The taste ist just great, you got a classic Helles Lager with the smoky feeling existing but just adding taste without to get the main star.
A good carbonation and medium body, maybe a bit oily, with a overall very nice taste that explode the "simple" blond Lager into extraordinary.

500ml bottle. Clear, brass-golden colour with average, thick, frothy to creamy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, white head. Grassy, woody, minimally smoky aroma, hints of peppercress, green pepper and dietary salami. Taste is dry, husky, minimally grainy, smoky leavings, grassy hoppy overtones, a mineral touch, very subtle pale malt sweetness; a greasy Salame Milano layer remains on the lips. Even Schlenkerlas "dishwater" is better than almost any other Helles.

500ml bottle from beermerchants.com. Pours a helles gold with medium white head. Taste has a light smokiness behind a decent helles character, just enough in fact without being dominating. A pleasant smoky lager.

0,5 l bottle from Schlenkerla webshop, best before end 6/2015. Clear, pale golden yellow with a medium large, fluffy, slowly collapsing, white head. Subtle smokey aroma of smoked ham and campfire with lager-like notes of grass, sweetish malts and butter. Sweetish taste of smoked ham, cereals and butter with a short, slightly bitter and grassy finish. Thin body, fresh mouthfeel, average carbonation. Very tasty and sessionable helles with a gentle smokey note that therefore stands out in this style. Good!

February 11, 2015. On cask at Akkurat. 
Clear golden with a medium sized creamy white head. Crispy aroma of noble hops and clean malty/grainy notes with faint smokey notes. Taste is light to medium sweet with floral, grassy and herbal bitterness. Very smooth and easy drinkable, soft carbonation.
White pale colour. Mild smoke on nose. Taste is big on palate with some mild smoke. Good stuff.
Bottle from Cotteridge wines. Pale golden beer with tight large head. Aroma of light smoked cheese and bread. Taste is lightly smoked, bread and smoked malts. Good stuff.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: FEB 23, 2015 Golden with white head. Smoke, floral, vanilla and some cereal. Round palate. Really something!

A: Surprisingly pale yellow gold with an inch of tight bubbly foam which stayed together for several minutes, never dissipating completely. Ample carbonation rising and attractive lacing as drunk.
S: Herbal hop scent with almost no maltiness and just the slightest hint of smoke. Very subtle though the very cold temp. may be stifling the aroma.
T: Oh yeah, theres the smoke!. Tastes like a very nice though typical pils or helles with sharp sour bread notes and mild hoppy flavors on the short dry finish. Crisp and refreshing. Very nice! Bonus: doesnt taste like someone dropped a fucking cigarette in it (looking at you. Marzen).
M: Nothing outstanding but very pleasant. Light body with a fairly strong tingle from the tireless bubbles. Finishes very clean leaving a hint of smoke at the back of your mouth.
O: I really like this quite a bit more than the Marzen which is the only other Aecht Schlenkerla offering Ive had. I guess its hard to get the smoke level exactly right but this is it at least in my opinion.. At $6/imp. pint, Ill forgo the Marzen but will definitely have this again from time to time. The stories are true, this is great stuff. Awesome experience!

Pale golden with a white smallish head. Aroma is malty with some hops and smoke. Taste is mild but pleasantly crispy with notes of hops and grass. Finishes with lingering smokiness. A tasty brew. (0,5l bottle, bb 07/2015)

Bright golden yellow colour with white foam head. Aroma of malt and firewood. Taste is spicy with here also the malt taste with à smoky flavor. 
---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pours a mostly clear pale golden with a large fluffy white head. Aroma of grains and sweet malt, mildly fruity almost prefumy, with a subtle smoke presence. Crisp grains and grassy hops, malt, with a smokiness that is kinda in and out throughout. Very tasty!!

500 ml. bottle @ home. Procured from Dranken Geers. BBF 12/2014 (so not very fresh anymore sadly). Enjoyed with sour cabbage, greens, potatos & tofu sausage in the spirit of things. Super crystal clear golden with a small, solid white head. Lacing is exceptional. Textbook appearance. Nose is grainy lager nose, faint corn sweetness, mmm Taste is better luckily. Light sweet grains, honey sweet, tad corn sweet, clean, touch more sweet than crisp, sugar, finish has a faint note of smoke that quickly seems to disappear from the picture, making a minor reassurance from time to time but you have to really look for it. Faintly grainy, oily lager body. Crazily easy to drink. It is good for what it is but I might had too high expectations considering that this is Schlenkerla after all. I have to say by the end of the bottle I found myself wishing that I had another one. At a good price point if available locally to me, I can see myself drinking a lot of it. A great accomplishment for a brewery to make a costumer feel that way about their beer. One that I believe German breweries in general work towards.

50 cl, bottled. Pours pale yellow with a decent white head. Aroma: Malt, wood chip smoke, grassy hops. Taste: Medium sweet, some acidity. Pleasant grassy flavours in aftertaste. Fresh. Palate: Medium-light body, some carbonation. Stingy. Pleasant and easy lager with smoked aroma.
Nice lager with light smoked aroma. Very balanced and smooth. Wish all lagers were like this one.
klart gyllent med fint hvitt skum med store bobler. duft av gress med hint av røyk. røyken dominerer smaken på en fin måte med milde florale smaker i bakgrunn. Fyldig ettersmak.
Bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours golden with white head. Easy drinking, fruity Helles. Some spice. Decent

500mL bottle, pours a clear pale blonde with a small white head. Aroma is classic spicy lager yeast, light herbal notes and grass. Flavour is very pleasant, with herbal notes, light spiciness, and a light grassy hops. Everything a helles should be. Perfectly balanced, with a great herbal spiciness. Great stuff.

500ml bottle served in a weizen glass.A: Pours an absolutely clear yellow color forming a medium to small head with low retention and lots of thin and lingering spotty lacings in the glass. S: Nose is the classic malty and crispy German Lager. Strong notes of sweet pale malts and flowery hops. Some metallic and ashy notes too. T: Slightly sweet pale malts in the upfront becoming dry and crispy with a considerable hop bitterness in the end. Notes of grassy hops. Hints of ashes and roasted malts.M: Very light body. Medium but persistent carbonation. Grassy bitterness in the aftertaste. O: Great drinkability. Refreshing. Excellent German Lager.

Yellow with a heavy haze, a cm of nice white had that fades to a soapy film and ring. Aroma is sweet, wet hay and pleasant smoke in the background, like that which silently wafts from neighbors on a cold winter evening. Body is medium-light, watery-syrupy, medium-light carbonation, just a bit of fine pricks. Flavor is light sweet grain (not malt or wheat, more like corn and hay) with light, delicate smokiness, maybe a hint of rye and tree bitterness. Incredibly quaffable, balanced, moderately complex, and yummy. Deserving of the label "Helles" over "Smoked".

Bottle. Clear golden body with a thin white head. Lively carbonation. Light lacing. Aroma of rhubarb, sliced pear, grass and white bread. Flavour of lightly smoked malt, apple pie and a finish of lightly smoked cheese. Thin body with a watery, slightly oily mouthfeel. Light fizz. Certainly one of the most unique Lagers Ive ever tried.

500 mL bottle from Total Wine, Chesapeake, VA. Pale yellow pour with a fizzy white head. Aroma of damp pale malt and faint citrus. Smoked wood is certainly detected in the taste and pairs nicely with the light fruit flavors found in this beer. Of the beers I have tried from this brewery, while this is not my favorite of them, I think this is the perfect starting point to introduce what a smoke beer is like. This is a great beer!
Very energetic little beer. Clear and quite a long-lasting head. Very very slight smoke taste.

Soft Helles like aroma. Body is a hazy straw yellow with lots of fine sediment floating around. Sweet Helles taste is on top of the famous smokebeer taste of its brethren beer but in a much subtler. Sense some sweet caramel tasting malts too. Leaves a sweet aftertaste with a touch of smokiness.

Blonde très pale, limpide, très léger col de mousse blanche. Nez sur le malt et maïs. Bouche sur le malt, houblonnage intéressant pour une lager, houblon épicé, citron. Amertume agréable.  Peu de corps. Laspect fumée évoqué dans la description et les critiques méchappe totalement ! Bonne bière de soif mais guère plus...
Flaske 500ml på på Cafe Abseits, Bamberg 11 Okt 14. Lys gylden. Svak aroma av røyk & gress. Smaken har et pikant røykpreg med en anelse gress.

Bottle from Appellation Wines. 
Appearance - golden with a proportionate head. Nice. 
Nose - subtle smoke and citrus. 
Taste - citrus and herbs up front and then wood smoke in the background
Palate - light bodied with a dry smoky texture and a balanced dry finish. 
Overall - the smoke grows in a gradual way and its adding complexity.

500ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours clear pale gold, thin white head. Light smoke and grassy aromas, light grains. Taste is quite fruity, more light smoke, creamy texture. Crisp, dry finish. Nice.

Faint whiff and taste of smoke is lovely. Good bitterness with a touch of coppery tang and bitterness at the end. Pale sparkling gold. And light and fresh mouth feel. A variation on lager well worth trying

Golden bubbly body and bubbly yet quite stable head. Classic yet very nice lager aroma, classically hopped, and a very faint butter but that supports the body and is far from an off flavour here. But I say dont smell, drink, because the palate is wonderful, and the bitterness juicy. Again a very small butter taste, but it gives a rich mouthfeel. It seems to come from the smoke. Excellent body, but overall a bit too odd perhaps to really raise the numbers. (50cl bottle from Saveur Bière)

Bottle from Great Grog. Clear golden body with a thin white head. Lively carbonation. Light lacing. Aroma of rhubarb, sliced pear, grass and white bread. Flavour of lightly smoked malt, apple pie and a finish of lightly smoked cheese. Thin body with a watery, slightly oily mouthfeel. Light fizz. Certainly one of the most unique Lagers Ive ever tried.

Draft pour at GBD. Poured a clear pale yellow color with a small, white head. Aroma was some light campfire, meaty notes. Light smoke. Flavor was nice light lager character, sweetness, and a little smoke. Not bad.
Lemon-gold with a generous head, plenty of lacing and a honey-sweet, floral nose. Modest carbonation with a light, syrupy mouthfeel and a long, roasty, honey, overripe banana finish.
16.9 oz bottle pours golden with a white head. Aroma of grains, yeast and some smoke. Taste is malts and a hint of smoke.

Bottle. Nice amber color, lacing white head. Nice wood fire smell, with smoky aromas, very tasty. Light sweet, light sour and a decent bitterness. More flat carbonation, with a watery body. Aftertaste is malty with a nice smoke touch, but not too much or too long.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2016 "wow - im surprised at the lower scores. this helles lager acheives a far more subtle smokiness than the urbock (which is world-class) and the marzen (pretty dang good too) without the use of smoke. poured at 44 degrees, the aroma took a while to open up...at forst no hint of smoke, but once it breathed the aroma and flavor were just fantastic. typical helles color, but has an everlasting fluffy white head, and is quite smooth. im generally not a lager lover, but this well balanced lager would be good without the delicate smokiness, and is just plain delicious with it. another that id get all the time if it were available in a 4 or six pack, but even at $4.50 per 500ml Ill go back to it...probably several times over the summer."
Bottle. Clear, orange, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & abrupt finish.
500ml bottle - pours a brilliant gold with bright white head . Soft grain aroma . Taste is clean bready malt with a faint smoke note . Clean and crisp . Nice .

In bottiglia. Aroma di cereale, affumicato non troppo intenso e legnoso. Al palato dapprima sentori di cereale e miele seguti da un finale affumicato, delicato con leggero erbaceo. Corpo watery ed estrema bevibilità.

Bottle:
Clear gold, with a giant, off-white head....frothy.
Lemon, grain aroma, light smoke.
Grassy,bitter, wheat malt flavour.
Very subtle smoked meat nuances,
light, but imparts the traditional Bamberg feel....
Very tasty and pleasant to drink.

Aecht Schlenkerla Helles Lagerbier has a thick, crackly, white head, a hazy, golden appearance, bubble streams, rather heavy lacing, and noticeable tan specks suspended throughout. The aroma is of very sweet, biscuit barley malt, bread crust, and smoke, which dies away over a bit of time. Taste is of those elements, riding alongside some pretty significant smoke presence. Yes, you do picked up the smoked pork with this one. Mouthfeel is medium, and Aecht Schlenkerla Helles Lagerbier finishes crisp, refreshing, and smoky. RJT

Poured into lager glass a light Amber with a foamy white head and lace. Aroma is subtle malts and wheat. Their is a sweetness to both the aroma and taste. Close enough to call light bodied with a fair amount of co2. Taste is malts and they use the same yeast from the smoke beers so it has a light smoked taste. This can vary from beer to beer. This one I could not pick out the smoke in the aroma while I have in the past. This is one of the more interesting helles out there since its a fairly boring catagory.

Bottle. Hazy gold with a thick white head. Aroma is sweet malt and lager yeast. Taste adds a little apple and some smokiness on the finish. Medium creamy mouthfeel and light carb. Definitely unique. I like it.
Light golden color with medium head. Weak aroma of hops and malt. Taste of malt. Only worthy to say thing is rather bitter aftertaste for this kind of beer.
Bottle. Sample at Voldby Ølmesse 2014. Pale yellow pour with some head. Nose and taste has sweat, grains and some ginger.
50cl bottle thanks to a friend. Appearance is hazy gold. Head is medium and white. Taste is medium bitter and light sweet. Body is medium but crispy. Aroma is smokey (yes!), light hop, light malt.

Tap at Bottleworks, Seattle.
Aroma: lightly smoky (without bandaid aroma that comes through in some smoked beers) light-roasted, earthy grain, slight floral note as it warmed a little.
Palate: Medium bodied but drier than the Bayreuther.
Flavor: Moderately smoky without being overpowering, pear, grain, yeast and moderate bitterness that lingers on the finish.
Comment: Great balance and integration of flavors. Instructive to have had this side by side with the Bayreuther Helles which was more rounded, and had less bittering and more floral character.

Pours a straw yellow with a huge head. Aroma is grainy/malty. Taste is the same with a little smoke as well. The taste is kind of light and, IMO, the smoke flavor detracts from the overall flavor of the beer.
Draft, Very good and definitely subtle smoke. Refreshing but with good body, paired very well with a brisket sandwich.

Bottle from Glug Newcastle. Pours dark golden colour with thin off white head which dissipates quickly. Interesting take on pilsner with a faintly smokey touch - helps it stand out from the crowd without the heaviness of other smoked beers

Drank this from the bottle
Mostly pilsner malt in the aroma, slight caramel malt.
Pilsner malt, slight smokey notes and sweetness, herbal bitterness.
Thin/medium body, soft carbonation, round mouth feel.
Dry herbal after taste.

Bottle from old backlog notes. Pours a clear golden color with a medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor have pale, bready malts, doughy, a mild smokey character which by the description came from the equipment not any special malts, light earthy, dry, decent, not one I would revisit.
Bottle. Clear gold color with a small head. Aroma is grains with a slight smoke smell. Taste is grains with a slight smoked almond aftertaste.

Wonderful slightly smokey aroma from the yeast repitched from their other beers. I had this beer ice cold in a frosted glass and the flavor held up
Wonderfully. I LOVE this beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Clean gold with a small head. Grainy malt aroma. Flavour is sweet, light smokey, sticky grain on a dry sweet finish.

Bottle. Pours golden yellow with an off-white, medium head that dissipates quickly. Nose is grainy with some honey, toasted bread and smoke that grows in intensity in the glass. Taste is mildly sweet and lightly bitter. Flavor reminiscent of cooked barley, theres some grassy hop notes, not much smoke at all. Finishes with some mild bitterness. Relatively clean with a light body. Not bad, grew on me the more I drank.
Pale yellow, some foam. Bread, grass. hay. Light bitterness. Pretty light palate. A better than average lager, quite refreshing, but not too exciting.
Bottle from Dranken Geers. Clear yellow colour, white foam. Medium carbonation. Easy drinkable lager. Malty aroma with subtle hints of smoke. Medium bitter finish.
Bottle at Craigs tasting. Very gentle smoke, sweet, light and thin, grassy.
Tuoksussa ja maussa mennään askel väärään suuntaan pmaan makuun. Kuitenkin yhden juo..

500ml bottle from Julios.
Appearance : Clear pale yellow with med foamy white head.

Aroma : Floral and spicy hops with light hint of smoke. Fairly malty with light adjunct notes.

Taste : Malty with spicy hops. Very light smoke notes if any. Fairly malty finish with spicy hops. Fairly dry. Light hay notes on the finish. 

Palate : Fairly lively carbonation. Thin palate but not that much considering the low abv.

Overall : Fairly nice brew. I was expecting a tastier malt profile but maybe this sample is not top shape. Quite drinkable and refreshing.

Butelka 50cl.
OCZY : śliczny i przejrzysty kolor złota z zółtymi odcieniami. Piana jest spora i śnieżno-biała. 

NOS : aromat jest dosyć intensywny jak na ten styl piwa. Dominują świeże aromaty nasion, słodkiego chleba i owoców cytrusowych takich jak mandarynka i cytryna, mokre pranie. Do tego aromat miodu akacjowego. 

USTA : średnio gazowane o wodnistej konsystencji. Bardzo delikatne ale oleiste. Przyjemne w buzi. 
Jest to piwo o świetnej równowadze miedzy słodkimi nasionami a goryczkowym finiszem. Trudno o bardziej subtelna gorycz bo pomimo delikatności jest ona dosyć trwała i orzeźwiająca. Słodkie nasiona wraz z aromatem chmielowym wyłaniają nuty miodowe i zbożowe z dodatkiem przyjemnej woni kwiatów. Posmak jest średnio trwały. Piwo lekko się klei na suchych ustach. 

ODCZUCIA : co za subtelne piwo ! Bardzo zadowalające pod każdym względem. Niesamowite na upal, który dzisiaj tutaj panuje. Jednocześnie zadowoli wielbicieli zboża ale i zaintryguje tych co lubią gorycz. Zaraz sobie naleje kolejny kufel. PS: Takie piwo nie powinno się pić po mocnym IPA czy stoucie bo kubki smakowe będą miały trudniej doszukać się niuansów.

OCENA : 
smak : 7/10
pijalność : 9/10

Bottle. Pale straw pour with a thick white head and lots of fizzy carbonation. Nose is corny and smoky, like someone dropped a match in a standard lager. Taste is really interesting. Fresh tasting smoke, some slight sandalwood and a big tasty hit of fresh lager. Refreshing, smooth and interesting!

500 ml bottle at the Bedford:Bamberg Spring Fest 2014. Pure gold with plentiful carbonation. Malt, grass and citrus in the nose. Taste is a cut above. A mild and subtle smokiness pervades a general bittersweet profile, overlaid with lemony sour/bitterness. Fuller palette than most lagers. Good stuff, just like everything else from this wonderful brewery.

Drunk from 50cl bottle bought near Bamberg. Superb lager style beer with subtle smoke taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50cl bottle, served in tumbler @ Homo Sibaris. Pours pale golden with small white frothy head. Looks a bit turbid, nothing wrong with it though. The aroma is composed of typical lager notes along with cereals and a very nice smoky touch. The taste is surprisingly hoppy, very well blended with the lager notes and the smoke. The palate is moderately dry and sweet. Light to medium body, good carbonation. Original and easy to drink, very balanced.

Excellent, brilliant stuff, a light smokiness pervades the beer and lingers legitimately for hours despite never being overwhelming, with a more traditional crispy light sweet helles malt body making up the majority of the flavor. Great beer.
bottle at home ... golden yellow ... thin white lacing ... soft grassy nose ... soft fruits ... light grassy fruits ... tiniest hint of smoke ... really not me,

Bottle from Citymarket, Kouvola, Finland.
Big white semilasting fluffy head. Clear pale golden color. Tiny smokey aroma with fine spicy nobel hop aroma and some crisp pilsner to balance everything. Smooth malty taste with crisp bitterness. One of the very best Helles Ive tried, and a huge drinkabillity.

500 ml bottle from BG Birra, served in a goblet glass. Beautiful rich gold, perfectly clear, with a creamy, persistent bright white head. Looks gorgeous. On the nose bready malts, light yeast, mild herbal hoppyness, a hint of wet cardboard in the far background. So smooth and clean in the mouth, much more bitter than expected upfront, but then an almost light sugary sweetness follows. Solid malty base, pleasent herbal hoppy punch, and just a tiny smokey/ashy sensation in the aftertaste, mainly coating the lips. Ridicously drinkable. Average to lively carbonation, medum body, slightly creamy texture. Stunning.

pours hazy golden with a nice off-white head showing some retention and lacing. honeyed and pils maltiness - some fresh cereals, subtle smoke, pepper, clean yeast, quite fruity too, hint of sweetness, grassy-herbalness, pinch of citrus. moderate carbonation, light body, clean lightly smoked and grassy-herbal-peppery finish. a bit straightforward but good. quenching too.

Pale with an easy white rocky head. Leaves intricate doily lacing. Clean bread Yeasty nose with a balanced but firms smokey finish at the end. Beautiful Smokey quality on the palate from beginning to end but still delicate and complex and bready and long. The best beer of its type. BNo doubt. But only an 84  on this site? Just goes to show that tickers dont know shit.

Bottle. Pours clear yellow with a nice, thick creamy head. Aroma is sweetly malt with a nice hint of smoke followed by a tremendous balancing spicy hoppines. Full body with quite soft carbonation. Flavour is initially sweet with malts and smoke, before the citrusy spicy hops kicks in giving a nice long bitter finish.
From bottle. Very clean, gold. Yeast and ash on nose. Strong lager flavor, with a smokey backing. Very refreshing.

Bottle at World of Beer Easton on 3/15/14. Clear gold in color with a thick off-white head. Aroma of malt, slight smoke and subtle noble hop. Malty sweetness on the tongue with slight smoke before a noble and smoke finish.

Flaska från Bier-deluxe. Gyllenfärgad, klar, medelstor vit skumkrona. Doft av ljust bröd, ljunghonung, skog och en aning rök. Röksmaken är inte alls påträngande utan finns i bakgrunden på en lätt, mjuk och len helles med en lätt brödig sötma och låg beska. Lätt drucken, trevlig och välbalanserad.

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2014 Flasche von Grabsch, Berlin. - Goldgelb, klar. - In der Nase Malz, zitroniger Hopfen, leichter Rauch. - Zitrusfruchtiger, herb-grasiger Hopfen über vollem, saftigem hellen Malz; dazu eine wirklich nur ganz zarte Rauchnote. Perfekte Rezenz. Im Abgang Grapefruitschale und die Trockenheit, die guter Spalter Hopfen verleiht. Gut bitterer Nachtrunk. - Wunderbar aromatisches, perfektes Helles, das eher an ein tschechisches Bier als an die faden, malzsüßen Biere, die sonst oft als Helles vertrieben werden, erinnert.

Aroma; grass, meadow, pale malts.
Eine große Schaumkrone, big fluffy head, almost clear straw golden body, eines fast klar strohgoldenes Bier. Lacings in my mug looks almost like a copy of a wall from Colosseum Roma.
Taste; hops, sweet malts, hints of caramel, berries, smoky wood, good stuff,
To palate fresh and crispy.
Finishes through the old oak, tasty malts, grains and hops. Overall nice stuff from northern Bayern, Oberfranken. Goes very well along with warm cheese sandwich, or anything along with it will do , I think.
