On tap at Map Room. Pours bright and slightly cloudy. Flavor is smoky but its not salty and sausagey like a rauchbier. Its flavor reminded me of a fresh hardwood campfire. It stung a little bit but it was good. Interesting beer.
Klær lys gyllen farve med lyst slum. Lukt av malt og humle. Smak av malt og humle. Ølutsalg.
Duft av malt og eik. Fin gyllen farge. Lite tynt skum. Smak av eik med en litt syrlig ettersmak. Leskende og lettdrukket.

On tap at The Dirty Truth in Northampton. An easy drinking brew with a dominant smokiness to it. I actually like this one more than their smokier marzen which is too smoky. It definitely went well with the cheese and pate I had with it tonight.

Bottle 50 cl.
Light amber to yellow, whit a medium white head. Lightly malty, with bread, grain and some hoppy grass aroma. Medium sweet, a touch of umami, medium lasting and rather light on the bitter. This is a true volume beer. This I can imagine drinking a lot of on a nice cool summers eve.

Music:Wagner  Die Meistersinger von Nürnberg
Might be advisable with more than one bottle.

Style conquest into Germany! Bottle. Pours clear gold, white head. Aroma is toast, fruit, "lager." Taste: holy crap, its smoky! Didnt catch this in the nose. Crisp, refreshing, light body, average carbonation, lightly sweet, short finish. Overall: unexpected; love how light and crisp this is. I need to drink more of these sub 5% classics.

This was a surprise...I picked up some non Rauchbier bottles here in Germany from this legendary producer. I was expecting a typical Lager, but I was pleasantly surprised to find that the "rauch" is here. A nice flavor is produced with the smoke and Helles lager. Not too heavy and a really refreshing drink...especially during the winter. Love to find unique brews like this in Germany!

Flaske fra roma Sofiemyr. Klar gylden farge, medium karbonert, stor hvit skumtopp.smaker malt, korn, brød,hvete, banan, gjær. Behagelig røyksmak.
 Ganske god

Aroma - the aroma is caramel, cereal, and slight grilling smoke
Appearance - appearance is pale, with a clear liquid that has some jetting nucleated bubbles, the head is frothy with full bubbles the head eventually calms down and hangs on a layer of foam. Stockings down the glass! Meow!
Taste - the flavor is really enjoyable its with a light sweetness of subtle malts, super muted hops, and a great shadow of grilled ham-like smokiness.
Palate - the body is light, the texture somewhat creamy, carbonation is average, finish moderate with the unique smoke

Further proof that this brewery believes in a think called smoke, and I love them for it. Love there use of smoke. Could drink this beer all day long. Probably would perfect for cooking as well.
500ml Flasche. Ins Glas ergießt sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, getreidig, leicht rauchig. Geschmack malzig würzig, getreidig, minimale Bitterkeit.

Yellow golden in colour with a big rocky white head. It is a model of German lager, but Im aware that it uses yeast from rauchbiers and there is just a suggestion of that smokiness on top of the classic German lager malt. The smokiness is much more pronounced upon tasting with dusky wood-smoke dark beech. It is a genuine pleasure to assess the subtlety of this beer. Thoroughly enjoyed.
A European lager that is anything but bogs-standard Eurolager.

24.01.2014. 0,5l Bottle. Spesialbutikken Vaaland, Bryne. Yellow colour with white head. Aroma is smokey with clear notes of wood and fire. Medium body with notes of malt covered behind the smoke. Bitternesd is medium as well. Good beer.

DAA; Pours hazy golden with a lacing, still fading off-white head. Aroma of roasted malt, grainy, grassy and citrus fruity. Taste adds spice, pepper with hint of wheat and banana. Light, crispy and enjoyable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hivenen savuinen lager. Ei oikeastaan juuri parempaa lageria voi kuvitella. Hyvä koostumus.

Bottle 0.5l. Pours clear golden yellow with a good white head. Aroma is doughy, grainy, hints of smoke, slightly buttery. Taste is medium sweet, lightly bitter, grainy, touch of smoke, hints of citrus and butter. I like this Helles as it is not one dimensional as so many other beers of that style. The smoke adds some extra flavour.

Might have over-chilled this beer, but it pours pretty clear and taste is mild. Palate feels nice and thick- a little dry- but the first touch on the tongue is pretty tasteless. When it hits the back of your mouth, there's a little malty and smokey taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I didnt read the label but assumed this was just a lager by Aecht, but right off the bat I could smell a subtle sense of smoke and I wondered whether it was just the power of suggestion. Now that I read the description I see its not just in my mind. Sweet with a touch of smoke. Really cool for a helles. Recommended for people who want to just begin to get into smoked beers or even just people who want a good lagerie. one that doesnt suck like most do.
(Backlog) Clear golden in color with a decent white head. Aroma is of smoke, malts, caramel, light herbs. Taste is sweet , malts, and faintly smoakey.

On tap at Track 84 - Warwick, RI. Cooled bread and distant pastrami. Clean, stand up malt snappiness up front, clean and crisp. The smokiness slides in, very gently, and adds rusticity to the brew. This is an interesting interplay between a style that should be crystalline, pale, and shining and adds some dark, heathen, and earthy qualities to it, making a unique juxtaposition that works because both qualities are excellently done and the platform for the base style is well executed.

pale golden colour, huge white head; aroma of smoke, grass and bread; taste of the same - well, it seems that they at Schenkerls cant brew beer without smokey notes :-)
great lager

.5l bottle from Prisma Seppälä
Pours clear golden with medium head. Leaves some lacing. Aroma is malts, grass, grainy and some butter. Flavor is malts, grains, butter and hint of smoke. Hops at the finish. Nice!
From a bottle. Interesting, though not necessarily delicious. Definite but subtle smoked character. Crisp, full flavored. Noticeable hops, but balanced.

Very interesting stuff. A clear, light Helles with fine and firm head. The subtle smoke aroma makes this a unique beer. Much more drinkable drinkable than the Rauchbier. Malty and satisfying finish, considering its relatively low aloohol level.

500ml bottle from S-market Kasarmitori. Pours golden yellow with a white head. Malty aroma with notable smokiness despite no smoked malt on the malt bill; some grassy hops as well. Grainy sweet aroma with some grassy and earthen hops and some smoke. A dry finish with some bitterness.
On cask at Of Love and Regret in Baltimore. Smooth. Pale yellow pour. Somewhat bland. Grass and hay. Nice beer but nothing special.

15/11/2013 Brasserie 4:20 (tap). Dorata, limpida, schiuma bianca mediamente persistente. Al naso sentori di malto rustico, integrale, leggerissimo affumicato, appena percettibile, ottima! In bocca è dolciastra allattacco con leggerissimo affumicato, quasi impercettibile, finale amarognolo, molto buona. Corpo leggero, watery, carbonazione media. Birra freschissima e di squisita fattura.

Draft to taster at Dutchs. Looks good for the style; a transparent gold with foamy white head. Smells doughy and (in the words of Tmoney99) like a basement beer. Tastes like it smells with light smoke. Average on the palate. Not bad, but forgettable.

Sample from bottle at the Vaaland stand at Nærbø Ølfestivalen 2013. Clear golden body with a faint white film. Light malts and wort on the nose. Sweet, smoked and pleasantly bitter. Light to medium bodied leaving the tongue dry.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2014 Bottle: yellow & straw color with a thick chill haze, topped off by a puffy & cloud-like white head that has excellent retention and leaves plenty of chunky lace behind. Aroma is humongous bread, grain, barley, thick yeast, mildly musky hops, and an uplifting dose of sweet, subtle smokiness. Fresh, crisp, clean, unique. Taste follows right along. Bready malts, toasted grains, & sweet smoke, almost like the liquid smoke that you use to barbecue with, though not as "peaty". Subtle, yet integral to the excellence. Finishing citrus zest, grains, & light smoke. One of the most drinkable beers Ive had, and my personal favorite helles lager. A simple, yet great beer.

Bottle from Redstone
Pours a fairly clear medium golden color with a decent sized bubbly white head that slowly dissipates to a ring on top. Rich sweet caramelized pilsner malt dominates the aroma. Rich dried fruit, prunes and raisins come to mind. Non existent hop aroma. Lightly spicy and almost smokey component shows up in the aroma as well. The flavor is rich with lots of caramelized sugary maltiness and plenty of dark dried fruits. There is a hint of herbal hop flavor and a bit of sweet cardboard. Medium body with a fairly dry finish. Moderate level of carbonation and a sweet slick mouthfeel. Love the aroma here, but the flavor suggests this bottle my be less than fresh. One day I will make it over the ocean to try some great lagers the way they were meant to be drunk!

Bottle poured into a tulip glass. Very slightly hazy light gold with a decent white head, medium density. Aroma is malty, sweet breads. On warming, reminds me a little of marzipan and green wood, but its the smoke that really starts to show through. Taste is mostly sweet malt, with some bitterness. Very gentle smoke finish, which is quite moreish.

500ml bottle. An above average Helles lager on account of the subtle smoky bacon flavours that leave a mark on your palate at the finish. Sweet buttery grainy malts dominate the front end. Little hop bitterness. Medium-light body with clean mouthfeel. Clear bright golden pour with small white head.
UPDATED: AUG 1, 2014 Tres bonne lager. Avec un arome et un gout legerment fumé, amère et malté. Bonne pétillance. Du niveau de la brasserie Schlenkerla
Really nice refreshing lager. Thanks to tectactoe on the split. Would really like to have again.

On tap at the Euston Tap. Deep amber gold in colour, nice thin foam of head. The slightest hint of smoke on the nose. This was superbly drinkable, the top end of German soft drinking malty lagers, biscuits and cookies, crisp, refreshing, and with the addition of a hint of smoke. More like malt that has seen a hint of smokiness in there, not the brutal barbeque of the officially smoked Schlenkerla stuff. Really quite pleasant.

The smokiness of this beer is the most prominent while drinking it. It pours with a golden color with no head at all. It has a really good taste to it though and I would drink it again. Overall it has a nice taste and you can really taste the smokiness in the beer.
Bottle from supermarket. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, smoke, grain, hops, grass and salted crackers. Bitter finish with hops, grain and a bit of smoke. Excellent helles.
August 2010. From bottle. Golden color with a white head. Aromas of malt, yeast, grain, light fruit and just a hint of smoke. Good balance and hoppy finish.
shared bottle. aroma is only yeast, malt and a bit of citrus. taste is a bit bitter at the end it gets a bit refreshing. taste almost like a cheap pils. nothing special at all.

Head gone disappointingly quickly. I didnt detect a lot of smoke here, mainly it was biscuity malt with quite a sweet finish - some cookie dough and angel cake with a streak of citrus in the finish. Pleasant and interesting lager.

Goldenrod colored body, medium to large white head, spotty lacing. Lightly smokey-earth lager yeast, grass, biscuit, and some sharper grains. Medium to light bodied with lively carbonation and a crisp refreshing finish.

Clear golden beer, tiny white head which disappears very fast and leaves no lacing.
Smells soapy and  a tiny bit floral, not much else going on in there, the taste is soapy too, also tastes like corn. The "residual smoke character" is nowhere to be found. The mouthfeel is a tad oily.
I was expecting smokiness, but all I got was a soapy beer that tasted like corn. yuck.
Very unique and enjoyable lager/"Dortmunder", nice smoky aroma and nice palate.

500ml bottle, clear golden brown pour with a small head, lively carbonation. Light caramel and toffee malt aroma, with dry, herby, earthy hop. Cant really detect any smoke character. The palate is full for a lager and the finish is well balanced and short. Nice drinkable lager.

0.5l bottle. Clear golden body, white head. Aroma of bread, floral hops and some metallic notes. Taste of bread, honey and floral hops. Im not sure about that, but maybe it has a slight smoke character. Nice one.

The best smoked porter out there. Swear to God its fused with bacon. Bought and drank a bottle at The Craft Beer Outlet, then brought one home, then brought one into work. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts spicy grass and hops flavor malts spicy grass earthy some citrus and bitter hops

0.5 l bottle from Prisma, Jyväskylä. Golden color. Aromas of honeyish malt, herbal hops, some sulfur and tobacco. Slightly sweet honeyish malt taste with restrained earthy and herbal hops, sulfur and hint of smoke. Light bodied. Nice session lager, tasty for its strength.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2016 15.09.2012, 0,5l bottle @ hotel room in Copenhagen:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head, straw colored. Aroma is slightly sweet, light malts, hay, wet grain, weeds, weeds, hints of smoke. Taste mild and slightly sweet, light malts, hay, weeds, paper, metal tank, caramel, hints of smoke. Little bitterness, slightly harsh metallic mouthfeel. Fair enough.

Bottle (500 ml). Clear pale yellow with a small white head and some lacing. Aroma is of cereals, light smoked notes and malt. Taste is slightly sweet with cereals, smoked notes and light malt. Light body. Slightly oily mouthfeel. Moderate carbonation. Smoke isnt overwhelming, but its interesting that this beer is quite smoked despite that no smoked malt has been used (description of the beer says that its only boiled in the same kettle as their smoked beer). Very simple beer, but incredibly drinkable and well balanced. Quite refreshing too! I would drink this on a regular basis.

Clear, yellow lager, and it has a compact firm layer of foam. It has a somewhat smokey aroma known from the other bamberg beers. The smokey part returns in the taste, and it has a pleasant bitter aftertaste.

Helder geel pils, met een dichte, maar stevige kop schuim. In het aroma toch het licht rokerige, waar de andere bamberg bieren bekend om staan. Het rokerige komt ook zeker terug in de smaak, men de nasmaak is aangenaam bitter.
Bottle 50cl @ home. Pours golden with a small white head. Butter, malty aroma. Butter, some smoke in the flavour.

Aecht Schlenkerla Helles is about as good as it gets for a smoked beer. Aroma is smokey with a hint of sour. Pour is amber hazy with a soft white head. Taste is a subtle smoke and just a hint of sour, and well-balanced overall. Aecht Schlenkerla Helles is very sessionable and deliciously drinking. Very well done.

On tap @Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo. Some malty and subtle smoky aromas. Pours light gold, some hazy, with average white head, vanishing, poor lacing. Light body, thin oily texture, soft carbonation. Taste is mild sweet, subtle smoky, some caramel and liquorice flavours. Enjoyable.

Probably best lager in the world so far as i tasted. And also this beer could show lager producers can make a really good beers. Smoked lager is something also butique producers should look for. Amazing beer , all big beerlovers should taste this beer.

0.5 l bottle from brewpub, Bamberg... Clear light golden color, average head... Nice smokey hop aroma... Light and refreshing Helles taste with some smokey bitterness... Short smokey ending... The real Rauchbier is much more intensive...

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2016 Uit fles@ biergilde hoorn. Goudgeel helder bier met fijn wit schuim. Bier heeft in geur tonen van maltbier, hooi en ook tinten van asperges /ammoniak. In de smaak komt rook naar boven, er zit echter geen gerookte mout in verwerkt. mondgevoel is wat waterig.

Big fluffy head dark yellow pour. Aroma of wheat, fresh barley, honey and grapes. Tastes like barley tea with fresh hops. Very fresh flavors. light carb sorta sticky on the palate/medium body. I didnt notice smoke flavors.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2014 Straw yellow to white golden clear beer with lots of white head leaving lacing on the glass and a permanent ring on top of the beer. Aroma has smoke, pale malts, grassy hops and butter. Flavor is dominated by smoke, accompanied by grainy malts, honeyish sweetness and hay. Palate is thinner than medium and medium carbonated. Finish has a medium long bite of bitterness, leaving a malty and grassy aftertaste. Good helles. The smoke is an original twist but at the same time takes away the refreshingness.

Clear golden color with 2 fingers of white head.
Ligth hoppy and smoked in nose. Really smoky(Speck schinken) in mouth with some cereal notes. To the midle of the glass it gets more hoppy and less smoked.
No in the level of the marzen but still good.
Clear golden with a very thin white head that keeps a lace until the end. Aroma is malty and light smoke. Flavor is like the aroma with some swetness. Medium body,  Dry finish. Good!
Pours a crystal clear golden color with a short-lived white head.  Corny pilsenerish nose.  Mouthfeel is medium- to full-bodied and wet.  Corn, honey, and metal flavors.  Not extraordinary.

500ml bottle at ABV.  Pours clear yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is slightly smokey, not nearly as in your face as the Marzen. Taste is clean and malty with a slightly smokey taste. This was pretty drinkable.
500ml bottle, Redmonds. Clear brilliant gold blonde, big rocky white head. Hay straw, biscuit malt nose. Flavour very similar, a fairly heavy dose of toasted malt. Smooth mouth feel, short finish.

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2015 50cl bottle, Maruhn BB 08/2013. Light-bodied, low ABV Helles made for sessioning with an impressive lingering hop (Spalt) spice bitterness, somewhat metallic mouthfeel with some malt residu notes and subtle smoke traces, apparently due to being lagered in the same cellar as Schlenkerlas real smoke beers. Requires hearty Franconian/Bavarian food to be enjoyed thoroughly and make sense. // Rerate several bottles 2015: Who am I kidding, this Lager is smooth, world class, oozing with local character masked as modesty and with 4,3% as sessionable as beers can get.

500ml bottle at Porterhouse Cork. Pours a lively straw yellow with a thick white and lasting foam. Aroma is straw, hops, with a light oaky woody character. Very lightly balanced sweetness  is followed by a little bit of a hop bite and a nice light smokiness at the end. Lively and light-bodied, the whole beer is just slightly rough at the end with the smoked elements. Overall, quite a delicately balanced lager, and very enjoyable drinking.

Half-liter bottle poured into a snifter. Gift from my Irish principal who last lived in Germany (go figure). Pours a bold, clear gold hue with a thin, quickly vanishing white head. Nose of pear and white wine. This is a surprisingly bold, woody, almost meaty flavor with a crisp, spicy bite. The only hop remnants is from the tingly sensation at the end of each sip. This is a new taste for me, but I actually like it for a change.

50 cl bottle at home. Golden liquid with a small white head. The aroma has smoked plums and tar sauna. The flavor is sweet and lovely smoked - giving it hints of tar sauna, combined with strong notes of wood. Specially good lager type brew for summer.
50cl bottle. Aroma is metallic almost pepperminty. Taste is balanced with hint of smoke. Very good beer when you are thirsty.
Bottle at home. Clear golden color, white head. Aroma is malts, some smoke, rye bread. Malty body, hops, fresh. Easy going lager.
Draught. Rich yellow color with off white spobgy head, doughy aroma, slightly bitter taste, fizzy, long finish. Fine lager
Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Golden coloured with smoked malt and toffee flavours, fruity sweetness followed by more smoke on the finish.

Strong peppery spicy little bit of skunky aroma. Smoky flavors finish and linger in the aftertaste. Very interesting. Dont dislike at all but then again could only drink so much. Makes you want to eat food.

Bottle from Zly Casy, Prague. Clear pale golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Grassy hop aroma, citrus, floral notes, some bread. Hoppy bitter flavor, bready, citrus, spicy notes, some hay, some red apples.
Bottle. Golden colour with big white head. Malt and sugar aroma. Malty and watery taste, slightly bitter.
Lots of body for a helles. Clear blond color. Average body. Fresh hop aroma and taste.

Pours crystal clear pale yellow with a small white head.  The nose is by far the weakest smelling as far as their line of smoke goes but that said it still has a very pleasant smoked meat and cheese element, a higher degree of fruity smells and some light grass or straw.  The flavor is pure elegance as far as a lager goes.  So crisp up front but mellows out into a nice smooth soft finish that is long as hell.  The body is light.  Very tasty, very refreshing.
Bottle. Pours clear light golden with decent white head. Aroma is malt, grass, hint of bananas. Flavor is malty, slightly hoppy, with a hint of smoke.

Bottle. Bright yellow gold with a slim, fine foam. Lemony, herbal nose with pollen, mown grass and honey. Lean, raspy bitterness backed with breadstick and honey malt; fresh grassy hop, green herb, slight sausage. That serious malty German backdrop holding it all together. Lingers like vanilla. Top lager.

500ml bottle in a lager glass.  Pours golden with a lacy, white head.  Aroma of pale malts and light hops.  Flavor the same with some toasted notes, hints of smokiness, and dough.  Average to light texture.  Not a bad beer for the style.

Flasche mit McTapps verköstigt. Keine Nase, simpler Geschmack, aber im Aroma und Abgang perversestens mit einem Raucharoma versehen. Aus dem selben Bottich wie deren Rauchbier, somit merkt man, wie man ein Lager ekelhaft in den Abgang brauen kann. Leider schäbig.

Light golen colour with steady head and medium body. Nose of malt. Taste of malt, citrus fruits, grass, white bread and bitter hops. Very bitter finish, some slight -unwelcome- smoked hints are tasteable in the finish. It is okay-like but just no burner.

50 cl bottle from Centra Høvik. Pours clear golden with a small quickly dissapearing head. Some smoke notes in the aroma otherwise nothing. low bitterness and sourness. Light body, oliy texture, soft carbonation, short bitter finish.

Purchased at Whole Foods Market NYC 2009. Poured into a Pilsner glass - golden yellow. Nice solid head which dissipates rather quickly. Good lacing and lasting carbonation. Have to agree with previous reviewers in the doughy odor to it. Heavy malt taste initially, mouth-feel is unremarkable. Finishes with a smoked flavor, slightly bitter, not bad. A fairly drinkable beer, would probably make an excellent accompanying beer for brats or smoked sausages. MUST ENJOY SMOKY FLAVOR

0,5 l bottle BB  Feb  13   from Liebick  Getränke 
smoke, caramel, roasty, cereal, bread, spruce, herbs, golden, clear, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Bottle 50 cl. Pours yellow like any other lager with an nice smokey scent. First taste is slightly weird but gets better after the tasting more. Taste is interesting with first smokey taste which turns to a buttery , hay  smooth aftertaste. Really easy to drink.

Bottle. Clear yellow with a pure white head. Aroma of bready pils malt, dough and very faint smoke. Flavor is bread dough, clean lager yeast and some light smoke in the finish. Medium to light body with a smooth feel. Really nice beer, the touch of smoke adds some complexity.
Bottle. Pours clear light golden with airy white head. Clear hoppy aroma with a subtle citrus note. Intensely malty flavour with sourish and bitter hoppy notes. A decent helles.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden color with almost no head on it. There is just a hint of smokiness to both the nose and the taste, which manages to be present without dominating the beer. Very light and easy to drink.

I was just complaining that I hadnt had a good lager in a while, here it is. Lager with smokey flavor. Delish. Like a lot of smokey (for a lager) which explains the editors note. Its not residual, its up front and helps round out the beer

Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma of malts, straw, smoke, light green banana. Quite sweet malty flavour, subtle smokiness. Quite full body (for a Helles), light sweet smoky finish.
Nice! The residual smokiness gives quite a bit of depth to this beer. Without adding smoked malts, I guess it is pretty difficult to keep the flavour profile constant though.
(From 50cL bottle @ home)

Bottle at JFs 05/01/13.
Clear pale golden with a very thin white head that clears to the edge and also retains as a thin film.
Nose is pale malt, caramel, light smoke.
Taste comprises pale malt, toffee, sweetish sugars, barley, light wood, touch of smoke.
Medium bodied, light spritzy carbonation, dry finish.
Ok - Rausch Light.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
#55
Wow, ein Lager-Bier mit leckeren Rauchnoten, ein Charakter unter den Bieren! Islay-Whisky-Fans werden diesen Nektar liebevoll schlürfen, denn der Rauch läßt auch andere Geschmackskomponenten zu. Malzig-getreidige Süße und im Abgang die Erinnerung an rauchigem Torffeuer!
	
Test vom 5.11.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 12,15,13,15,9,12 - 12,90
0,5 l bottle from local supermarket. Pours clear golden with a low head. Aroma is mostly malts with a hint of smoke. Flavor is pretty much the same. Decent if a bit disappointing.

The beer is crystal clear and pale yellow hued with a small, but lasting, white head that leaves sparse lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is classic Aecht Schlenkerla campfire, albeit a more subtle scent than in other beers from this brewery. In addition to the smokey notes is a pleasant German lager scent.

The beer is light and smooth, with a balance of smoke and German lager flavors. Exactly what I would expect from this brewery.

I could easily drink a liter or more of this. Refreshing and flavorful. Well done.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-28-2012
Surprisingly good lager. Nothing that stands out but very pure error free lager.
231212. Bottle at home. Pours clear light golden with a small head. Aroma butter. Light bodied. Quite the typical helles.

Botella, color palido muy claro con espuma blanca de buena formacion y persistente. Aroma levaduras, algo de ahumado y notas ligeras de malta, en boca igual que en aroma, no es para tirar cohetes pero cumple su funcion
0.5 l bottle from supermarket. Nice head, light colour with some bubbles. Great malty taste with some hoppiness. Not too dry though.

500 ml bottle. Clear pale golden yellow, thin white head. Aroma of sweetish malt, grassy hops and the familiar smoked ham. The flavour is malty, with smoky and buttery notes and mild grassy hoppiness. OK.

Golden, slightly hazy body with spare head. Bubblegum, banana and grass aroma. Earthy, leather, soapy taste, chalky dry and metallic finish. Hard to drink, a bit sour and too dry. Not a refreshing experience!
Draft. Nose is smoke, campfire, smoked meats. Taste is smoked meats, fresh bread. Crisp lager.

See through yellow lager with a big but brief white head. Malty sweet aroma. Pretty easy to drink. Mildly bitter hops. Moderate carbonation. I thought this would have a little bit more smoke taste in it but it was just my prejudice. Not bad but not that special either. Refreshing like a good lager is.

50cl bottle shared with Dutchdrebus. Clear a bit pale golden color, medium sized fairly quickly disappearing white head. Smell malts, crisp, lightly hay. Taste malts, hay, lightly bitter and fresh. Low to medium body, low to medium carbonation. Nice solid fresh easy to drink helles. One of the best Ive ever had I think.
Bottle @ home thx to benzai. Pale yellow colour with a very small head. Smells lemon, malts, toiletblock. Tastes malty, grainy, iron, slightly hay and barnyard. Thin body, soft carbo.
2012 - 11 - 17 500ml bottle. light yellow golden colour. medium, white head.  hay in aroma. light bitter taste.

500ml bottle from K-Supermarket Kamppi

Pours clear golden with a small foamy head. Aroma of bready malts, hints of grass and smoked ham. Taste is bready and malty with mild smoky notes and hints of grassy hops. Finish is malty and slightly bitter. Okay lager with some mild smoked notes.

Finger of head. Clear, medium straw colored body.
Smells like bread, grain and smoke in that order.
Nice sweet taste, mild bitterness. Smoke in the background throughout. A really nice balance of flavors.
Crisp and light body, moderate carbonation. Short finish.
Enjoyable. A lager with some gentle smoke to it.
There it is again: that schlenkerla grillimakkara sausage flavour. Theres a nice smokiness.

Bottle. Light golden, small to average and fully diminishing head. Light to moderate malty  lightly grainy and sweetish aroma, bread and diacetyl. Body is light to medium, malty- lightly grainy and sweetish flavor, some bread and diacetyl. Finish is average, malty  lightly grainy and lightly sweetish, light bread and some diacetyl. Sweetish helles/lager. If you want to look cool and drink Schlenkerla but do not like the smokiness  this one is for you. Afraid of the smoke, Lagerboy?
Pale golden with white head. Aroma of smoke, diacetyl, malt and toast. Flavour is toast, malt, diacetyl, smoke and a little bit sweet.
Bottle from Ass-market, Kemi. A good quality, pure german lagerbier with some famous Schlenkerlas smoke in both aroma and taste. Soft and smooth, simple and enjoyable.

Bottle:
Medium vast white head, changes slowly into a thin but closed lacing on top of a clear yellow colored beer.
Smell ginger, smokey hay, honey, hint of soap, tea herbs, smokey forest tones and a hint of something like dogfood.
Taste smoked honey, hay, malts, light soapy, light bitter, herbs, smoked malts, smoke and fish.
Aftertaste of smokey malts, light hoppy with some fishy, light bitter and herby tones.
Low carbo, soft creamy mouthfeel, low to medium body and a creamy texture.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle 50 cl. Poured clear pale golden in color with a small fluffy off-white head. Hay, straw, butter and light hoppy notes in aroma. Hay and light grassy hops in taste. Leaves a nice lacing on the glass. Tasty helles with a slightly bitter finish, also some light sweetness and faint hints of smoke or wood in finish..

50cl bottle. Golden color with a small white head. Malty aroma with notes of hops and smoke. Flavor is malt, some grains, grassy hops, slightly smoky and bitter. Medium body, some bitterness in the aftertaste. Good, balanced lager.
Smell of smoke and malts. Golden colour, small white head. Sugary, smoky and fruity aroma. Medium sweetness, lively carbonation.

Location/Date:Bottle on October 27th, 2012.
Appearance: Pours a clear gold. 
Aroma: Aroma is nice amount of smoke, not overbearing.
Taste: Light smoke, very light bitterness, bready malt.
Palate:Light body, light aftertaste.
Summary: My fifth rating of Brauerei Heller. I enjoyed this one, but not as much as the other versions they make. Might be a good first beer from them if nervous about smokey aroma/flavor as its quite light.  Just had to try this one, hope to finish out the brewery at some point.

Aroma has hay, grass..countryside aroma.golden, clear, frothy head medium long.  lightly bitter, dry, light to medium body, thin feel, soft carbonation, dry finish medium long. Ok lager but nothing special, expected much more.
Lahev (pivo-expres.cz)  - Skoro bez pěny, chuť po klasickym leáku a po uzeninách(hodně podobné nakuřovanému), příjemné, osvěující pivo !

Bottle from Makro C&C, Thessaloniki. Pours golden colour with medim white head. Aroma of hops. Lightly smoked taste. Light body, average carbonation, medium bitter aftertaste. Overall, a refreshing beer, good for its style but nothing very special.
Aroma is hops and smoke. Pours clear yellow with medium white head. Tastes medium sour and smoke with light bitter finish. Body is thin and texture is oily. Overall, its a nice lager.

Bottle. Yellow, clear w/nice white head. Nose has lager qualities, some grassy hops, a bit of smoke. Body is medium light. Some grassy, gingerly soapy notes. Nice and smooth. A tad of smoke, not as much as expected. The slight ginger is confusing. Nice tasty lager nonetheless.-- bb/h

Bottle. Golden color, frothy white head. Hints of butter and lemon in the aroma. Clean, well-balanced flavor with a wisp of smoke and a fairly dry finish. Medium body, medium carbonation. Very nice and would be quite sessionable as well.
Bottle 0.5l from local market. Nice golden colour. Aroma and taste is malts, grain and some hops. Fresh and clear lager.

Bottled. Clear, light golden colour, thin lacy head. Malty aroma is mostly grainy with dry husks, delicate smokiness and a hint of grassy hops. Malty, round flavor is medium dry and somewhat bready. Medium body (full for the low alcohol-%), very soft and mellow. Very good balance. Great lager.

A yellow beer with a medium and white head. Aroma is rich and malty, slightly smoked, grassy hops, but that is mild. Taste is smooth and malty, mild bitterness, smooth and pure taste, just hint of smoke in the aftertaste. Medium- bodied, malty and slippery to drink. Nicely, hint of smoke in the aroma, overally pure beer that believes in the strenght of malts, smooth and nice lager.

Bottle. Slightly orangey, dark yellow with a small white head, a blanket of white bubbles really. Aroma is mild, very grainy, light lemon and grass. Taste is grainy, seedy, refreshing, dry, light malt. Palate is light, refreshing, stingy, very carbonated, not watery.

Tap. Pours clear golden yellow with thin, creamy white head; short retention and spare lacing. Aroma is smoke, toast and straw malts, banana, light fruit, some spice, candy sugar, and faint floral hops. Flavor is sweet, cereal malt up front, some light fruit esters, and a candy sugar finish; subtle smoke throughout ending dry. Light body and low carbonation.
180712: Light different German sweet hoppy lager. Lightly smoked and dry finish (because it is fermented in the same vessel as Schlenkerla rauchbier)
500 ml. bottle.  Pours a clear pale gold with an average white head.  Aroma of malt, grain, florals, and some smoke.  Taste is the same.  Enjoyed this very much.
Bottle from grocery store. Pours a typical golden light lager-style colour.  Aroma nothing special, but has a surprisingly pleasant smoky flavor to it. Overall a very good lager indeed.
Clear golden color, small white head, light bitter taste. Enjoyed it in a hot greek summer. Really liked it!

Pours a deep straw color with a couple fingers of fizzy foam that settles out quickly. Aromas are clean malts, touches of crisp hops and a lovely subtle smokey woody notes. ON the palate its direct and well balanced... great bready crisp pilsner style malts touched with a kiss of bitter hops and earthy smoke.

Sampled bottle at GBF 2012.
Pale golden.
Grass, bread, smoke and salami, quite thin.
Medium-bodied.
Wouldnt mind trying it again for a fairer rating, but as it stands now its a bit underwhelming compared to the other beers from this fine brewery.

Gyldne Hest, Horsens, DK.
Bottled, 240812.
Golden with white head. Aroma of malt. Flavour with no smoke character.

Bottle - average sixe foamy head, light straw color, sweet malt with surprising mild smokiness aroma and flavor, mild hops - the smoke notes are interesting, and after reading the description above, I understand why now - pretty good and different
Pours yellow with white head.  Smells of smoke and cereal.  Bit of spicy bitterness, but mostly sweet, malty, smokey cereal.  Clean finish.

500ml bottle pours a clear golden color with a small white head and good lacing.  Smells of floral hops, grainy malts, and smoked sausage.  Aroma is pretty much the same, but with hints of banana, cloves, and straw.  The smokiness comes out in the afteraste.  Medium body with average carbonation.  If this is a lager, it is my all time favorite! Very good for a Rauchbier or a Helles, too.  Another good one which will bring me back to this brewery again to get fully schlenkered.

16.9oz bottle. Thin white head, that fades a bit, to mostly minimal. Perfectly clear golden color. Awesome satisfying smoked aroma, typical of schlenkerla. Good, smooth lighter carbonation, dry finish. Really nice, smokey savory flavor. A smokey lager is an awesome lager.

Bottle 50cl, a clear copper beer with low head. Nose is on honey and caramel. Aroma is medium sweet, crisp with medium smoked notes, typical lager touch on nuts, high carbonation. Finish is on honey and grassy hops, medium bitterness but with long duration.
Pours golden with a thick, off-white head. Aroma of pale malts with a little bit of nuts, plus light hops. Flavor the same.

500 ml bottle from Country Club Liquors. Nose is grassy with bits of banana, caramel, char, and cloves. Lightly hazy yellow with a medium pale yellow head. Flavor is peppery, lightly bitter with a hint of banana.

Beautiful clear gold pour with a half inch or so fizzly white head. Slightly smokey aroma, with sweet malts and a dash of earthy noble hops. Taste is on the sweet side, lots of cereal malt flavor. Light oaky smokiness to it with tends to come out in the aftertaste. Nice floral hop flavor helps to offset some of the usual sweetness and dry breadiness. Body is light and slick, perfect for throwing back all day. Excellent beer. One of the best Helles out there.
Bottle @ DØE meeting. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, straw, grass. Flavor is malt, grassy and flowery hops, light smoke. Medium body, soft carbonation. Nice brew. 180712

Pours a golden beer with a nice white head that disappears quite fast. The aroma is of bread with a hint of smoked malt and a grassy hop tone. The beer is very light-bodied (altough this not an issue, but a virtue here). The taste is again of bready-malt with a smoked aftertaste and a pleasent, well-balanced hop bitterness. Wonderfully brewed session beer.

Bottle. Pours golden with a small white head. Notes of smoked sausage and herbal hops in aroma. Taste has got a clean bready maltiness a moderate metallic bitterness and a slightly smoked aftertaste. Overall: Clean, well made, atough anonymous helles.
(Bottle 18/7-2012) Low white head, clear yellow color, slightly flower aroma, light smoked taste. BB date 09.2012.

Bottle.  Woody smoke and light fruity malt aroma. Clear gold with a small white head. Smoky malt flavor. Lighter than some of the other Schlenkerla smoke brews Ive tried, but excellent none the less. Smoked are my favorites, but sometimes its nice to have a lighter easy drinking version when Im out on the porch in the evening at the end of a hot day.

From the bottle.  Aroma is light sweet malt, slight roast, and perhaps subtle smoke in the finish but it may just be the power of suggestion.  Taste is clean and crisp with light caramel sweetness, a small amount of bitterness, and residual hops.  Nice, easy drinker.
Draft at Smoke and Barrel. Slightly hazy zinc colored pour, small head. Nose holds awesome beechwood smoke, with a lovely creamy palate. Could drink gallons.
Soft bamberg nose. LOTS of carbonation. Smooth body. Some bready malt, straw and soft smoke. Well put together. Fresh would probably be 4+ as I imagine it would project really well.

I tried this brewerys famous "smoke" ale, so I came back for more.  This is a very solid beer--especially for summer, for it is refreshing, light, and will not put you on your ass in terms of alc %  Nothing exceptional, just a typically nice, crisp lager from Germany.

Half litre bottle, golden colour, clear, large head which soon disappeared. Smelled apples, Saaz hops andd a hint of smoke. Tasted apples and a hint of smoke, had the spicy sweetness of Oktoberfest style beers. Smooth texture, medium body, light carbonation. Overall very refreshing, the smoke was understated but really gave the beer some depth with you would not expect fron its strength.

Tasted this alongside other rauchbiers at awork sponsored bierprobe. Although it is a helles, the smokiness kown by Schlenkerla was present. A very unique helles, and not out of place if tasting rauchs....

Thanks to tderoeck for sharing. Pours a nice crystal clear pale gold. Smells of straw, a little bit of cigar, spicy hops, and smoke. Tastes bready, yeasty, with some noticeable smokiness, an odd taste of butter, and ending with nice bitter hops. Crisp on the palate, making for a solid session beer.

23/VI/2012 - 50cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: I/13 (2012-643) 
Clear light orange beer, small creamy white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: grains, malts, little smoky, grassy hops, some citrus. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: lots of grains, malts, barnyard, some smoke, citrus, nice bitter hops. Aftertaste: smoky, refreshing hops, nice bitterness, grains. Good lager!

500 ml bottle.  Served in a pilsener glass, the beer pours a clear straw gold color with about a half inch off-white head.  Head retention and lacing are both decent enough.  The brew smells like grain/bready malt, apples, bananas, smoke, pears, and a bit of herbs.  The taste is just like the aroma from what I can tell, I dont notice anything different between them.  Mouthfeel/body is light/medium, its a bit slick and smooth and easy enough to drink.  I think its a good overall beer, although I do prefer their smoked brews.  But Id buy this one again, I liked it.

The head is ok, the body light. It smells a bit smoky. The taste is intensive malty, smoky. Overall smoky, nice taste and also light and sweet so easy to drink. Fantastic balanced Beer! 11/13/12/11/12/12

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2013 Pours a perfectly clear light straw yellow with a nearly white head of loose bubbles.  Smells of fresh cut hay and alfalfa slightly toasted over a late summer campfire.   Tastes smooth and sweet with only a tinge of bitterness.  Definitely light on the palate.  A great representative of  Helles.
From the bottle poured pale yellow brew with a thin white head that disappeared rapidly. Faint aromas and flavors of smoke, malt and hops. Medium bodied and not to my liking.

Draught at the Bullfrog, Mnpls. Smoke not evident in the nose. Smells more stone smoked or just stoney. Slightly hazy pale gold. Thin whispy white head. Smoke very evident in the flavor and helps "make" this beer. Not over the top smokey. Also good. Beautiful lace.
Small tasting...light golden pour with minimal head.  Smokiness in the nose is present and translates to a fairly smoky taste.  Lighter lager flavor past the smoke.  Overall, not too bad.

Straw golden pour with almost no head. Sweet aroma with a nice malt profile standard for the style. The taste had an amazing subtle smokiness to complement the honey sweetness of the beer all blended well with the grain. It is amazing how they make the smoky taste without smoking the malt. Easily the most crisp, light, and refreshing "smoked" beers Ive ever had. Delightful surprise for the summer.

A deep golden straw color. A frothy tall foamy white head is produced on the pour that bright white.
Small bubbles dominate the well carbonated brew.

Aroma smells of malts but is dominated by the rich smokiness of this beer.

Well balanced in taste not to much malts not too much hops and not to much smoke. Malts are light and pale, perfect for carrying the rich smokiness from the beechwood, Hops typically and true to this case are light and simple, simply here to add some balance.

Mouthfeel is thin and I notice a touch of graininess.

Overall, a good beer not to heavy in smokiness so its perfect for some looking to try his/her first smoke beer.

16.9 oz. bottle- Pours clear golden with a nice white head. The aroma is floral, crisp clean hops, basic beer. The taste is the same, smooth, creamy, floral, not really getting any smoke here unfortunately, but this is nice tasting. Body is medium, carbonation is medium, mouthfeel is creamy. This is one of the easiest drinking beers I have had in a while, I could easily drink this all night.

Unique and tasty. The beer smells of grain with just a touch of smoke. The color is a clear golden, but without much head at all. The taste is sweet with a light and tasty smokiness and subtle notes of fruit in the background. The beer is crisp and clean with a quick finish leaving just a light smoke in the mouth.
A really unique beer. Subtle clean Helles with a lovely gentle waft of smoked goodness - a nice touch. Very drinkable UCSC Tasting June 12

Pours a pretty medium yellow with soft white head that falls to a skim fairly quickly. Aroma is light smoke, malt and grass. Taste is a nice mix of the smoke and malt with a touch of sour mash and dry crispness. Mouthfeel is delicate and very nice. Active carb but finely structured with light plus body. Overall a beer that should be part of the rotation.
(bottle) medium gold with quickly fading white head; light malt and straw aroma. Flavor is medium bodied malt, some hints of smoke.

Pours slightly cloudy golden straw color with dense white head. Aromas  herbal spiciness, floral, and a light metallic off note.  Taste of pear, pepper, apricot, apple, cracker, toasted grain, and herbal spiciness with smoky sensation througohut.  Fairly dry on the finish. Very nice and well balanced flavors. Medium carbonation and light-medium bodied; with a slightly creamy and very smooth mouthfeel.
Flat looking with no head.  A slight cordial flavour and some sparkling notes.  I think i can taste slight smokiness and bacon.  Watery.

500 ml bottle into pilsener glass, no bottle dating.  Pours slightly cloudy golden straw color with a nice 2 finger dense white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a thick cap that lingers.  Some nice lacing on the glass, with plenty of carbonation streaming up retaining a dense head.  Aromas of big pepper, bread, light smoke, apple, pear, herbal spiciness, floral, and a light metallic off note.  Some pretty nice and balanced aromas with decent strength.  Taste of pear, pepper, apricot, apple, grass, biscuit, floral, cracker, toasted grain, and herbal spiciness.  Fairly dry on the finish; with some lingering notes of pear, apricot, grass, toasted grain, earth, and herbal spiciness on the finish for a short bit.  Very nice and well balanced flavors.  Medium carbonation and light-medium bodied; with a slightly creamy and very smooth mouthfeel.  Alcohol presence is essentially non existent as expected of 4.3%.  Overall this is a really nice, smooth, and balanced Munich Helles lager.  It probably wasnt very fresh, but it was still very enjoyable.

Bottle. Nose is malty, straw and hay, with a minor smoke background note. Cloudy yellow, light head. Very balanced with sweet malt notes up front and smoke in the finish, lingering. Beautiful rauch, very subdued compared to other Schlenkerla offerings. The lighter smokiness really lets the rest of a well-brewed beer shine.

500ml bottle from knightly spirits. FL VC #9. slightly hazed golden, small, dissapating white head. lovely clean helles with smokey edges. one of the best lagers ive ever had. id session this all day long if i could. highly reccomended.

Bottle (not sure why I havent rated this before). Pours with a crystal clear golden hued body with a medium sized white head that lasts and leaves some pretty respectable lace. Aromas are bready, lightly toasty, malty, grassy, medium malty sweetness. Faintest hint of DMS. Light and refined smoke (like a shirt the day after BBQing-using a smoker not a grill). Very light noble/herbal hop character. This is a smoke character in a beer that I appreciate. Clean yeast wise. Flavors are lightly bacony, refined smoked meat aroma. Some bready malt character. Perhaps a touch thin/watery. Nice malt presence, bready, biscuity, pils. Very low hop character. Clean yeast, pretty crisp. A very easy to drink smoked beer, which is often not the case. Lively bubbles, medium thin. Quite a nice beer without being too smokey; quite enjoyable.

Always worth buying again.

Aroma of starchy malts and a very distinct smoke background. Persistent two finger head and explosive carbonation. This is listed as the best German helles on RB, but I really feel this is a smoked lager, light as it may be. The smoke may be an addition as opposed to the smoked malts used in the brewers other beers, but it remains the dominant element. Its is heavy on the palate and somewhat drying. Trying out the shallow end of Hellers pool, and looking forward to going out deeper.

Interesting combo of noble hop and a slight sulfury smokiness on the aroma.  Truly bright yello beer with a very slightly greenish hue.  Tall foamy white head.  Flavor is very clean biscuit with the sulfur/smoky note repeated.  Dry finish.

Bottle picked up at Beertopia Omaha, opened in Exira, Iowa. Pours a clear, golden appearance with a bubbly white head. Sweet grainy, husky, pale malty, rich straw aroma. Crisp, light pale malty, straw, hay flavor with a bit of woody smokiness in the background. Refreshing and easy drinking. Fuck, I could drink five maß of this and not even realize it. Excellent brew.

16.9 oz bottle. Smells faintly smoky, faintly grainy, bready. Pours clear straw with a quickly disappearing white head; it collapses into a collar of big-bubbly foam. Taste is lightly sweet with no bitterness. The smokiness comes through surprisingly strong in the flavor for a beer not "intended as a smoke beer." Carbonation is medium and the body is thin. Best Helles Ive ever had.

Pale straw color. Small white head and a little bit of lacing. Faint malty aroma. Not much else. Taste is malty with a soft hop bitterness. A tiny bit of smoke in the back. Not much, just like a piece of ham touched my lips.  It is very faint, but there. Not a bad beer.
Amber pour with a persistent thin white head. Biscuit aroma with very faint hops. Crisp lager taste with a whiff of smoke. Lingering dry finish. Delicious.

Pours a dark golden color with a small creamy head with ample lacing.  Aroma
is of a light rauchbier.  It has a tangy citrus quality with a definite smoked overtone.  I was quite surprised at how much smoky character this maintained when it was not billed as a smoked beer nor created with smoked ingredients...quite a testament to smoky residual of their other excellent beers.

Sampled from a 16.9 oz brown bottle this beer poured a yellow-golden color with a huge soapy white head that lingered and left decent lacing. The aroma was faint hickory and bread with a tangy lager undertone. The flavor was tangy lager with faint bread and hickory smoke. Medium finish with lingering smoke. Light to medium body. Ok.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Perfect orange pour with a small fluffy white head. loads of lacing and head retention. The mildest hint of smoke on the nose. Light citrus and earthy hops are prominant. Much smokier in the taste than anticipated, especially considering the beer isnt smoked. Quite herbal tasting with toasted grains and grass that cuts through the middle. Rather nice and easy going. Palate ruins it a little for me. Very watery with low carbonation or length. Solid beer all up

Bottle 500ml from Parkhill cellars. Very subtle and tasty lager. Aromas of citrus, wet leaves, and hints of smoke. Taste is sweet, with light bitterness, and average length. Palate is oily, and medium bodied. Yellow, with a disappearing head.

One I missed last time I was in Bamberg. Happy to see it here in Oz, a perfect choice on a hot Summers day.Lively pour, quite effervescent.  Sparkling medium gold with a fine bead that raises a satiny pillow of white. The heads well retained, adds to the mouthfeel and leaves a lovely web of lace. Bad boy, bold, gritty and very raw aroma of toasted malts on the nose with a low hint of smoked meats and earthy noble hops. There is also a low vinous quality to it that comes out after a few harder sniffs. Soft, creamy mouthfeel, frothy and full. A raspy, sharp and herbal hop note dominates some ample toasted grains and barnyard notes. Very clean, very crisp, the finish has just a touch of the smoked character of its bigger brothers mixed with bright hops and supple citric notes. Shows nice balance, the flavour builds as it warms and it just gets better and better, a touch of peat emerges late. I could slam this back in bulk and still be savouring each ensuing sip. A delicious Helles. (50cL, BBE 10/12, Mane Liquor, Belmont)

Clear gold, thin white head. Aroma of fruit-apple, pear, some grainy/grassy malt, nutty, light burnt malt. Taste has more smoke apparent, even though the beer is apparently not smoked, lots of nutty grain and fruit. Nice crisp texture, medium body
Bottle from Meny at Grønland, Oslo. Slightly hazy golden body with a white head. Light smoked nose with some sweet malt. Moderate sweet malt flavour with light smoked notes.
Golden color with a minimal white head. Grassy aroma, slightly malty. Just a little hint of smoked bacon. Medium carbonation, a bit watery.
Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and light smoky bacon. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Dry and light bitter finish. 090212
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are sweet malt, grass, subtle bacon, sausage and hops.
Bottle. Clear golden with medium off-white head. Aroma is malt, little smoke and a little grainy. Flavour is malt, little smoke, little meat, little sweet, little grainy and a little bitter.

Bottle enjoyed at home
Golden, white head. Smells of dust, grass, malts and tiny hints of smoke. Nice malty flavor, good sweetness. Dry on the palate as a german lager should be and a nice grassy hoppy finish

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2014 basement aromas, herbs, spruce, bread, toast, nuts, earthy, cooked vegetables, clove, licorice, golden, cloudy, white foam, rocky head, light sweetness, very bitter, lightly sour, sticky, full body, average carbonation,

Bottle from Bottleworks. Hazy orange, well, diaphanous appearance, with a hazy orange color. Wispy head.Aroma is nice and woody. Sublte smoke, with a honey aroma, and touches of caramel malt. Fucking amazingly nuanced, and lovely to smell. Initial flavor is smoke, wood, and light honey. Caramel dips in and out. Nice lingering light bitterness, with that wood and smoke carrying on. I can really taste both the wood and smoke in this one. One of the best beers in all of the mother fucking universe. I say that, and I have yet to venture into other galaxies where the production and consumption of beer may or may not exist.

Mini keg courtesy of TheCheeseman. Pours yellow and clear with a nice white head floating on top. The aroma hints at more smoke than is actually there, light, doughy, and some citrus. Easy to drink and easy to love, with a nice amount of crisp bitterness for the style and light smoke.
Bottle from Meny Grønland. Pours slightly hazy golden with a big white head. Sweet, malty and somewhat fruity without much bitterness. Just a hint of smoke. Slightly bitter finish.
500ml bottle.  Pours light gold with a medium, frothy head.  Aroma is smoked lemon and grass.  Taste has lemon to start, light smoked finish with a soapy smoked finish.

Tükrös, világosabb aranyszínben mutatkozó főzet, közepes, finom pórusú fehér habbal a tetején, amely vékonyan megmarad.
Illata édeskés.
Kóstolása enyhe csípősséggel indul és kekszre emlékeztető, malátás aromáját enyhén kovászos és citrusos jegyek kísérik, a komló csupán sejthető.
Az olajos testességű, könnyen csúszó ser közepesen száraz befejezése viszonylag rövid és szintén inkább édeskés, némi füves komlóval, frissítő citrusokkal és füstös hatásokkal kiegészítve.
Jó, kellemes-fajta sörital, amely azt hozta, amit elvártam tőle.

Sörspecialista, Budapest. Tiszta, áttetsző világos arany színe van, habja csak közepes méretű és igen hamar le is apad. Illata malátás, "házi sörösen" élesztős, valamint füvesen és fűszeresen komlós. A malátás alap mellett ízében is kiemelkedő szerepe van az élesztőnek, mellette akác és az illatából ismerős komló érződik. Utóíze malátás, tejes és élesztős. Könnyű teste van, közepesen szénsavas és száraz. Szerintem ez azok közül a kontinentális főzetek közül való, amely inkább csak a turisták számára érdekes (gondolok itt főként az angolszászokra), különben nagyon hasonló pl. a táborfalvai HBH-hoz, talán az még jobb is.
Pours a straw color with a puffy off Greyish colored head. Notes of ammonia, grass, smoke, and honey. Astringent finish. Nope.

50 cl bottle @ home, BBE 01/2012
Aroma is slightly stale with grain and butter. Flavour has grassy hops, some grain, hints of smoke and gooseberry bush in the dryish finish. The hops actually disturb a bit, maybe this hop variety is just not for me. A helles with extra hops.

500 ml bottle.
Pours a golden colour without a head. Large visible bubbles. Aroma of grainy malts, grass with some weak smoke notes. Flavour of rich grainy malts, grassy bitter hops, citrus with some light honey-like sweetness. Medium bodied, thick mouthfeel and a bitter, malty, grainy finish. One bitter Helles, good.

50 cl bottle. BBE 01/2012.
Pours clear pale golden colour with small head. Aroma of clove, grass, mild hoppy and lemony fruits, herbs and light malts. Flavour of butter, grain, light malts, lemon, dry hay and some herbal notes. Crisp palate with a bitter finish.
3414

My bottle was on sale, so perhaps thats a sign that it wasnt at its best. Aroma is vaguely skunked - not smoky, but now I see that it isnt really supposed to be. Nice looker: clear straw, good head. Subtle smokiness? Perhaps, but otherwise a mediocre helles. A bit grassy.

500ml Bottle.  Appearance is darkish-orange color with medium, off-white head.  Aroma is grainy, malty, with some citrus.  Taste is similar with dough, grainy malts, general sweetness with some lemongrass.  Very little bitterness.  Palate is medium-bodied, slick texture, average carbonation, and a short, sweet finish.

16.9 oz bottle.  Clear straw with a puffy white head.  Nose is dough, light lemon and a touch of toffee.  Medium light but plenty substantial for a lager.  Carb is bright but soft.  Taste is grass, honey, white pepper, clover and citrus pith.  Clean, very drinkable, but perhaps a bit bland.

Bottle...  Poured clear, pale golden with a white head. I had this in the past and remember it having more residual smoke flavors then now. This time it was very faint with mostly a cracker malt graininess and sweetness coming though. Some floral hops, and a clean lager yeast character. A little bit of light fruits, toasted grains. As the glass warmed some charred smoke-like flavors came through.

(bottle) Pale golden color, clear, with a small for my head. Medium bitter taste - a bit more than most other beers of that style I have had. The initial subtle smokiness is complemented by an aroma of grassy hops. Medium body, average carbonation, bitter finish. A good session beer with a smoky twist!

Bottle from Fenaknoken, Oslo. Pours a clear light golden body with a big white foamy head. Nose is pale malts, hints of dusty hops and vague tones of cured meat. Taste is sweet pale malts, dusty, crisp hops and faint traces of smoke. Smooth and pleasant, but definitely not an actual "smoke". Dortmunder/Helles is way more correct here, as any rauch tones is purely residual hints from the rest of the (undoubtedly) smoke-infused brewery. :-)
Brigh tand crisp yellow.  Light and sweetly smoky. Tingly, honey sweet, lightly smoked and glazed. Very mellow and very interesting. Smooth, light and crisp with a long lasting smokiness.

Appearance is a hazy light gold. There is a healthy 1.5 finger head that hangs around.

The smell is of a typical german lager. Noble hops and a crisp maltiness. There is a very small hint of smoke.

The taste starts off like numerous other german lagers: crisp and clean with nice hop bitterness. The smoke only kicks in once the hop flavor has faded. The smoke takes a backseat in this beer to the malt and hops.

I do like this beer but I feel it falls somewhat short of the other offerings from this brewery. It is not a whole lot different than many other german lagers.

On tap at Barley Johns - Pours hazy yellow with a foamy white head. Sweet and smoky nose, though its actually a little sharp. Taste is grainy and lightly sweet with smoke that comes through lightly on the finish. Its sweeter than I expected, and less smoky than I expected. Carbonation is a little sharp, and those whole thing is a bit weird.

A bottle from One Pint in Helsinki. I was surprised they had this, because I havent seen this beer even in Bavaria! The smoked notes mentioned in the label were not detectable in the aroma nor taste. All in all, Schlenkerla Helles a fairly pleasant normal Helles.

Bottle at Q-Brick. Aroma of light fruitsapricot, strong malt, a bit of cardboard. Deep golden color with a high head. Malty flvor, some cardboard and a light whiff of smoke. Rich, thick body. Decent but not that impressive. Would like to try it on tap in Bamberg.
Bottle from Bierkompass. Golden color with small white head. Malty, light smokey aroma. Taste, malty, some caramel, light smokey finish. Drinkable.

Gold pour medium carbonation head is good size frothy aromas salt sea air citrus grain wheat malt caramel flavour sweet not much bitter bit watery grain hay wheat some honey caramel the finish strong grain fruit caramel malt mainly sweet normal helles

Pours pale gold with a small head.
Nose shows grassy/spicy hops, soft smoke, hay, bready malt and faint caramel. Also a weird savoury note, possibly part of the smoke.
More hay and grainy, bready malt as flavours, along with spicy hops and some just noticeable woody smoke. Finishes with an assertive bitterness that then settles down to reveal some caramel.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2017 Bottle. Light to moderate malt notes of light bread and grain, light herbs and dough for the hops and yeast, with background notes of smoke, cardboard and a faint fruitiness. Head is small, frothy/fizzy, white with no lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is parkling clear but hazy on the last pour, light amber with a bit of tiny suspended particles. Flavor starts moderately acidic and finishes lightly acidic and lightly to moderately bitter. Palate is light to medium, watery with a lively carbonation. A typical bittering hopped German lager with a nice smokey character to it. Goes real well with your Oktoberfest weisswurst und brezn.
I got smoked out from this lager.  Smokiness smell and taste and light lager with limited malt flavor.

500 mL bottle from K&L. Pours a clear light gold with a mountainous white head that lasts forever.  Aroma is smokey - not like roasting a pig over a campfire, a la the other Schlenkerla beers - but definitely reminiscent thereof. Subtle notes of Christmas ham along with the more typical melanoidin character. Flavor isnt as smokey as the smell. Bigger emphasis on the base beer character, with Cheerios-esque malts and a  lightly sweet, grainy finish. There is a vague note of woody smoke throughout but its never at the fore. Lovely heft to the body, not too watery nor too sweet and fatiguing. Really hits the spot.

Bottle, 10C. Gold with a modest but dense white head that never quite disappears. Grainy aroma with smoke, mild spices. Soft mouthfeel is very lovely. Sweet with hay and grain, smoke hides the bitterness almost completely at first, then it creeps up and theres some pepper and earth as the finish struggles to be dry.

clear golden, nice white rocky head, fades relatively quickly, some nice lacing... light smoke, some sweetness, and some grassy hops, a little sweeter than expected aroma... light smoke, a little sweet, really mimics the aroma well, nice flavors, but again with the sweetness... medium thin body, very easy drinking...

From keg at the Rake. Looks like a regular lager, blond coloured with a small white head with small bubbles. Aroma is interesting, bit of dough, bit of wheat and a slight whiff of smoke. Tastes is typically lager-like but with an increasingly smoky finish. Glad I tried it, but probably wont rush back to it, unless I am sitting in a Bierkeller in Germany somewhere.

Light floral bouquet with some honey and a bit of lemongrass; a surprising hammy smokiness underlies the aroma. Appearance is translucent gold with light white head. Flavor is dead on the nose, with a lemongrass finish. Palate is very bubbly and chewy. Very nice lager.

In bottle at S.Brevinga Alus, Riga. Pours a light golden colour with a lacy white head. Aroma of smoky pea and ham soup and caramel. Similar flavours with light grassy hops, yeast and a light bitter finish. Not as smoky as other Schlenkerla beers Ive had. This beer has a crisper, lager flavour with mild carbonation and a light CO2 prickle.
Poured a light copper with foamy white head. Smells of smoke, wood, and earth. Very light body, tastes like liquid smoke and has a very small amount of sweetness.

Review from notes at Pegs Cantina on 9/10/11. 

Poured from a 16.9 oz. bottle into a pint glass. 

Appearance: Poured clear light gold with a 2 finger snow white head. Nice lacing.

Smell: Lager yeast and malt with a nice smoky background.

Taste: Typical German lager with a nice portion of smokiness. The smoke has a bacon-like quality to it. There is a touch of herbal hops at the finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied with a nice amount of carbonation.

Drinkability: Good drinkability. This would be perfect on a cool autumn day. You could drink several without any trouble.

Overall: Very good beer overall. The smoke enhances the flavor instead of dominating it. I would definitely recommend this one.

Interesting. Definitely smoky on the nose and tastebuds- but not overwhelmingly smoky.  Puts me in the mind of a pig roast.  Has a light dryness behind the smoke with an edge of malt. Finishes a little sweet for me.

Bottle at Leightons Aug 11 tasting. It pours straw yellow, with a thin, foamy white head. The nose is cheesy hop, light smokiness, wheat, white bread and grass. The taste is sweet malt, lemon, wheat, cereal, biscuit, dough and light smokiness, with a clean, light bitter finish. Light body and fine carbonation. Not bad.
Bottle from brepub shop. Pale yellow colour with a average white head. Aroma and flavour of malt and hops with smokey notes.

Bottle at a tasting. Pours clear yellow with a white, bubbly head. Dough and light florals on the nose. Pretty sweet flavor, some minerally smokiness, bit of dough, some straw. Light bodied with fine carbonation. Nice and clean to finish, doughy malts, some floral hops, quite clean. Nice beer.

27 Aug 2011, bottle. pale yellow, clear, occassional bubbles. nose initially had some lager skunkiness that immediately got surpassed by smoked sausage. thin body and a bit fizzy. smoked sausage w/ some lager bitter finish. i could actually drink this sometimes. smoked sausage isnt what im looking for in a lager but it was better than a lot of lagers.

Bottle from Vinter Wine. Ive always mocked the raters who described this non-smoked beer as being smoky, however they are actually wholly correct. It now amuses me that the facilities at Aecht are apparently smoky enough to impart that flavor on a beer merely being brewed there. Nice, comparatively mellow campfire aromas highlight a crisp lager. This is as smoky as a Z lager. The flavor has light veggies, wood, crackers and most distinguishable: meaty smoke. This is a most pleasant surprise.

Bottle.  Pours a clouded medium yellow with as somewhat foamy white head.  Aroma has some maltiness, but there is also noticeable smokiness.  Flavor is crisp and clean with distinct smoke notes.  Very nice.

500 mL bottle poured into a pint glass at home.  Golden beer with fizz and decent head.  Typical smoky Schlenkerla aroma - seems wierd on a helles.  A smokey helles, with a slight metallic taste on the first sip.  If anything its better than most helles Ive tried.  Its not exceptional however, but good.
Draft at Engine 15. Clear gold pour with a thin white head. Scent is sweet malts and caramel with a grassy hint. Taste is sweet caramel and a tinge of smoke.

Bottle thanks to Doug 
Appearance: Pours slightly hazy honey color with a medium sized creamy white head and some lacing 
Aroma: Biscuity, smokey, and honey 
Taste: Semi-sweet malts, smokey and grainy 
Ok.

The beer pours a yellow color with a white head. The aroma is a mix of bready malt with some grassy hops. A nice, clean smelling German lager. The flavor is mainly bready and biscuit malt with some grassy hops mixed in. I also get a little bit of light grape notes but they are pretty faint. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Another good beer from a great brewery.

[Bottle] Pours a bright golden color with a small cap of white head. Grains, dough and a distinct smoke aroma. Sweet and malty taste is of biscuits, toffee, straw and some smoke. Thick body and low carbonation levels. Dry and grainy finish. A great helles style beer with a nice smoky undertone.

Bottle 500ml @ yngwie
Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, grain and light smoked. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with notes of smoke. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle, courtesy of yngwie.Pours golden with a white head.Aroma of fruitiness, malt, hops and some smoke.Flavor is sweet and malty with a noticeable smoked character.Medium body, average carbonation.Nice , more people should make smoked helles.

500 ml bottle thanks to GT. Pours a totally clear golden color with a medium white head. The aroma is sweet honey and grains, light hops. The flavor is very clean and crisp; smooth sweet malts, apples, light honey. Very smooth and tasty. Insanely drinkable. This has to compete for the easiest beer to drink in the world.
Bottle from Davis Beer Shoppe. POurs clear yellow with a disappearing white head and a floral aroma. There is a yeasty light malt flavor that leaves a hint of smoke on the palate.

Pours a standard pale sparkling body with a large white head and fair lacing. Lovely fruity aroma with citrus, although quite vague. Also nice malty elements, some sweet honey? From time to time my beer ignorance is heavily rewarded, and this beer certainly gave me a big surprise when tasting it: smoked bacon? Its not often I start laughing when tasting a beer, but this one made me giggle! I had no idea that this beer was supposed to be smoky, but now that I know I do recognise some smoked notes in the aroma as well. I also get some fruity flavours and pleasant sweet malty notes. Medium sweet taste and a light bitter finish. The first few sips has a slightly metallic feel, but its soon forgotten. Lively carbonation, medium body. A fun beer! 
[50 cl bottle, from Meny Telemarksporten, Porsgrunn]

500ml bottle from Meny Grønland Torg in Oslo, shared with friends in Tromsø. Clear golden body and a lasting, small white head. Mild hay and pale malts to the nose. Half-sour, caramel malts in flavour with fruity hints. Ends round and dry. Undetectable rauchnote. Quite possible to drink (summertime beer session, 05.07.2011).

Bottle. Amber beer with a low off-white head. Malt and mineral aroma. malt and light caramel flavor with light mineral and light smoke. Medium bodied. Malt and smoke linger with light caramel and light woodsiness.
Golden body, ahite head. Aroma of really grainy malt and toast. Flavour has raw grains, medium bitterness, smoke. Very well balanced.

Bottle from Binnys.  Pours a clear yellow with a tall frothy head.  Light malts in the aroma.  Grainy and earthy.  Typical of an imported lager.  This thing shines on the tongue.  The sweet grainy malts are hidden underneath an earthy woodsy smokiness that are all subtle but apparent.  The combination make this drinkable and delicious.  Earthy dry finish.  A little grassy and in there but this would be easy to throw back in large quantities. Good stuff.

0.5l bottle that pours a golden body packed with lots of sediments and has a small bubbly white head. Aroma is malty, caramel, light citrus, some strange cucumber notes, a little butter and some thin hints of smoke. Quite decent aroma for a lager. Body is watery to oily, average carbonated and light bodied. Clean and crisp flavors, light citrus, mildly hoped towards the end. Could not tell that this is a smoked lager if I didnt already know it. But wait a minute, there is a mild smoky hint in the aftertaste. Took me a while before i noticed it, but I think its there.

500 ml bottle, from MENY Grønland Torg, Oslo. ABV is 4.3%. Pale yellow colour, large white head. Moderate aroma of smoked sausage. Ordinary helles flavour with a little smoke added. Moderate hops in the finish. Nice enough to drink, but did not blow my socks off.
From a smoke tasting w/ the LL/Proof group:  light yellow pour.  light grains, wheat.  green apple.  light smoke.  6.8

Draft at Memphis Taproom.  Interesting and pleasant.  Light smokiness, neat to read that it has no smoked malt, just residual flavors as a result of being brewed in the same place as the classic smoke beer.  Pours light straw colored, hints of smoke in the nose as well as noble hops.  Nice light smoke across the palate.  Easy to drink.
slight burn and grass aroma. light straw. color. settling small head. rounded sweetness honeyed light malt. nice balance of sweet and sharp pilsy flavor.

Mild herber Antrunk, in dem eine dezente Rauchigkeit gut eingefügt wird. Trotz seiner mild ist der rauchige Ton noch lange präsent, die Aromen, allem voran die Herbe, scheinen fast Rücksicht darauf zu nehmen. Die Herbe wir ab dem Mittelteil grasig-hopfig, was den Effekt hat, dass die Herbe nicht mehr so deutlich hervorsticht, das Bier aber insgesamt voluminöser wird. Zum Ende hin pusht die ein deutliches Getreidearoma die Rauchigkeit, in dem es sie vor sich herschiebt. Gelungener, überraschend markanter rauchiger Abgang, in dem der Hopfen zum Schluss noch einmal ein Revival erlebt. Gut! 10/11/12/12/10/12

Bottle. Pours clear golden with a big creamy off-white head. Aroma of hay, moderate sweet grain. Taste is moderate sweet grains with a weak and subtle note of smoke, quite nice. Ends rather dry, moderate grassy hops.
Not too strong aroma. The taste isnt as strong as the other onees from the same brewery, but still very smooth. The finish is way hoppier than its brothers.
Faint Smoke cereals in my bottle. Light clear yellow. Round mild neutral taste. A very harmonic experience; also nice without food.

Aroma is light grains, faint hops, pretty subtle.  Pours clear, straw/golden color, 1/2" of white head with poor retention and no lacing.  Flavor is malty, light cereal grains, mildly sweet, some hop bitterness, also some faint smokiness in the background.  Light body, medium carbonation.

Bottle from Knightly Spirits. Pours a golden body with minimal frothy white head. Aroma is grainy and toasty, displaying shortbread and almond. Flavors are biscuit, toast, metal and piney hops in the finish. As the tastes open up, I do get hints of smoke. High carbonation and light/medium body. Crisp and refreshing.

The beer in glass is bright golden with a good foaming. The smell is amazing smoky and like smoked ham. It starts relatively mild, slightly hoppy, but it takes only a moment, until the smoke-hammer beats you up! comes hammer. Some pine wood aromas are noticeable in background! Recommended for everyone who thinks, the Märzen is tooo fucking smoked!

Im Geruch moderat schinkenrauchig. Antrunk rauchig, ein wenig Schinken. Mitte schwach hopfig-bitter mit zurückhaltender Rauchnote. Mild bitter und leicht schinkenrauchig ablaufend. Eher leichtes Rauchbier, welches im Abgang etwas wässrig wirkt. Trifft nicht so meinen Nerv.

Tap at Redlight. Pours a deep gold pour with a thick white head. Aroma is noble hops, malty and a hints of smoke. Taste has a wonderful malty base with touches of noble hops and the lightest bit of smoke. Good session brew.

500 ml bottle. From Germany. HHOK IX.
Clear pale golden colour with small bubbly white head.
Malt, grain, dough, smoked ham and mild fruity hops in aroma.
Smoke, malt, grain and diacetyl in dry flavour. Some dry hops in aftertaste. Low carbonation. One of the best Lagers Ive tasted.

Thin, white head dissolves in a few seconds with an opaque lacing that slides down to the body at a rate of about an inch per two seconds.  The body is a clear, orange/yellow.
Aroma is hoppy with spicy notes.
Taste is lightly bitter, lightly sweet, and lightly sour, and the smokey nose is very slightly present.
Palate is light body, thin feel, lively carbonated, with an abrupt, astringent finish.
A fine Lagerbier but not a prize.

Bottle picked up at Chevy Chase in DC. Served in a tulip.

Pours a light straw color with a thin white head and not too much lacing, even after a good swirl to raise the head back up. The nose brings a good amount of smoke along with mild lager characteristics lingering in the background. The smoke definitely overwhelms the lager, which which basically just means a lightly-smoked carbonated beverage. This creates problems for both the nose and the taste. The feel is redeemed is the Helles crispness is still there and fits well with the smoke. Fairly good, but not my favorite of theirs.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-22-2011

500 ml bottle in Germany. This correctly classified as a helles lager, this is in the top 2% of its style, and deservedly so. Golden with lasting white head. Mild smoke grass and honey aroma. Toasty malt flavor with very mild smoke and clean finish. Medium-light body and medium carbo. Very mild smoke residue adds an interesting layer of complexity to this nicely made Helles, Palate is mellow smooth and some light smokiness. Superior beer!!!
Hazy amber color; Medium body; Aroma of smoky malt, & some floral hops; Flavor of sweet malt, light hops, and grain; Finish is somewhat smoky; Nicely balanced; Overall, quite different and very good.

Bottled 500ml. -Clear yellow coloured, medium sized white head, ordinary dusty pils nose with hint of grain. Malty, weak smoked and mild hoppy with too light panceta notes in the finish. The weakest Schlenkerla so far, even Raschhofer Rauchbier is much better.

Dry, crisp pils. Refreshing and light, then a lovely layer of smoke, almost bacon-like. Would be very good with pork and other heavy dishes. The pale apperarnece is decieving. Very welcome addition to Norwegian shops.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2013 Big white head. Yellow body. Minty oily grassy aroma with herbal notes. Very clean and mild. Dry-sweet grassy strawy taste with oily herbal notes. Mild mouthfeel. Light body. Dry strawy smoky grassy aftertaste with oily caramelly notes. Perfect dry/sweet balance, amazing harmony. If I were stranded on a desert island with 240 crates of this beer, I believe Id stay there. Certainly has character. (0.5l bottle, Meny Grønland Torg, Oslo.)
