bottle. yellow gold body with almost no head. wet prairie light smoke aroma. flavor is damn good. bit of tart, honey sweetness, with a mild smoke bitter. kind of a meaty finish this has all the finish of a smoke beer, very interesting that this has no smoke malt. an easy drinking food beer. will have to buy a few for the summer when i can grill.

500 ml bottle. Sparkling golden and crystal clear. Medium-sized white head that clings to the glass. Crisp floral hops aroma. Subtle smoky flavours. Sparkling carbonation that enhances the crispness of the beer. Fresh malts and grassy hops. Aroma gets stronger, especially the smoky notes, as the beer warms up.  A delicious beer that works nicely as a session beer. Very happy that this is finally available here in Norway.
Has a slighlty coarse smokiness, otherwise a rather standard helles, not exceptional, but good none the less.
From a bottle poured a golden color with a small amount of head.  Light malty flavor with a quick finish.
Light golden color, thin white head. Yeasty aroma, with little smoke. Taste is malty sweet, with some smoke and hay. Bitter aftertaste.

After having the Rauchbier and thinking it was ok but not something I would buy again, this one intrigued me, perhaps it would be the right balance of smokiness, here it goes.

Poured into a 0.4 liter mug/Stange hybrid for export lager, it will do until I get a good Bavarian crystal mug. It has a nice white one finger head. The color is amazing, it is nice darker helles color with a tiny bit of haze, almost like a Dortmunder, with a nice amount of bubbles. Very nice lacing as well.

Alot of people got bacon scent in the original Rauchbier Maerzen, but all I smelt was burnt wood, this one smells a bit more like bacon, especially when I popped it open and i got a huge bacon whiff. After the pour the smokiness/bacon dies down and it is a nice malty sweet smell with some breadiness. I am also getting a slight bit of hops that blends with the smoke scent.

Wow great taste woweee. Starts off quite sweet with the malts, and they last quite a bit, its a long flavor. Hops come in with a smoky bite, some spice, and some citrus flavors. The lingering flavor is smoke and hops, it has a slightly dry finish. A very complex and satisfying taste. The carbonation is perfect, has a nice bite on the tongue. This almost reminds me of a Dortumunder Export with smokiness and some Bavarian Helles charm, I guess I picked the right glass too then hah.

As it warms the smokiness on the palate intensifies but it never gets to the slightly offensive levels the Maerzen got too. The drinkablity is pretty high but I probably couldnt down more than 2 of these big bottles. The 4.30% abv makes me think a couple of liters of this would be feasible, if only this were in the mini-kegs they sell here and not the Maerzen.

This was a lovely surprise, this beer is just packed with flavor, but it isnt a big, bulky brew just light and flavorful. They ave succeed in creating a whopper of a low abv beer that I would stack up against many big beers. If you want a reprieve from your everyday Bavarian Helles this is the way to go.
Beautiful golden color, weak foam. Aroma of malt, apple, campfire. Bitter sweet in the mouth with pleasant smoke in the background. Very rounded taste, finely tuned bitter end.

The aroma has more than a hint of smoke. The hops are hay like with a touch of floral. The malt is buried but in there. The appearance is pale gold with a foamy head. The taste is like the aroma making this more of a light smoke beer than anything else. The palate is thin and the aftertaste watery, bitter, and papery. Overall I feel like this is all you can have from a place that does just smoke, it permeates everything.

Bottle. Pours a clear yellow brown color with light head. Smells of smoke and toast. Tastyes of toffee some mild bacon and hops. Not as good as the previous ones from them but very crisp and easy to drink for the novice smoked beer drinker on a shot day.
500 ml bottle. Pours hazy, pale with lacy head. Intriguing aroma which foreshadows extraordinary smoky taste.Buckets of flavour for a lager with a long finish.

50cl bottle from Bierzwerg. Poured clear golden with a white head. Aroma is very perfumy and grassy, some smoke detected as well. Actually quite a lot of smoke flavor, with some grassy and buttery notes. Medium body. Really nice and drinkable.
Bottle (thx travlr). Pours slightly hazy yellow with a white head. Flavor is lemony, grass, light hops.. fairily standard hellesbock.

Bottle at Paradiso Dupont.  Hazy yellow.  Lacks the typical rauchbier notes of burnt pork and ahstray that the rest of the series has.  Didnt help that we tasted this one side by side with the Eiche Doppelbock, the difference was massive.

Pale yellow; frothy white head. Saazish hay aroma, slightly dirty, cat piss? Very light smoke underneath; Sourdough. Very satisfying bready flavor. Restrained hopping. Almost imperceptible smoke, really more of the almost-sweet tangy flavor that comes from smoked malt.

500mL courtesy of Travlr. Poured a clear yellow with a thin, white head. Really no retention or lace. Odd lemon, diacetyl, and grainy lager aroma. There is no smoke or normal Aecht Schlenkerla barbecue notes. Really just void. Taste is lemon with a soapy, suddy body with a hint of diacetyl. Some honey and adjunct sweetness seems to come through. Massive disappointment.

Nice looking beer.  Clear pale yellow with lots of bubbles and a fluffy white head.  Aroma is mild cereal with smoke and bacon notes.  Dry bitter flavor with a good amount hops.  Meaty smoke throughout.  Very enjoyable.

Bottle looks simple, but really good. Beer in the glass zippy, small head, deep golden. Smoky aroma. Starts mild, malty-dry, modest hoppy-flowery. Not as smoky as the aroma. Finish well balanced, still mild but not washy, very drinkable. Well done!

Picked up a single 500 ml bottle from Heritage Liquors in Maplewood, Minnesota. Pours a clear golden pale colored brew with a thick and creamy white head that has some excellent retention and lacing. Aroma of floral hops, golden grain malt, a hint of honey, and just barely a hint of smoked golden barley. Taste is light to medium bodied, slightly bitter dry with flavors of golden grain malt, some noble hops and a touch of smoked grain. Finish is semi-dry, with a mild grassy hop bitterness that slowly disappears. Slightly more bitter than most other helles style lagers.

Olive bottle, 0,5 l, best before 5 08, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savoured on November 27 2010; eye: golden, slightly hazy, no effervescence, tiny off-white head, slight lacing; nose: light smoke, light medicinal, slight floral hops, light perfumy, slight maple sap that is boiling; mouth: light smoke, light medicinal, light floral hops, finale in light smoke with slight presence of floral hops, medium body, average carbonation, a bit thin; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille olive, 0,5 l, meilleure avant 5 08, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savourée le 27 novembre 2010; il : dorée, très légèrement voilée, pas deffervescence, petite mousse blanc cassé, très légère dentelle; nez : léger fumé, léger médicinal, très léger houblon floral, léger parfumé, très léger eau dérable qui bout; bouche : léger fumé, léger médicinal, léger houblon floral, finale en léger fumé avec très légère présence de houblon floral, corps moyen, carbonatation moyenne, un peu mince; en résumé : bien
Easy drinking, a hint of the smokiness that I thought would be more present. Its nice having a lager that isnt pure corn sweetness.
11/5/10.  Bottle shared at S3.  Sweet, fruity lager aroma with hints of grass and hay.  Sweet fruity flavor with a hint of spicy hop kick.
bottle.  Pours gold with visible sediment, small white head.  Just wrote a long one on this and ratebeer lost it so suffice to say its one of the best lagers Ive ever had, excellent.
Pours a clear straw yellow color with a white head that disappears quickly.  Aroma of grass, lemon and yeast.  Mostly smoke flavor with some lemon, yeast, and grain.  Good beer!

500 ml bottle from The Royale.  Pours a clear gold color with a small white head.  Aroma of pale and Munich malts, straw, corn flakes, and grass.  Flavor of the same malts, corn, grains, honey, and just a little bit of smoke.  Very restrained.  Medium-bodied, with mild carbonation and a malty mouthfeel.  Pretty dry, especially at the finish.  Nice helles.
Aroma of yeast and even bacon. Quite a heavy flavor for a lagerbier, unfortunately I only seem to taste yeast.
Bottle 500ml. Color dark yellow with medium white head. Aroma sweet, an idea of smoke. Taste grain, sweet, grass.
Regalo di Gian da Bamberga; lievemente affumicata, pur non avendo malti rauch; ancora più delicata della Marzen di Spezial. Buonissima, con la grigliata di carne, poi...
Ottima lager leggermente affumicata (limpianto è lo stesso dove fanno di continuo la loro fantastica rauch), è una birra di grande qualità che rivoluziona il cliché della helles germanica.

500ml bottle from K&L Redwood City.  Really pale yellow-straw color with a small white head that leaves a film.  The aroma is smoky with a little sweet malt and grain, a little hay.  Nice base helles lager, with pale malt and grain, slight hops.  A nice restrained bacony smokiness.  Fairly light-bodied with average carbonation and a pretty good mouthfeel.  One of the more interesting helles lagers Ive tried.

50cl bottle.   Tough one honestly.   Decently malty helles with just enough phenolic character from the smoke to completely change the flavor profile, but not even close to the rich smoke of their other beers.   Dry and refreshing with bready malt and singed smoke everywhere.   This just really makes you want a marzen or ur-bock, though it might be good for beer pong while I certainly cant imagine using either of those.
light aroma of smoke, very smooth taste, clear colour, good offering from a very interesting brewery.
Bottle. Smokeyness comes out in the aroma for sure, but not as much as the marzen. Barely any smoke taste.

Very impressed.  I like the smokebeers from this brewer, but did not realize when I bought the beer that this one is brewed using the same equipment.  Not actually smoked like the others, but still gets a smoky character from the process.  Aroma of sweet malt followed by a subtle smokiness.  Appearance is a beautiful clear gold with a full white head.  These beers make me envision the brewing process and brewery itself more than any others do.  I love the hybrid nature of this one and I will definitely buy this brew again!
Bottle. Pale yellow pour, white head. Aroma of grain, bread a bit of yeast. Nice discreet smokiness too, quite pleasant. Taste is slightly sweet, light yeast flavor. Palate is smooth, enjoyable.
I don;t care for the smokey aroma but I suppose that doesnt mean its a bad brew. Nice full smooth body however and quite refreshing.

On tap at Fountainhead.  Pours a clear golden color with some medium, bubbly white head.  Aroma is of light smoke, light floral hops and roasted malt taste.  Taste is light smoke, light grassy hops and light roasted malt.  Not bad for the style, but I would have preferred more smoke.
UPDATED: JAN 27, 2015 Really good stuff.  Just a touch of smoke comes through. Nice sweetness from the malt. Serving: Bottle

(Tap @ GBBF). A bit soulles considering how unique other Schlenkerla  brews ive sampled are. I did expect a little smoke , just as a signature.  Bready malt. Leaty dry hops.  Some resins .   Reasonable but lacking interest and I usually dig dortmunder helles.

Bottle from Spirits Red Bank. Poured a very thin bodied crystal clear golden straw underneath a large full frothy bright white head. Aroma of smoked pork products, burnt firewood from a camp fire the morning after you wake up while camping, plastic and hay. The body is much fuller then expected and actually slightly foams up a bit once it passes your lips and a good dose of carbonation. The flavor is smoked hay, lightly burnt toast and a touch of plastic. Interesting but if Im gonna have a smoked beer give me a smoked beer and not a smoked beer light.
UPDATED: DEC 26, 2013 Bottle.Pale gold with a medium head,aroma of smokey meat,wood,malt,taste of smokey fires,grass,dry malty sweetness,light dry finish.

Bottled. Pours deep hazy golden color. Fine carbonation. Neutral aroma. The flavor is slightly sweet - nice and roasty. I can detect the faint nuances of the smoke beers, especially in the finish. This would be great with grilled meats.

Fine stuff.  Im told that they dont use smoked malt in it, but simply run the beer through the filters that the brewery uses on its other smoked beers.  They certainly get enough smoke flavor using this process.  I could hope for a little more in the way of some good Helles maltiness, which is a bit lacking in my sample, though this, like all smoked beers, remains a ton of fun.

Very nice and Smooth. The beer pours a light, clear amber with a medium to large white head. Taste is crisp and carbonated with a light lemon flavor. Very clan on the palate with an aftertaste the same as the beer.

A clear yellow pour with very lively carbonation in the body, and a large foamy white head. The aroma starts with some crisp grainy wheat, sporting both notes of banana and grassy citrus. A faint note of smoked malt is ever present. The flavor starts with smokey meat notes that quickly turn to wheat grain, grassy hop notes, and finally reverts back to a smokey finish. A doughy bread note is pervasive throughout the quaff. Very interesting and unique- I cant get enough of this style. The palate is medium bodied with fine bubble carbonation and a clean, ever so grainy finish. I love the smoky character in this light example, but it definitely works best in the darker renditions such as the marzen and urbock.

Bomber. Golden yellow with thin white head. Aroma is great light smoked nut smell, grains, and almost a urine smell all pungent but somehow appealing. Flavor starts wet on tongue and lightly sweet but bitters and dries (although only some) as the beer finishes. Flavor notes incoude light tang gruit, and reminds me (although Im not sure why) of roasted peanuts.

Bottle from la Cerveteca, Barcelona. Clear golden pour, creamy white head that leaves lacing. Hints of smoked malt in the aroma, some spices and a bit of hops, all very delicate yet nicely balanced. Flavor is slightly bitter and slightly sweet and with smoked malts. Full bodied for the low abv. Creamy texture and decently carbonated. Easy drinkable and still satisfactory.
There is a bit of smoke in the aroma which is the same in the flavor, very interesting for such a pale beer.

500 ml bottle.  Pours a crystal clear gold with a moderate brilliant white head that lasted through the first quarter of the glass and left very little lace.  Very mild aroma of malt and lager yeast.  The flavor is malt, lager yeast, husky grain and, I was surprised to find, smoke mild smokiness.  Fairly smooth finish.  A bit rough around the edges, but otherwise a solid beer.

Had this the first time in Bamberg at the brewery and it was phenomonal. I have had it since then in bottles stateside, and it doesnt quite hold-up, but is still very drinkable. Great smoke aroma is deceptive, since it does not have a very heavy smoke flavor. Great on a summer evening.

A golden color body with a pure white head that faded away somewhat quickly.  Aroma had a slightly smokey hint and a fruity note to it.  Corn was dominate but not in a negative way.  Flavor seemed to be balanced with corn and fruit malt notes and had a mild hop finish.  Crisp.

Bottle at Smiths Billiards - Downtown Springfield MA.  This is the first authentic Helles lager that I have had.  I could detect a hint of the smoke in the aroma but none in the taste.  The flavor is dominated by very metallic hops, corn, and a lightly acidic hop finish.  I loved this beer and at 4.3% I can picture myself drinking multiple at a barbecue.

Light amber/ golden hue.  Light eggshell head.  Curious faint smoke on the nose.  Comes across very smooth and crisp on the palate; cleansing with a light smoke flavor and light spice.  Very sessionable, screams food pairing.  A very unique and versatile beer for certain.

The smokiness of this beer acually comes from the process of lagering it within the vessels that are you for their smoked lagers.  This alows just enough smokiness come through without overwhelming those not into smokey beers.  Great beer for BBQ

500ml capped bottle.  Pours a light crystal clear golden with a bight pillowy lasting head with light lacing.  Nose is slightly sweet floral, honey and corn with light biscut and cracker malt notes, damp grassy hops and faint smoke.  Lightly sweet up front with touch of smoke, floral, hay, honey and sweet cracker malt.  Mid palate brings some crisp Nobel hops with the finish bringing back light sweetness and smoke.  Ive had this a few times before and this wont be the last.

Pours clear and golden with a huge, foamy white head.  Has a nicely crisp and sweet lager aroma with hints of corn and honey.  Flavor is that of a high quality light lager with the addition of upfront smokiness and a finish that is both smoky and bitter.  A refreshing and uniquely flavored lager.
(500ml) clear medium yellow pour light bubbles. Nose of smoke, BBQ, bacon, corn and raw grain. Taste of corn, raw grain, smoke, toastiness, and a dry smoky finish.

Tap at fountainhead.  Pours a clear golden yellow with a fluffy white head. Notes of light peaty smoke, earth.  Seems like drinking a good pils while gardening with a wet leaf campfire off in the distance.  Clean. Refreshing. Enjoyed this quite a bit

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2012 an average helles lager.
i do get a hint of smoke in here, but theres not enough malt character for the smoke to grab onto, it seems disembodies or lost. the aftertaste has a rubber note.

Aroma has a slightly acrid touch of smoke, like your clothes when you wake up in a dew-dampened tent after sitting by a campfire half the night. There is a notable, yet restrained, minerality that is sharped by the smokey character. The pilsner malt comes through pretty clear, but the hops give just a hint of herbal presence.

Taste leads with a bit of salty minerality and cracker-like pilsner malt, followed by some damp smokey notes and a hint of herbal hops.

A unique offering from the world of German Helles beers. The smokey character, though sharper and less meaty than in actual rauchbiers, gives this helles lager something interesting to bring to the table, making for fun pairings.

Tepid urine appearance, head gone quickly after pour. Nose is sweet, heavy honey and grain but also a light smoked note. Flavor has light smoke, some biscuit and also grass, and a creamy sweetness that only adds to the complexity. Moderate body, oily and coating through the lightly smoked, corn finish. The smoke adds a nice touch here, combined with the light grass bitterness to keep the grain-heavy flavor and nose from becoming sweet. Very nice.

500 ml bottle; pours clear light gold with trace bubbly white head; light rauch malt aromas with some corn, stale malt, lemon; soft texture light body; light aromas of mild smoke, creamy malt, light fruit; smooth drinker with light smoke; nice dose of sweetness; crisp, smooth and yummy; smoked lagers are tasty

This one I really liked.  Having tried the other offerings by Heller I was bracing for "charcoal in a glass".  While the smoke was certainly present, it was a contributor rather than the monotone flavor.  There was room for malt and hops too, and this beer could stand on its own, without needing to pair it with food.

Lightly sweet malty aroma.  A good Eurolager that is a little sharper and fresher than most.  Central European hops (Saaz?  Hallertau?), grains, and some sweetness.  I didnt taste much of the smoke that this brewery is famed for - maybe a little whiff, like from a chimney a half mile away.

Bottle poured a clear gold with a lasting white head. Aromas of straw, spicy hops ans subtle smoke. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of straw, spicy hops and subtle smoke with a crisp dery lingering smoke finish.

500 ml bottle from Binnys South Loop (Chicago, IL). Continuing my smoked beer travels. Pours a light golden transparent pour, very bubbly and well carbonated with a pretty big offwhite thick creamy head that stays ok sized, laces ok. Aromas are a bit skunky, some smoked malts coming in beneath, a touch of noble hop, grainy malts. A bit of a victim of its travels. Initial is heavier end of light bodied, some good crisp cereal malts with a nice bit of campfire smoke, light and easy going, the smoke makes the malts feel a bit heartier on the palate, a touch carmelized perhaps with an even hop bitterness that is there, gives way to a pleasant smoky maltiness, lighter, but there. This is ok, an easy drinker, but the possible skunk and noble hops gets in the way a bit. Hopefully, a rerate on tap at Bavarian soon. I still enjoyed it as I drank this with the windows open, the sun shining through, and the old ballcap on. Cheers

Bottle.  Pours a golden color w/ a decent sized head and a fair amount of carbonation.  Signature lager lightness and flavors, malt and hops balanced nicely, has a unique smokey flavor as well.  Easy on the palate.  Has a nice creamy feel and is light bodied and goes down easily.  Not bad at all.

Very pale golden with a thin soapy head.  Aroma is Saaz hops, smoke, and graininess.  Flavor profile leads with smoke.  Light zing in the mouth.  Tastes pretty much like a European Pale Lager with some smoke.

Bottle.  Pours a clean clear golden amber with a thin white head.  Light faint smoke, crisp sweet grain, light citrus hop, lemon.  Medium bodied, crisp grain, a little smoke.  Crisp and quite drinkable, grainy finish, lingering hints of smoke.
Bottle.Clear golden colour with large white head who stays.Aroma is smoked and grainy with smooth note of hops and malt medium body and good smoked finish.

Serving: 500ml bottle from Sperryville Corner Store.
It pours a clear gold color with a foamy white head.  The nose has a bit of smoke, floral notes, and a good bit of grain.  The taste has a light bitter smokiness to it, the floral notes make a return, some cereal, and a good bit of soap.  Suprising I thought I detected a bit of alcohol but that seems unlikely given the low percentage.  The mouthfeel is light and it is slightly slick on the tongue.  The finish is rather forgettable.  Overall its a different take on a Helles, but it doesnt do all that much for me.

pours a semi-hazy pale yellow with a thin white head, and not much lacing.

smell is faint, malt, grain, a touch of smoke, and a little corn.

taste is of corn, malt, a little sweet in back, a little smoke, and well hidden hops, ends dry and a little bitter.

[bottle]
Sweet base malt aroma with just a touch of noble hops. Clear dark yellow under a thick white head that drops after a bit. Melanoidiny malt flavour with a significant bitterness that comes in together with not a small amount of smokyness. Some faint fruity notes, green apple, pear. Light to medium body, moderate carbonation, sweet and almost clean finish.

(Bottle 500ml) Clear, pilsener-golden beer with a small, white head. Faint smoked aromas and some sweet malt in the flavour. Good smokey notes that are very exciting. Fresh and easy to drink.  Great pilsner beer and great flavor!
This here is Schlenkerlas try at a "normal" beer, and they have succeeded magnificently...very smooth lager with a nice sweetness at the end, goes down very easily.

This lager, reminiscent of a rauchbier, is absolutely fantastic.  Enjoyed on tap at the Map Room in Chicago after Ive had one more other high powered ales than I should have, this was the perfect beer for the time.  Very subtle hint of smokiness, very drinkable, also very enjoyable and savory.  I can drink this stuff all day.

Bottle.  Poured pale yellow with thick white head.  Aroma of malt and smoke.  Rather smoky flavour, much more that I expected from a lightly smoked helles.  Malt balanced the smoke.  Lekker hop finish.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text: I really liked this one.  Sweet, and smoke, without being overwhelming.  About the same smoke as the Alaska Smoked Porter.

Golden yellow with a loose white foam, thick sheets of lacing.  Grainy huskyness typical of a helles mixes with a mild ashy smoke aroma.  Taste is grassy, herbal, grainy, tannic, then a light wash of burnt wood, campfire ash, smoke.
On tap at Wildeman. Golden body with tall head. Looks like a pils until you take in the hammy nose. Taste of smoke, and ham. Watery. Also nice malt flavours. Enjoyable.

Average sized frothy white diminishing head. Clear light yellow body. Average malt aroma of grain and cereal. And lots of smoke! Medium body, thin texture, soft carbonation and bitter finish. Moderate sweet and light bitter flavor.

pours a very clear golden color with a medium white head...retention could be better.  aroma is very faint and has slight smoke, a touch of hay...malty but not sweet.  flavor is malty...pils malt...up front with a subtle spicy hoppiness and nice smoke in the back end.  mouthfeel is light and lively with a crisp finish of smoke and spicy hops.  refreshing with a perfect amount of smoke.

Interesting find on tap at The Other Side Cafe in Boston.  Pours pale golden with off-white head.  Aroma has some fruit and a perfumy quality, along with smoke.  On the palate the perfume quality is present and the beer is overall very crisp and refreshing.  Good accompaniment to the pub fare.

Bottled 50cl. Courtesy of joss. Clear pale yellow with a nice beautifully lacing white head. The smoke component is very subtle in both nose and aroma which is surprisingly hoppy. Great malt and great hop profile. Decent bitterness. Accompanies extemely well indian cooking. A mindblowingly good Helles. Thanks a million joss!

Poured medium gold with a nice white head from a bottle. Initial smell includes the definite smokiness and peatiness of their real smokebeer. Almost to much for me, and I split the bottle in half with a friend. Flavor has initial lager taste followed by a strong bitter, smokey, peaty, and generally earthy taste and texture. Im debating on whether this bottle was older then it should be or if its just my own palate that isnt used to this flavor. Overall it wasnt horrible but out of a recent random selection of beers that I got this has been my least favorite by far.

Bottle at Son of Sid Brewery, The Chequers, Little Gransden, Cambs 1st Beer Festival on 02-10-09   Pours mid gold with a white head. There is a definate smokiness to the nose. The taste is initially lagery with lager malts showing. Some grain but the smokiness is ever present.  A7 A5 F7 P4 Ov14 3.7

Poured a hazy gold with a light head. The aroma was on the sweet side with notes of week hops and yeast. Then the taste was completely dominated by the yeast and wheat. While the aftertaste was powered by bitterness. Not enjoyable.

Draft.  This was nice!  Pours a golden body with a white head.  AT first comes off a hint sweet maybe the residual hefe from my previous beverage and ends anything but.  Huge smoke character peat like malt, hints of earth and honey.  Liquid smoke come out even more as it warms.  This is great!

A clear gold appearance, white head.  The aroma is very clean, malkty, grassy, honey, sweet.  The flavor follows exactly, very enjoyable, and refreshing.  I dont get the smoke that is supposed to be in this beer.  Clean finish, mild bitering of noble hops.  Enjoyable, one of the best in this style.

Bottle from Beers of the World in Henrietta. Pours a clear deep gold with a head of tight white bubbles. Aroma is slightly smokey and also sweet. The flavors reveal more of the smoke, but only enough to make this sweet lager interesting. Not spectacular, but a lighter offering from a brewery that makes a lot of impressive beers.

Bottle from Sams, Durham. Very pale golden pour with moderate carbonation. Malts and yeast in the nose, with a hint of light fruit and a healthy bit of smoke (though nothing compared to other Schlenkerla beers - awesome that the brewery is so smokelicious that they didnt even need to add smoked malts to this). The beer isnt especially convincing as a Helles, with not quite enough liveliness or body, nor even a particularly flavorful quality to it. But the quirkiness of smoke in this style is enough to merit a decent rating.

Bottle, bought at brewery. Bright gold, clear. The head disappears pretty fast. Disappointing aroma is bland sweet malts, light caramel, even a hint of honey. Thin, fizzy palate. Some bitterness in the finish has good character but is otherwise bland. Drier than it smells, and has burnt wood flavors and decent hopping. Bland and I dont get any smoke. Tastes like the brewery runoff, which all things considered, could be worse! Still, Im left with the impression, "Why bother?"
Sampled at DØE Beerfestival 2009, Valby. Pours a clear yellow beer with a white head. The aroma is weak. The flavor is weak smoke. The palate is thin, and overall the beer needs character.

Pours pale peachy gold with a 1 finger creamy white head. Aroma is smoke, grass, lemon, sweet grain, lightly toasted grain, a little soured malt and a touch of floury bread rolls. Flavor is like smoked granola, or something right away-smokey, slightly sweet and grainy-very nice, lightly roasted nuts, some biscuit and bread notes, grilled vegetables - in a good way - definite mineral notes and apple peel near the finish. Finish is campfire biscuits, grass and lightly bitter hops, with a crisp mineral fade that cleans the palate of smoke notes before they become stagnate. Palate is light bodied with a light yet slightly sharp carbonation and a dry that borders beween dry and slightly oily. I hate to see this bottle go, I really need to buy more of this the next time I can. Id imagine that this would be a fantastic beer to pair with just about any meat or veggie dish, sushi would probably work extremely well too, mmmm... salmon.

Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is light sweet malt, grassy hops, and light smoke. Flavor is lightly sweet with a bit of graininess, and a little biitterness in the finish. I am disappointed as I expected this to be like their other beers. Not horrible , but not a smoked beer.

Pours a very pale golden yellow color with a lot of visible carbonation and a thin white head. Aroma is dominated by a smokey woodsy maltiness with very slight golden fuit notes. Golden pilsner altiness with a subtle hop character and a very smokey, characoal wood chip flavor. Dry finish.

500ml bottle served in a dimpled mug.  Clear golden pour with a two-finger thick head of  slowly fading off-white foam.  A decent amount of thin, spider-web lacing was left around the glass.  The aroma had grass, lightly toasted grain, and an unintrusive note of moderate smoke.  The flavor was clean and crisp with a light campfire smokiness.  Lightly grassy with a decent amount of sweet, toasted malt.  Nice body for such a low ABV drink.  Light carbonation.  Pretty good stuff.
Blonde colored with creamed head. Light graininess in the nose, full of smoke, but supported by a crisp backbone.  Light grainy maltiness of flavor of which airy smokiness plays. Nice.

On tap at the Bavarian Lodge, Lisle, IL. and poured to a logo-ed lager glass, a clear, golden color with tight bubbled, white foam and streaks of lacing. The aroma was light grain and smoked sausage. The flavor carried on the light smokiness along with a low intensity of hop bitterness but a pleasantly dry finish.

Cask Stillage at the GBBF Earls Court, London 09/08/2008
Carbonation. Hop aroma. Clear golden coloured and hoppy with a crisp and dry lasting malt finish.

Typical heller/pils appearance. Faint smokiness in the aroma. The taste is quite sweet but theres just enough noble hop taste to balance it. the smokiness isnt really present until the aftertaste. somewhat disappointing the hints of smoke add some complexity but i would have liked more. should be classified as a helles not a smoked.
Bottle (cellphone rating). Light golden with a white head. Grainy aroma of malt, smoke and a light sweetness. Flavour follows up completely on aroma with a light bitter finish.

8/06/2009:  Schlenkerla Helles Lagerbier...  Aroma:  Fruity lager and lightly sweet cereal grains paired with a delicate campfire smokiness.   Appearance:  Dusty golden color, cloudy; white foamy head; extremely vigorous torrents of carbonation that actively stirs the beer around the glass; the extremely fine carbonation bubbles sparkle in the lacing as it slowly slides down the glass.  Flavor:  Lots of good, deep campfire smoke and some suggestions of smoked meatiness that both permeate the fruity lager, biscuity malt, and crisp grassy hoppiness of the base beer; mild bitterness.  Palate:  Light to medium-light body, soft mouthfeel, creamy texture.  Overall:  This is just one of those beers that is simply fantastic for what it is.  Low alcohol, but very flavorful and different...  I could drink this stuff non-stop for days, weeks, maybe even months on end and never get sick of it.  I could always use more of that great Schlenkerla smokiness that I love so much, but for what this beer is and how they make it (no smoked malt, they just brew a lager and using their equipment and the beer picks up the residual smoke from equipment!), its just right.  Drinking this beer is really making me crave a Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier Märzen!

Once tasted the light malt (pils) and smooth smoke struggle with eachother for dominance, resulting in a beautiful dance. As these two fight it out, earthy hops start to crowd around and eventually over take the two dancers. Quite a nice sequence of events. Medium mouthfeel running to light at the end. Nice and dry. I’m filled with nothing but regret and utter compunction for never having reviewed anything at all from the Schlenkerla Smoke Inhalation Series. I’ll get right on that. Let’s start off with the Helles Lagerbier!

Smell: Sweetish honey and toffee maltiness with only a background, though still obviously present note of smoke.

Taste: Sweet maltiness, perhaps a pinch of crisp pilsner malt, along with flavors of toffee and clover honey. Hint of biscuits, maybe a bit of ripe peach fruitiness. Mild, spicy hops and bitterness along with the very restrained smoke character assist to balance the sweetness. Finishes crisp with a remaining light blend of smoke and sweetness.

Mouthfeel: Medium-thin body. Medium-low carbonation.

Drinkability: Well, that really was a breath of fresh air! Schlenkerla lite, I dare say. Overall, highly drinkable and a very good way to casually introduce yourself to Schlenkerla’s wares.

Drank as part of my beer tour at Winking Lizard.  It was decent. I did not detect the so-called "smokyness" from the commerical description.  It was light, kind of wheaty and sweet flavored.

Bottle at Winking Lizard. This brew is a hazy yellow-gold color with a thin white head that dissipates steadily. Stringy lacing. Aroma of malt, grass and smoke. Medium-bodied with a subtle smoked character, and flavors of bready malt and grassy hops. The finish is clean and sweet with a smoked malt aftertaste. Slightly above average overall.
Golden colored beneath a tight white head. Biscuit like doughy malt aroma. Crisp clean malt flavors with hints of smoke in the background and just a touch of lemony hops in the finish. Quite nice.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2008 (German) Bottle shared by the Knights. Pours a golden yellow with a sm-white head. There is a slight skunky aroma to this brew, but the taste is of smoked meat, with a dry finish. Not bad, but i dont think i could drink a few of these back to back.

Another shared with the Dev-Knights.  Pale gold pour with a white head.  A light grain aroma with the smoked body kind of at the back end, not overpowering.  Some complexities but overall refreshing and rather light, no real bitterness at all.

Bottle shared with the Devonshire guys. Pours gold in color with a white head. Smells very doughy. Taste is standard helles lager with a side of smoke. The flavors dont blend, you can easily pick them apart. Nice, easy drinker.

My notes after 13 beers is "Tastes like natty".  hah. well although it wasnt that flavorless, it doesnt exactly live up to its counterparts.  Im sure there is some smoked flavors, i just couldnt pick them up.

500 ml bottle courtesy of SoLan. Pours a translucent gold color witha big white head that had good retention. The aroma is light with semi-sweet malted grains and light smoke. The flavor is that of a good lager with with a light smoke accent. The mouthfeel is a bit on the light side but still very nice for a lager. The finish is short and dry. Overall: A very enjoyable smoked lager, and one that should pair well with a great deal of BBQd food. Thanks Solan.

50 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden yellow to orange with a dense, huge and white head. Mild bitterhops and faint smoke aroma. Mild creamy mouthfeel. Nice cornish medium sweet flavour and light hoppy bitterness lurking through. Dry almost wooden finish with a slowly building bitterness.

so i wasnt much a fan of this smoked beer.  It was my first introduction to smoked beers, and this one just didnt do it for me.  Its a strange taste to add to a beer.  It poured a light yellow/orange, with no head and no sediment.  Its aroma was defined mainly by the smoked characteristic.  The flavor was very mild, not much flavor at all.  Bit of a skunked flavor though.  The palate was light, no body.
Bottle. Pour clear yellow with no head. Slightly skunky aroma. Taste is some carbonation with dry finish.

Pours a hazy gold with a thin white head.
Grassy aroma, slightly skunky, light bready malt, meaty smoke as well.
Quite lively carbonation, grassy hop flavour with a medium malt and sausage like smokey,with a dry finish.

Light golden in colour, thin white head, good retention, nice lacing.  The aroma is lightly smoked, some sweetness from the malt, bread.The flavour is a bit smoky but nowhere near the other Aecht beers, quite sweet, pale malts, herbal and earthy.  Sweet mouthfeel, medium/light body, medium carbonation.  Finishes lightly smoked, lingering sweetness.
Its nice, light but sometimes even lacking in smoke flavour.  Quite soft at times, even some floralness.
500ml bottle from the Premier Gourmet in Buffalo, New York.
Opened on December 19, 2007.
No date.

Bottle.  Pours a clear golden yellow with hardly any head.  Aroma is a bit skunky (which faded only slightly as the beer warmed) with some sweet malt notes.  Flavor of more sweet malts (bready), some light fruits as the beer warms.  I was surprised to learn this is classified as a "smoked", I guess I would say there are some smoky notes in this beer, but only if you look hard enough for them.  Just ok.

Bottle. Aroma of pale malts and smoke. Flavor mostly keeps the smoke in the background, restraining it to generalized earthiness, with the malt opening up into a nice, sweet breadiness, at times lightly fruity. This bready malt, definitely the highlight of the beer for me, also dominates whatever hop presence there is. Nice beer, nothing terribly remarkable.
Not too bad, but relatively unexciting.  The aroma is definitively smoky and peat-y, as is the aroma, but you have to work to find it.  Great mouthfeel though.

Bottle: Slight haze to the golden pour with a thin bubbly white head. The nose has mild smoke, but its there. Some doughy, damp German malts and a very mild hop character. Has some wood and earthy as well. Great creamy mouth feel, especially for the low ABV. Nice bready malts give it sufficient body. The smoke is apparent, less so when compared to their other offerings. It leans toward woody and earthy, and its nicely balanced by a mild Euro-hop bite in the finish. Pretty solid, just needs more Smoke!

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2011 Smoked ham and hop aroma is not very strong but pleasant. Deep golden color with a medium/small head. The start tasted like most German pilsners, crisp and clean, medium bodied.More smoked ham flavors arose in the finish with very little or no bitterness.

Pours very pale gold with a frothy white head.  Aroma of yeast, smoke, and spice.  Light, highly carbonated body.  Initial taste is crisp and clean, pilsner like hops.....lagerlike.  Finish is nicely (and not overwhlelmingly) smoked which definitely elevates this otherwise unexciting beer.  Not my favorite of the Aecht Schlenkerla line, but a clean, crisp, refreshing beer.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2011 Pours golden with a small white froth.  Light ham aroma, some smoke, and skunky German hops, sweet smelling.  Taste is much the same: salted ham, grassy, lightly smokey.  Nice bubbly light body, fine carbonation, glassy.  Seems like more of a pils than a helles.   A nice easy drinking accidentally smoked beer =) 7.3.7.3.15!..... [rerate 2011 after many many bottles... 7.4.7.4.15... more beer needs to be like this seriously, amazingly bready with a beautiful hop bouquet]

I thought this was a decent beer overall.  You get just a hint of the smokiness in the nose, but more herbal hoppiness, and a hint of ffresh cut grass.  The flavor is got a nice malt profile, a bit of honey sweetness, but very biscuity.  The smokiness lingers giving it a nice bitterness in the finish.  Enjoyable and uniquely different.

From a 500 ml bottle.  Nice hint of smoke in a well executed helles bier.  Loved the combo, but the helles bier as a base was a bit lacking.  My least favorite of the Schlenkerla line (but I still would get one from time to time despite the price).
The color was very light golden.  The head was creamy, thin, and white.  The aroma was very light grape.  The flavor was smokey.  The palate was lively.  The finish was abrupt.
Pours a very pale golden with a fizzy white head. The aroma is grassy, sweet, hay, crisp, a little smoke. The flavor is similar, crisp, sweet, grassy, a tad smokey. Not too blown away by this one.

A nice helles (smoked!) always hits the spot come baseball season, so I was pleased to see this on the shelf.  Pours a slightly cloudy medium gold with quickly dissipating white head.  Nose is light, slightly sweet, with floral notes...quite nice!  Flavor is initially not too smoky, but the smoke builds throughout the first half of the beer before fading again in the second half as the palate becomes used to it.  A mild hops bitterness accompanies it, to make this a nice beer, overall.

Crystal clear golden coloured body with a very thin white head - nothing too impressive. Aroma of yeast, wheat, corn, peat and a tiny bit of metal & fruity sweetness. Medium-bodied; Highly astringent in mouth with an interesting malty flavour at first then fading to a super mild smokeyness. Aftertaste is bitter from the smoke and malt, with a tiny bit of respite for some sugars - but not much. Overall, very odd for the style and not really good in any sense of the styles it tries to represent. I wish Id try some of their other beers before this one - but this really isnt recommended at all. I sampled this 500 mL bottle purchased from K&E Discount Beverage in New Paltz, New York on 12-April-2008.

Pours quite clear and golden with a big fluffy white head. Honey, malt, light smoke and floral hops in the aroma. Sweet malt and mellow smoke in the flavor. Strange way to make a smoked malt just from the house flavor and not actual rauch malt. Has a bit of oxidation and a metallic note. Could be a little bigger bodied. Still, a clean enough lager with a satisfying bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2008 Not a rauchbier really, altough it depends on your definition, but not a rauchbier.  Gorgeous pale golden colour.  Beautiful lightly smoked aroma with some lovely malt and a crisp, smoky, refeshing balanced flavour, excellent finish - nice and hoppy.  Superb with fish (not the most delicate however) and sausages.  Tends to oxidise fairly quickly in bottle in my experience so possibly not always accorded good enough score in the US.  Would it not be better to try an rate a beer on its merits as opposed to rating it against something (ie Rauchbier Marzen or Urbock) that it really doesnt share much in common, styilistically, other than a brewery name?  Always got to put it in a box....

Light golden color with a medium white head.  Aroma is malty, sweet, and lightly smoky.  Flavor is of a medium bodied Helles with a nice hint of smokiness.  Clean finish - good for a Helles, subpar for a Rauch.

Sparkling light gold, thin fizzy white head.  Light smoke aromas with faint earthy citrus-like tones.  Soft nutty earth and smoke flavors play out from start to finish.  Thin, watery, with soft carbonation.  A big disappointment when compared to the Urbock
UPDATED: SEP 15, 2015 Mild smoke aroma.  Gold color with some haze.  The smoke is very light, which makes sense from the way it is made, but what is there is good in the aroma and flavor.
Bottle, pours a pale yellow with white head.  Aroma of light smoke, maybe sausage.  Not much to the flavor - mostly malts with a smoked meat overtone.  Light bodied with a fizzy mouthfeel.

This was tons better than I was expecting.  Pours hazy yellow with a light white head.  The aroma thankfully only has a hint of smoke ~ it is mostly helles-like with pale malt, some corn and cream.  Medium body with some underscored sharp, but gentle, carbonation.  The flavor starts very helles with good solid maltiness, some spicy lightly grassy hops, some graininess and gentle smoke.  A bit more smoke comes out on the finish, but nothing that ruins the beer for me.
Average good lager aroma with the usual amount of yeast and a slight amount of roastedness. Hazy golden color with not much white foam. Mild beginning with a yeast and very tangy finish. Light body.

Pours a golden-brown, with a cottony white head. smells like lager, a little richer than average. Taste is bold for a lager, with a little banana and spicy hops. Dry ending, tingles tongue. Its subtle, the difference between this beer and other lagers, say Heineken. But its good in every way.

500ml bottle. pours clear golden with small white head that didnt last too long. light smokey and grainy aroma. flavor is grainy biscuity and lightly smoked. thin and watery body. sessionable but not smokey enough. i didnt think id ever say that about a schlenkerla beer.

500ml bottle at home. Except the fact that this beer tastes of rotten smoked cheese to me, nothing to complain, and with a big chunky smoked applewood doorstopper probably bliss :-) it pours an innocently golden straw colour with a big bubbly head. light smoky notes in the nose, which will hit you hard when you taste it. for a rauchbier too yoghurty. but hey it is extremly well made and even i have to honour that.

500ml bottle. Pours a light yellow straw colour with a big white head. Aroma of lager malt with a light smokiness. Taste-wise, its a case of your usual malt and hops meet smoky bacon for a party! The creamy mouthfeel helps the flavour linger and adds to the snack in a glass feel, but its not that heavy. Overall, nice for fans of smoked beers.

A lightly hazed pale golden beer with a thick frothy white head. Aroma is faintly doughy and fruity, with light smokiness. In mouth, a nice light sweet malt, like freshly mashed grains,  with pleasant smoky notes, light crisp German hopping and light body. Bottle bought last May 2007 at Spirit Haus, Amherst, MA, 3.80$US.

Bottle. Pours a slightly pale golden colour with a big well lasting white head. Aroma of grains, some malt and cow stable. The flavour is smoky with cow stable, malt, bitter hops and a soft sweetness.

Bottle at the Manchester Winter Ales Beer Festial. Slight smokey aftertaste, very drinkable. Reading a few rates and there is talk of bacon, so thats what it was! I did miss a meal drinking this I think, that must be why. Is there a better drunken food than bacon on waburtons? No, there is not. I did enjoy it a lot.

Bottle courtesy of yinzer at Pittsburgh gathering on 1/27/08.  Pours a very light golden color with stark white foam, great lacing and retention.  Somewhat restrained smokiness for a Schlenkerla, some nice light maltiness and German hop aroma also.  Flavor is nice and crisp with some nice bacon like smokiness.  Its like a great Helles that was dry hopped with bacon, good stuff.

Gold with a thin white head.  Aroma is is lightly malty, very light smokiness with a light sweetness.  Taste is very interesting, a light smoke accents the helles side of the beer, with some floral showing.  Definantly interesting.

Had the pleasure of sampling this at the 1/27/2008 Pittsburgh ratebeer.com gathering  and festival upstairs, Sharp Edge Creekhouse. It will be a long time, if ever I am invited again and I see a spread of bottles like I did there - ever again. I am not good enough for the beers that were that we sampled! For example, how about this beer, the prime example of smoke from yinzer!  Aroma of fine honey glazed ham or sweet pie!  Almost sickening in olfactory sweetness.  Attractive like it must be for a bee to a beatiful flower!  Look is very clear pale yellow. Barely any carbonation. taste is more woody than smoky. Vanilla at times. Very very unique, difficult and meaty! Thanks Mark, glad to have had the chancce to try this!
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Sampled at the RBPG; bottle courtesy of yinzer. The aroma of this particular beer from this brewery is perfectly described by two words: smoked honey. Pours clear golden with a thin white head. Medium bodied with light carbonation. This is a fairly simple lager, with a dry light maltiness thats not really complex. Unlike some of the other beers from this line, the smoked meat taste is not overpowering, but rather youre left with some smoky honey notes. Its light, tasty, and in no way overpowering when compared to the others. A bit thin, but nice.

No brewer does smoke like Brauerei Heller-Trum. Being based on a helles I knew it wouldnt be as strong as their others. Aroma was nice. Smoke and not much else. Pour was a light gold with a white ring for a head. Taste was bland (as I consider a helles to be) with not much coming to the front other than the mild smokiness. I like my smokes so strong that I cough after a sip. Good but not great.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text:
Bottle sampled at the Ratebeer meet-up 01.27.08 at the Sharp Edge Creekhouse. Beer courtesy of Yinzer. 

Pale yellow with white head. Aroma is malt, honey, ham. Flavor is the same and smoky but has a weak body. This was dubbed "liquid bacon" or "bacon grease," I cant quite remember the exactly wording. Personally I would have preferred more of a bacon flavor. :)

bottle.  golden pour, carbonated with clarity.  almost no head.  sweet grains, wheat, yeasts and caramel malts in aroma.  flavor is much the same iwth some rice and mild hops.  dry mouth.  texture a bit of syrup.

Pours a crystal clear straw colour with a large puffy white head, quickly reducing to a sudsy film. The nose is muted and uninspiring, with floral, saaz hops, honey, corriander and a whisper of smoked malt. The flavour brings out the smokiness of the brew, but its dominated mostly by floral hops and honey-sweet malts. There is an herbal, almost medicinal mid-palate flavour profile. The body is thin and the mouthfeel is sharp, watery and crisp. Dissapointing.

Bottle: Poured clear golden yellow color lager with a medium white foamy head with average retention and limited lacing. Aroma of floral malt with some sweetness also noticeable. Taste is a mix between some floral malt with some sweet notes but I could not distinguish any some at all. Body is quite full and slightly oily with some medium carbonation. Interesting but not really smokey.

Bottled (BB 01/2008)
Very pale color, small white head. Sweet maize-kind of aroma, very tiny smokey feeling there. Light grassy hoppyness, metallic malty flavor. Smoke in the aftertaste. Heller-Trum has better products than this, looks overrated.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2013 Bottled (2007). Yellow colour, small white head. Aroma is mild smoke, maize and diacetyl. Flavour is diacetyl diacetyl, maize and some mild hoppyness. Mild smoke as it gets a bit warmer. 4 2 3 2 7
Bottled (2013, from K Citymarket Kivihaka, Vaasa). Golden colour, mediumsized white head. Aroma is mild toasted malts, some grains, herbs and a bit mint like notes. Flavour is mild toasted malts, some quite strong grassy and hayish notes along with mild meaty notes. Also a bit metallic notes as it warms up. Still better than the diacetyl mess I had in 2007. 6 3 4 3 10.

14 Dec 07.   500ml bottle, blue & white bavarian flag label.  Pours clear, 24K golden yellow. White very rocky head.  A very light, almost undectable aroma of smoked malts.  Flavor of smoke.  But very light.  Clean, crisp malt body.  Very balanced.  Earthy finish, with nice hop bitterness.  Definately an unique brew.

500 ml bottle.  I knew I tasted smoke on this beer.  I thought I was crazy.  Aromas were sweet malty, leaning toward pilsner.  Flavor was crisp with some citrus notes and touches of smoke.  Not bad.  Interesting take on a helles.

Bright yellow gold color, with an off-white head, with a wet earthy, grainy pale malt nose, with a faint smokey note,with a hint of honeyed malt in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a crisp, sweet honeyed pale malt, a bit corny also, with a mild smokey character, with a faint flowery hop note, with a subtle peppery spiciness, leading towards a shy smokey, lingering hop bittering finish.

Bouteille de 500 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Odeur de fumée. Apparence: La couleur est blonde avec une faible densité de bulle. Saveur: Goût de fumée avec une pointe dhoublons. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence de fumée en arrière goût. (Rating #1377)

A smallish head.  Faint generally lagerish aroma.  Cloudy, pale golden color.  Just a hint of smoke, even though this is not actually a Rauchbier.  Strong hops flavor for a lager and this is its strongest point.

Pours an unfortunate macro yellow with a loose conglomeration of big bubbles and a razor thin suggestion of a head.  The nose is unfortunately a big skunked.  (Shame too, this just showed up in my beer store!)   Beyond the skunk this is a mildly sweet light lager with just the slightest hint of smoke.  Maybe a bit grapey.  The mouthfeel is thin and refreshing, what a lager of most sorts, like Helles, should be.  The flavor is a bit better than the skunk suggests.  A better than average euro lager at its heart.  Bigger malt sweetness, but very light.  A bit of hop bitterness.  Some small aspect of grape.  But there it is, just a touch of smoke.  Not the huge sticky bacon, but more like campfire smoke.  Oh how I miss drinking by a good camp fire...  anyhow, a bit grapey.  A bit tannic.  Long dry finish, with, unfortunately, a bit of skunk.

Pours a clear, golden color with a quickly disappearing white head.  Strong grain aroma, slightly metallic, hint of the upcoming smoked flavor, not much else.  Thin body, but smoked flavor makes up for that.  A dry, smoked wood in a fireplace is the best way to describe it, but not as smoked as the other Schlenkerla offerings.  Easy drinking, clean finish.  Great, if you can find it.

Bière blonde dorée, assez pâle, très claire. Faible col qui disparaît après peu de temps, effervescence très discrète.
Le parfum est essentiellement celui de la fumée, mais légère. Il ny a presque pas dodeur de bière. Le goût est aussi dominé par la fumée, sans trop être aggressive. La finale est moyennement amère. Assez équilibrée.
Le palais est mince, avec peu de gaz.
Ce serait une partenaire parfaite pour un plat de fruit de mer ou de poisson.
Elle se boit très bien pour une bière à la fumée, mais je nabuserais pas...

In short: A smoky basic lager.  Simplicity = Drinkability.
How: Bottle 500ml, fresh (drank as soon as we got it through private importation)
The look: Clear blonde body with a little white head
In long: Typical Helles lager yeast (egg white to me), inexpressive cereals, a somewhat oily body and quite a bit of smoke.  Undisturbed by the expressive maltiness of other Schlenkerla products I thought the smoke here was really pure smoke of dry wood/paper burning.  As little as I have to say about the taste (it is a very simple beer) I found myself wanting a lot more than the lonely 500ml that I had, so thats a good sign.  Highly drinkable.  A lot more smoked than I expected since I was told that this one doesnt used smoked malts and the smoke only comes from the residues of other Schlenkerla beers.  I mean, by itself this beer is as smoky as my college-days living-room.  But relative to other Schlenkerlas this is like walking into my college-days living-room after spending 6 hours in Willie Nelson tour-bus.
Poured a golden color with a minimal white head. Nose of wheat and yeast. Tasted clean, with some bread and yeast flavors. Not really much in the end.

16.9oz/500ml  bottle-pours a disappearing white head and yellow/pale yellow color.  Aroma is musty/muted grain, secondary earthy hops.  Taste is slightly smoky, musty/muted grain, secondary earthy/metallic hops.  Light side of medium body.  Mild carbonation.  Thanks jwc215 for sharing.

German rating # 100. Bottled. A clear yellow beer with a medium sized white head that disappears quickly. The aroma has more than a touch of smoke, though less than other Schlenkerlas beers, with also some malt sweetness. The flavour has smoked notes together and well balanced with malt and hops. Light to medium body, average to lively carbonation, long, dry and smokey finish. Softer, but certainly a Bamberger rauchbier. The more drinkable among this brewerys offerings. Very nice.
If you arent into to smokes beers this is perfect to review. Much lighter than the other Rauchbiers. A must try if you havent had one. Slight smoke taste with a watery texture.
user_location: Heart of the Rockies, Colorado, USA

text:
Bottle at home.
Yellow with a white ehad, quickly gone. Aroma light malty (smoked) and hoppy. Flavor light sweet, moderate sour, long. Light body. A specialty, ok.
Yellow with a small white head. Malty aroma with a hint of smoke. Sweet and malty, with more smoke in the flavour.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2012 Crystal clear, light golden body with minimal visible carbonation.  Wispy film with small, bubbly patches.  The aroma shows wet hay, light corn syrup, and traces of honey as the malt base.  A sweet breadiness and faint traces of smoke are soon to follow.  Minimal, grassy hops are detectable on the nose.  I dare say I even picked up trace scents of smoked pork.  The flavor is sweet up front, with corn malts and honey showing strong.  Grassy hops and a sharp, dry smokiness add balance.  Medium to light bodied with a crisp, dry, smoky finish.  Easy to drink and quite sessionable.   A very intriguing brew, and one that has enlightened me to the diversity of the "smoked" genre.

Bottle. Grassy, wet leaf and a mild corn sweetness on the nose. Just a hint of smoke. Pours bright yellow with a very thin white head. Lager breadiness and biscuit on the tongue with the smoke taking a back seat. Medium bodied with a dry smoky finish.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2007 Pours a most beautiful gold with a nice flyffy white head that settles moderatly to a thin film of carbonation. Legs begin then as small mountains of foam sitting on the beer. Steady sparkling carbonation.  Dry leaf nose is reminiscent of walking thru woods.  The smokiness begins lightly and elevates to a medium smokiness that is expertly mingled wh the malt and light hops.  Body is med and last a good while.  Moves into hop smoke finish that is also extended.   A tuly enjoyable brew that was a pleasant find at Half Time  in Pogh. NY.  A trip to bamber has just been put on the radar.

A delicate, clear golden lager... well its a Helles alright, covered by a healthy, lasting white foam. Clean and incredibly smoked for a beer with no bamberg malt. Delicate and flowery, woody. Soft and rather round in the palate, yet cleansed by a firm carbonation. I must say that the smokiness is its dominant feature really, but this is exactly what I wanted when opening it and was thus highly satisfied. Hugely drinkable. Minimal grassy hops procure a dryness that balances out the soft pils malts.
Very nice beer. Lighter then the other smoked beers I have had, it still had that mice BBQ flavor.

Golden colored, little white head. Dominating smoke in sweet aroma, some fruits and cardboard also here, misses some character with this smoke. Medium bodied. Flavor is also dominated by smoke, same cardboard and mild fruits here too. Aftertaste dries strongly. Good one, still expected more out of this.

Straw gold with then head. Subtle smoke aroma. Taste is of smoke, but is much lighter than the Marzen etc....Sharp bitterness to finish. This is right up my alley....just about the perfect mixture of a lager and smoke flavor.

from crackedkettle.com - translucid golden colour, little foam; subtle smokey nose; smoked bacon and ashes; subtle carbonation; some sweetness, medium-bodied, long gentle smokey finish, slightly peppery - a good session beer

Bottle. Small rocky white head that mostly diminished. Clear sparkling body with a golden color. Fair display of lacework. Aroma of grain, hay, cookie and light underlying notes of smoke. Over the palate the smoked notes becomes more evident. As does some grassy notes as well giving it somewhat of a light dry texture. Medium bodied with an average carbonation. Well balanced light bitter flavor and light sweet notes. Light dry and bitter smoky finish. Quit nice and very drinkable. This is a good beginners smoked beer I recon. I thought this was a well crafted beer without being spectacular in any way.

Pale gold in colour with medium carbonation. Light malt aroma with notes of honey, a bit of smoke, and a bit of fresh cut grass. The flavor starts out very Helles like with very minimal smoke: more light rounded malt notes backed up by some mild grassy/earthy hops. On the back end, the smoke re-asserts itself, and integrates with a light mineral bitterness. A touch watery, but I think the smoke residue really adds some nice character to a style that is often at risk of being a little uninteresting.

Clear gold with a lasting white head. Nose of wheat and malt with a taste much the same. Some subtle smokey hints in there that add some character. Has quite a decent creamy mouthfeel. Not at all bad for a style of beer I dont generally like.

Clear golden pour with a thin but lasting white head.  Lightly malty, smokey aroma.  Nice grainy hops up front, dough and a bit of that smoke throughout.  Not overpowering and it adds a nice element to what would be a pretty decent pilsner.

Pours a crystal clear gold with a small, bubbly white head.  Smells a little grainy, some mild malts, and very subtle hops.  Nothing special there.  The flavor was a little more complex.  You get some of that Schlenkerla smoke in there, but it is pretty controlled.  It is mixed in with some mild maltiness and crisp hops in the finish.  Slight bitterness in the aftertaste mixed in with the smoke.  Easy to drink and refreshing brew.  Went great with my pizza slice.

Tap, Town Hall Brewpub. Pale shiny copper, nice dense cap of fine white foam. Deep clean malt, a nice leathery touch, but not particularly full-on smokey aroma. But in the flavor, the gentle bright malt flavor blends seamlessly with a big leafy layer of smoke. Some underlying pear notes. Delicate palate. Interesting, well-crafted beer. Less intense than I expected, but I suppose that makes it a lager for an evening session, rather than just one glass. As a side note, its cool when a brewpub like Town Hall not only makes great beer, but also gets in really top-notch examples of beer from around the world.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2009 Pours a pale golden with a respectable, although small, white head that coats the glass..  Mild aroma of bread dough and hop flowers.  Crisp clean refreshing pilsener style German beer; perfect blend of sweet malts, mild hop bitterness and an interesting smokiness.  More in the Czech style than the more hoppy and ubiquitous northern German pils.  This is very good and loyal to the style, in spite of the smoke.  Perfect summer beer!

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2011

Mode: Bottle
Source: Brewfest, Athens
Appearance: pale yellow
Aroma: nice light smoked aroma
Flavor: light malt with great smoked flavor, light bitterness, its all about the great smoked flavor but its not too big to be overwhelming

after having a whole bottle I can say that the original rating from the brewfest thimble was spot on
