Date: October 11, 2011
Mode: Draft
Source: Brick Store Pub
Appearance: opaque yellow, creamy off white head, lots of sticky lace
Aroma: sweet winey aroma, light earthyness, touch of oak
Flavor: sweet and spicy flavor, touch of winey sweetness, lots of spicyness, growing touch of funk, balancing bitterness

Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 11/20
Rating: 3/5.0Drinkability: 6/10
Score: ** /4

Clear straw hued body with a small and fleeting white head. Aroma of spicy hops, subtle smoke, and sweetish malt. The smoke is picked up more in the taste, but is still quite restrained compared to the brewerys other offerings. Very well balanced and extremely drinkable. The smoke is more of an aftertaste than an intrusion.

Poured a very clear straw color with very little head that disappears quickly.  Aroma is slightly smoky with a faint hint of spice.  Palate was thicker than expected for a 4.3% lager.  Smokiness is up front with a nice grainy taste and a heavy finish.  This was pretty refereshing and the smokiness was pleasant and not overwhelming.  Ill drink the second half of the bottle with a steak.

Savannah, Ga. - Habersham Beverages, 500 ml bottle. Murky medium gold pour, kind of lifeless, light white head. Aroma of a freshly open can of sardines - not much else - stays potent throughout. Flavor has a strong smoky, sweet, chewy flavor that is not meant for the uninhibited or unaware. Pick up a hint of miso soup as well - odd, yes. Mouthfeel is thick enough. Not an everday beer and not meant for a hot day. Like all the other smoked beers from this brewer - difficult to tell which style this beer was originally before if got smoked.
Bottle.  Pale gold with a moderate white head. Aroma of sweet malt and floral hops with a hint of smoke. Flavour started sweet before smokiness kicked in. The finish was pleasantly bitter. Unusual.

Cask, GBBF 2007.  Golden with an off-white head.  Aromas are caramel malts with good smoky notes and some metal.  Flavours are hay and caramel with crisp soft citrus.  Some toast.  Floral with some soapiness.  Smoky and sweet.
A yellow beer with a slightly smoked aroma and flavor; nothing special here.

Golden with dense white head, fades to film, decent lacing. Bacon up front, dry biscuit character takes over, somewhat grainy in the background. Flavor much the same. Smoky bacon, dry biscuit/pils malt, very grainy, some residuel sweetness, with herbal/grassy hops near the finish. While it doesnt sound like much, at least in my words, this is a very nice brew overall. Well balanced, very clean, and highly sessionable. Would have to guess this is one of the better "lagers" Ive ever had. Not a euro-styles expert, but reminds me of some sort of smoked maibock-pils something or other.

Draft - Clear golden color with a hint of smoke in the aroma and a thin white head.  I loved the taste of this beer.  A subdued smoky flavor with an excellent helles backbone.  Could drink it all day.

bottle, thanks to MoritzF! 
Pale yellow, medium-sized head. The aroma is not smoky. However, in the taste the smokiness is clearly detectable. Starts rather smoky, the middle püart is smoky as well, the finish is dominated by hops. Not as full-bodied and smoky as other Schlenkerla beers, but still very very nice.

Light lucid straw with a small white head.  Aroma is fresh yeasty dough and musty at the same time and I swear theres this funky banana smell too.  Light and crisp on the palate.    It tastes a little like bananas, smoked bologna, and faint hops. Very drinkable as a Helles should be.

(50 cl bottle) Smoked? No way! No smoke what so ever in this one... Pale Lager for sure! Clear pale golden color, small white head. Sweet sugary malty scent, some corn. Sweet malty and vegetable taste. Medium mouthfeel and bitterness.
Orange in color with medium white head. There wasnt much to the aroma. Flavor was interesting. My first smoked beer. It was really good for a lager, but I guess smoked is a different category..

Bottle.  Aroma:  Biscuity malt, noble hops, apples, and faint whisper of smoke.  Appearance:  Light amber in color and clear.  Off white head was full and frothy with good retention.  Fair lacing.  Flavor:  Biscuity malt with a nice caramel note, noble hops that slant towards the spicey/earthy.  Smoke is subtle and ties with everything else pretty well.  Medium bitterness and a medium-sweet finish.  Palate:  Medium-light bodied.  Medium carbonation.  Overall:  I liked this one.  Smoke was interesting rather than overpowering.
Pours with the look of a standard lager. Smoky, slightly skunky aroma. More hops than usual in a german helles, and a nice smoky touch in the aftertaste.
Bottle at j-betskis in raleigh, nc!  This is wonderful smoke beer very subtle smoke flavor. pour amber with light head and lacing.  nice hoppiness on the mouthfeel and a light smoke finish

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2007 Bottle from Frugal McDugal in Nashville. A second hand smoked beer eh?
Pours a translucent golden with sudsy white head that dissipates to a ring. Strong aroma for the style, which is biscuit. bread, and european hops. Flavor as lots of biscuit and grass that transitions to a european hop (noble?) finish, with some hard water/ mineral notes.  The smoke is subtle on my palate, as I only catch it at the back of the mouth before it goes down. As it warms, you can pickup a little more. My wife picked up tons of smoke on the first sip. Perhaps I am becoming accustomed to smoke in beers or my receptors are not as sensitive. I liked this beern because it is  a unique and fairly aggressive Helles.

on tap at the hop devil grill, NYC.  thin creamy white head, clear yellow body.  aroma is a bit metallic & grassy.  smoke is super faint if noticeable at all.  smells like a bottlecap.  flavor is a bit spicy up front, medium carbonation, then dry grassy malt and a bit metallic.  not really getting the smoke.  the guy who distributes this told me theres a big difference b/c its on tap, and would be more smoky from the bottle.
Robe blonde très claire surmontée dune mousse blanche épaisse qui persiste. Arômes de levures, de fruits et de céréales. Saveurs de céréales, de houblon amérisant herbacé et de fumée.

Pousr medium yellow with small white head.  Nose is faint Noble hops and malty creaminess.  Bitter notes predominate in the flavor, with a hint of smoke that is overwhelmed by the fact that I am barbecuing.  Honeyed towards the end.  Medium body.  I think its good.

Poured a very pale straw yellow, translucent, with a dense head which faded rapidly. Little lacing. Aroma of Noble hops, some generic maltiness with slight liqourice/honey/caramel, and just a tiny hint of smoke. The taste was weak, watery with slight Saaz and Hallertau hops, and some sweet honey/caramel (which became more prominent in the finish). Some smokiness in the finish too, albeit very slight - especially for Schlenkerla standards. After drinking 3/4 of this beer I was missing the smokiness so much that I threw some Laphroaig whisky in the glass - ahh, that peatiness is more like Id expect from Schlenkerla! Watery mouthfeel, medium/low carbonation. An easy-drinking, light, and bland lager.

Bottle. Clear golden amber, with a medium quick dissipating head. Malty aroma, wet hops with honey and apples. I missed the smokiness in the first few sips, its got a bit of honey sweetness to it. After that the smoke takes hold, its more subtle than the other schlenkerla beers, but very noticeable in this more delicate style. When the smoke clears, the body emerges a little bit on the thin side, and hints of plastic linger. I think this has some interesting food and beer pairing potential, more so than their other brews. Being a fan of both smoked and helles styles, I found this justa little less satisfying than other beers of equal quality in each independent style. Regardless, good overall.
Yellow pour, frothy lasting head, very smokey and bandaid taste, very different but that is not always good.

on tap @ the Lazy Boy, White Plains NY.  A smoky beer - you have to try it.  Would not drink it all night, but worth a try.  Interesting flavor - grainy, malty + hoppy, but not too extreme in either.  A good blend

Bottled.  Poured a clear medium golden with a short, well-retained cap of creamy white head... some very light sediment floating around in there.  Aroma was of sweet floral and biscuity notes with a hint of lemon and just a touch of smoke.  Flavor had a very nice bready base with accents of lemon and smoke.. mild floral and herbal bitterness work well in here.  Light-bodied with great balance to it.. finish was a touch sharp.  Enjoyed it.

On tap at Map Room, Chicago.  Has that Saaz hops taste, and a slight smoky flavor.  The smoke is not as strong as their other rauchbiers.  Im not a big pilsner fan, so Im probably giving this a lower rater than the typical beer fan.  It just had an overall metallic taste that I didnt like-- like Pilsner Urquell.

Pours gold with a thick white head. Aroma of malt, earth, butter and some smoke. Flavor is basically of a helles with smoky notes. Balanced palate with medium mouthfeel. Could be darker, but an interesting beer.

Bottled: Light smoky aroma, malty, butter, hoppy and a bit grainy. Golden color. Smoky but not too intensive smoky flavor. Sweetness, malty and light grassy notes. Astringent, hopped and light bitter finish. A bit too light bodied.

Bottle. Clear medium yellow / orange color with a average frothy good lacing white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, bread light, grain, light hoppy, grass, earth, butter, light light smoke. Flavor is moderate sweet and light bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft.

Tap. Very quaint and refreshing helles, though not quite what one would expect from Schlenkerla, nor a helles, if that makes sense. A bit of off bitterness, but a very clean finish, quite quaffable. Pleasant.

Pale yellow-golden pour with small white head that diminishes quickly. Combination of light smoke and bready grain in the aroma. Bitter finish after a slightly sweet start. Subtle flavors of bacon, dough. Crisp mouthfeel and the finish is moderately long. Medium body. Very nice.

Draught at Reading Beer Festival, April 2006. Gold colour with a  light sparkle. Despite the absence of "Rauch" in the name, this has the signature Schlenkera smoky bacon profile in abundance, especially in the aroma. There are spicy hop notes in the flavour that do not clash with the smoke, but compliment it. Fantastic stuff.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2017 Perfectly clear deep gold color, sizeable white head with large bubbles popping and leaving a spider web of lacing on the glass. Stone, dried hay, honey-ish melanoidins ala Heller Bock, subtle char, burnt biscuits against citric-herbal, peppery, sticky hop oils.   Its more bitter in 2017 than its ever been, perfectly balanced by lush and firm carbonation.  Masterwork.

Pours a two-finger white head that fades quickly to a thin layer leaving traces of lace. Almost clear pale amber color.   Smoky nose. Light-medium carbonation and medium bodied. Flavor is smoky sausage, way more than "a hint of smokiness".  Clean finish. $3.30 for a 500ml bottle from Tullys Beer & Wine Wells, Me.

I would suggest that, contrary to the commercial description listed on this page, that this beer has more than a hint of smoke, although this is definitely not the smokiest beer Ive had (that would be the Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier Marzen).  To my palate, this beer tastes meaty, which is not entirely a bad thing but does make the beer a bit less drinkable than some other styles.  This beer tasted a bit like summer sausage, in contrast to the Rauchbier Marzen by this same brewer which tasted very bacon-y.  Definitely worth a try, but not something youre going to drink more than one of!  Also, if there was ever a thread on this site for "worst lawnmower beer," this might be in contention.

Oddly (at least to me) is that this beer really does look lager-like.  it is golden with nice amounts of head.  Aroma is very smokey.  Mouthfeel is actually fairly pleasant.  Recommended.

Bottle at home - while typing the festivalratings. Clear golden - white head. Corn, crisp, straw, grains, nice light hoppy, grape, citrus, lime, very dry, light smoked, dusty. It gives me a fury feeling on my teeth !!

Clear pale yellow body with small white head. The aroma is dense hickory smoke, light herbal hops and a touch of biscuit underneath. The flavor is lightly smoky, herbal, lightly grassy with some bread and honey. Medium/light body is softly carbonated with a nice bitter finish. Superb.
Pours pale gold with medium carbonation.  One finger head that dissolves quickly.   Never had a smoked beer before.   Not bad, but the flavor isnt for me.  Drinkable, but probably my last...

Crystal clear yellow/gold with a small white head. Distinct smokiness is right up front, almost masking altogether a grainy, bready aroma. Light, clean palate with only moderate carbonation. A hint of light malty sweetness lurks in the background, but the flavor here is dominated by a pleasing smoky bitterness. Lengthy dry refreshing finish. This is unlike any other smoked beer that Ive had, and certainly not typical of the beers of Bamberg, which I have had first hand. It is much lighter, and although apparently no smoked malt is used, the smokiness resident in the brewery certainly characterizes this beer. It is actually quite refreshing, an adjective normally not used in describing rauchbier. Not for everyone, but I like smoked beers.

Very strong, smokey aroma - it is very much like apple-wood smoked bacon, and very full.  The flavor is not quite as full as the aroma, but it retains its pleasant smokiness, now paired with a good dose of malts and a crsip hoppiness.  I would have actually guess that the alcohol content was more due to its full flavor.  Clean, slightly hoppy finish.Decent.

Nearly clear golden pour, with many tiny suspended particles - fairly smokey aroma, considering there is no smoked malt, with touches of honey and floral hops - smokey up front in the flavor, followed by flavors of butter, bread, honey - grassy, herbal hops arrive late, drying out the beer somewhat - the smoke doesnt quite work in such a light beer, but this is still pretty nice.

This smoked beer pours a yellow gold color from a 50cl bottle. Medium to large sized white foamy head. Aroma is slightly smoky, grainy and some hops. A medium bodied smoked helles. Malts are grain and cereal. Hops are spicy and earthy. There is just a hint of smoke in this one, subtle but prevalent. This is a fairly decent helles with that touch of smoke. Big bold carbonation. Very drinkable beer. Light and refreshing, yet it has a lot of flavor, with that dash of smoke in the background. Nice. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is crisp and clean. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.

Bottle.  Aroma is smokey, slightly funky, with a hint of grain.  Flavor is kind of nasty.  I have never had this style before, so I have no idea what to compare it to.  I think it tastes like medicine.

Pours bright gold into an English pint.  Fluffy white micro head with good retention slowly recedes to skim surface.  Smoky malt aromas.  Crisp smoke with a lasting slight bitter smoke finish.  Very light on the smoke and very refreshing.

A mild smokiness emerges from the pint bottle, but nothing like the smoked Marzen.  Unlike most Helles, the nose has a fair amount of hops.  It pours like classic Helles, clear and light gold.  The flavor is light, bready barley malt, light smoke, and firm hops, which do not quite blend together. Still, this is an interesting Helles, well worth trying even if not ones first choice.

Bottle... Barely hazed, light yellow lager with a small, creamy, white head. Decent retention. Subtle, smoked bacon aroma with a hint of menthol. Generously hopped for a helles; pulls up just shy of being heavily bitter.  Flavors of lightly kilned barley with sweet, smoky undertones. Medium-bodied and mildly creamy with super fizzy carbonation. Bitter, smoky, dry finish. My new favorite helles! Thanks, boboski, for the bottle!

On tap at Town hall brewery.  Pours a rich honey yellow color with lots of carbonation and a half inch of foamy white head.  Mild hops and malt on the nose.  Mild hop bitterness with a balancing malt flavor.  Dry mid palate with a surprisingly refreshing finish.  I didnt know this was supposed to be smoked when I ordered it, though I should have figured it given that it was from this brewery.  Not a lot of smoked character compared to their other beers but an excellent beer nonetheless.

bottle-pours sharp clear yellow with a foamy soapy whiteh ead.  nose is mostly smokey beachwood-pretty cool.  REally doesnt have that bacon./meat nose that the others have from this brewery.  the flavors here show the twangy german yeast very nicely along with lite smoke, spicy hops, and lots of grassy notes.  very well intergrated smoke for such a lite beer.  really unique for this style.  body is fluffy and soft.  carbonation is not as high as i thought it would be.  Definately worth a try by everybody!
Draft.  Golden pale w/medium head.  Grass, malts, etc.  Not as smoky as I expected.  Ok but I prefer the Spezial helles.

Very pale clear golden with a medium frothy white head. Has a pleasant mix of grain, grassiness and light smoke in the nose. Notes of sweet pils malt, lemon/citrusy noble hops, hay, grass and smoky malt in the finish. Light, yet full of flavor. Medium bodied with lively carbonation and a smooth mouthfeel. Good stuff.

Golden color with a thick, dense head of lacing, white foam.  Alright...this may be an odd observation, but I mainly smell canned, black olives with just a faint hint of clove in the background.  The flavor shows a lot more of the smoke that I was looking for but the black olives are there as well.  The balance is nice and this is unique and drinkable.  I would like to keep this in my fridge at all times.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a small sized head of foamy fine to medium sized white colored bubbles that were mostly lasting and left behind a softly carbonated light yellow-orange colored body and a good lacing. The funky aroma was malty and dirty sock. The mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish. The mild flavor contained notes of malt hops and smoky. A decent one but not one that I would consider buying again.

Unassuming gold color, foamy head--looks pretty much like beer. Nose of spicy hops w/ just barely a hint of smoke. In fact, the smoke is quite subdued in general, which was a pleasant surprise as I couldnt for the life of me figure out how smoke was going to work in a helles. Really, what this ends up being is just a nice twist on a traditionally styled German lager and its a very pleasant departure.

50cL bottle.  Pours a clear, medium yellow color; fluffy white head with attractive lacing and good retention.  Light, intricate aroma showing a creamy smokiness and hints of sugar.  Medium mouthfeel: pleasant balance between the crisp, floral lager and the creamy vanilla and smoke character; average carbonation; well-balanced and very drinkable.  Medium, toasty vanilla and smoke finish.

16.9oz, no date.  Pours a slightly hazy pale golden with a minimal white head, though with a bit of rousing a 1/2 finger head emerges, and fades again.  Aroma of smoked meat, grain--even a bit of corn, and some grassy hops.  Flavor doesnt have quite as much smoked meat so the grain, sweet biscuity malts and grassy hops come out more.  Moderate bitterness (4 on a 1-10 scale) arises in the finish.  Light bodied with light carbonation.  I was hoping Id like this more, though that said, it isnt bad at all.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Golden with a snow white smokey head.  Touches of lace.  Smoke character is very evident in this beer.  Very nice.  Big malty backbone, with a pleasant bitter finish.  Great beer.

Pours a clear yellow with a beautiful whit head with soapy lacing. Smoked meat/smoked malt aroma. It has a nice malt profile with just enough smoke for another layer of complexity the end with a pleasant hop bite in the finish. Well made beer.
bottle. pale yellow color. large head. sweet grainy. some malts and hops. traces of smoke. a confused beer.

50 cl bottle. Pale golden clear colour with a little fine white head. Light aroma of smoke and hints of maltness. Light malty flavour with notes of smoke, sweet malt and a touch of hops. Ends with a bitter and dry finish.
Bottled. Pale golden coloured with a large off-white head. Very nice balanced. A bit malty and sweet and also nice and hoppyness. Very refreshing with notes of smoke. Very nice.
Bottle. White fluffy but lasting head. Clear golden body. Sweet mind and round barley aroma with a touch of honey. Dry wood flavor with a relatively high hops bitterness.

Very pale yellow with a good charcoal white head. Aroma is malty with strong tones of smoke. Im not the biggest fan of smoked, but this seems okay. Very nice mouthfeel. Then I remembered why I did not like smoked... Too much of it again - powerful aftertaste, drowning out an initial malty sweetness.

A Mes rate: 50cl bottle from Quinns. Hardly a patch on their full on Rauchbiers but it still has that trademark smokeyness although here it is very faint. Still even a hint of that Schlenkerla flavour makes for something that is at the very worst enjoyable.

I had this bottle at Uber Tavern. I am not a smoked beer fan at all, but this beer is really good. The aroma has a hint of smoke and it carries on into the first sip. Then the beer becomes a classic helles lager. I could never session with this beer, but I woul definetly order it again in a session.
Smellls very smoky. Taste is like a piece of smoked ham. Really nice. I think I like the smoked lagers best, maybe even more than the smoked porters.
A good, traditional helles lager.  Very drinkable, good taste, a touch smoky, with a floral hop and soapy taste.  Good beer.

This is great beer!
Stonecrusher stopped by and mentioned that the case I had was not dated and ran the risk of being old, I trust the big lug so we cracked one in the store to test it.

Poured a nice light gold with a thin head, that had me a little worried at first because it died so fast.

The smell was slightly smoky, like a nice western highland scotch, wicked with some hops and a good green leaf hint. Had a hint of rye bread in the nose.

The taste is smooth with a smoky/hickory pepper that would pair well most cheese, and good marbled beefcuts. It finishes with a subtle malt/hop body thats like a sour dough bread.

Best beer I have had in a while. I quote crusher "this beer rocks"

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2007 Bottle (500ml).  Shared with blankboy and viggo, my bottle.  Pale clear yellow, not much head.  Sweet and peaty aroma, mild and smoky, floral hops, slighlty pungent on warming.  Sweet, sulfur-bandaiids, smoke and bitter herbal hops.  Extremely thin yet sticky (lip smacking) body, flat - smokey aftertaste  Really wanted to love it; didnt.

Clear, golden appearance; tiny head; no lacing.  Woodsy, peaty, mild smoke aroma with some tart fruit on the back end.  Moderately hopped, biscuit-like malt taste.  The second hand smoke adds interest to the sometimes staid helles style.  Medium bodied, well carbonated mouthfeel.  Finish is dry, crisp, long lasting.

Bottle. Poured a small white head that mostly diminished, poor lacing, mostly transparent with a tiny bit of cloudiness, minimal carbonation, and a pale yellow hue. Nose was malty, bready, hint of hops and smoke. Flavor was dry, smokey and earthy. Tingly, dry and smokey mouthfeel. Light-medium body.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2008 This had a very surprising smokey flavor.  I did not really expect that taste so it caught me off guard.  The cinder flavor was also prominent in the aroma as well.  The cinder chimney flavor and taste was not overpowering, but it was rather subtle.  The beer also has a cloudy hue to it.  I truly felt that I was drinking a beer and smoking a cigarette at the exact same time.  Not really the flavotr I was looking for.  For those of your that enjoy a nice cigarette or cigar, this would be a great beer for you.

Pour is a cloudy yellow with a average white head.  Aroma is fair.  A little peat and some smoke deffinatly not expecting that.  Flavor is holy smoke!  Lots of smoke and peat with some sweetness and a dry bitterness.  I have been avoiding this brewer b/c i am not a fan of smoked beers but this was not bad.  The smoke did not get in the way and it made for a more exciting lager.

In the 0.5L bottle from Beertopia. Golden yellow in color with a fluffy white head that leaves amazing concentric rings of thick lacing. Aroma is a faint, but established smoked scent. Flavor only has a mild smokiness, earthy and peat-like flavors are stronger. Delicious finish of bitterness on the back of the tongue lingers for a long time on this otherwise crisp beer. Very good.

50cl bottle. Clear pale yellow pour with a white head. Lots of carbonation bubbles rise to the top. Sweet malt nose lightly smacked with meaty smoke. Fairly light flavored, sweet malt, grassy notes, and more medium smokiness. The smoke flavors are well balanced against the malt and grassy hop, none of the flavors overpower. Fairly clean, crisp finish, just a small coating of smoke in the mouth. Rauchbier training wheels? Good stuff!

Bottle from beastiefan2k.  Pours sparkling light yellow with spare white head, spare lacing.  Aroma is average malt (bread), light hops (vegetables), average yeast (dough) with notes of smoke, ash and wood.  Short duration, light sweetness and acidity, moderate bitterness; light smoked vegetable and wood flavor.  Light bodied, watery texture, soft carbonation and a metallic finish.
A nice brew, hints of smoke throughout, some grass, slight dough, very drinkable and enjoyable. Thanks to MoritzF for the bottle.

The 16.9 oz bottle poured a crystal clear, light amber colored beverage with a modest white fizzy head that was mostly diminishing and left almost no lacing on the glass. The aroma was nicely balanced. It had a subtle wet smoked peat aroma that was accompanied by honey, fresh grass and caramel. The body was medium-light with an average carbonation and a watery texture. The flavor starts off lightly sweet but quickly takes on an interesting bitterness that lasts through the medium-long finish. To this smoked beers credit, the smokiness isnt overpowering but somewhat subtle.

500ml bottle pours golden with a short white head that fades back to a ring and leaves a little lace.  Aromas of some campfire smoke over some yeasty bread.  Flavor is good bready flavor and dough with a bit of bavarian hop flavor at the finish.  There is a smoke flavor throughout but it is definitely not the prevalent flavor in the beer.  Palate is light bodied without much carbonation.  Smooth and easy to drink start to finish.

500ml bottle, Stateline Liquors.  Pours a mostly clear pale yellow body with a slight yeast haze.  Small very fizzy head with minimal retention, bright white in color.  Aroma is that beautiful campfire and smoked meat scent of an authentic Schlenkerla Smoke beer.  Below lays some bready malt and light hay.  The smoke is still in the forefront of the flavor, but a little lighter than the Marzen and Urbbock beers.  Kind of an unusual style to be smoked, the more I drank, the more the Helles flavor became apparent.  Lots of hay and doughy malt and a little hoppy bitterness on the finish.  Mouthfeel is medium bodied with a moderate level of fizzy carbonation.  Nice full round texture.  Pretty darn good, but not my favorite from them.  You really cant beat these guys for Smoke beers, at least those that are available here in USA that is.

Bottle, a clear giolden colour with some carbonation rising to the large frothy white head. A sweetish hoppy aroma, with some yeast on the nice and a touch of that smokiness towards the end. A smoky touch again to the flavour, but with a dry lager palate and a bitter grassiness in the finish. A different lager.

Large bright white head of fine bubbles.  Lots of carbonation.  Smokey and grassy aroma.  Kind of weak and the smoke is not all that strong which is nice.  Medium gold in color.  Wheat flavor and texture.  Smoke is even lighter in the flavor.  Kind of shows up in the aftertaste.  Pretty dry and a hint of hoppy bitterness.  An ok smoked brew but the other offers from Aecht Schlenker are much better.

11/30/06: Bottle.   Aroma of light wheat, grass and yes - smoke.  Bright, golden-yellow body.  No head/lace.  Flavor is peat-ie with wood chips and slightly stale.  As beer warms some lemon is also noted.  Note to self:  I really like the packaging.

Clear gold, pillow white head. Nose is bread, very light campfire, a little lemon. Extremely well balanced. Flavor is light malt, crisp hops and just a hint of smoke. Im having a hard time sipping this one - its wonderful and demands larger gulps.

Mildly medicinal iodine-like resinous smoke malt in the nose.  Brilliantly clear golden body is topped by a decent white head that recedes slowly to a partial cover with some lacing.  Lightly medicinal smoke flavour with a sweet somewhat thin malt body.  Creamy texture with fair carbonation.  Bottle sampled with MartinT, muzzlehatch and Olivier_MTL.

Clear gold, pillow white head.  Nose is bread, very light campfire, a little lemon.  Extremely well balanced.  Flavor is light malt, crisp hops and just a hint of smoke.  Im having a hard time sipping this one - its wonderful and demands larger gulps.

Bottle. Poured clear pale color with a large frothy white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate smoke grassy aroma. Medium body with soft carbonation. Medium sweet smoke flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration.

500 ml bottle, white head when poured,
pale yellow straw lager, smelled of smoke from fat on a bar-b-q, pork fat, bacon, faint charred smoke and faint malts on the nose, some lacing on the glass, tasted of smoke, oily smoke, did not feel oily in the mouth,
malts and light hops are there in the middle and finish, the mouth feel is light medium.
Pours a nice golden color with a decent white head.  The aroma is lighly malty with a bit of smokiness.  The flavor is lighly malty with a light touch of hops and a crisp finish.

Poured a deep orange-golden color with a nice bubbly effervesence.  Previous rater is right ... this does smell like an ashtray.  Smooth and malty but there is a nice little smoked-sausage-like essence here.  This would go GREAT with a nice BBQ or the aforementioned smoked sausage.  Very good.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2012 Bottle bought at the brewpub. Clear yellow colour. Plasticky, thready head. The aroma  has a little ashtray. The flavour is quite malty with a bit of smoke, more than a hint. Pleasant, medium bitterness. And pleasant mild to medium carbonation. 5 3 7 3 15

Bottle, 4.3%. Citric aroma, must be from the hops. Clear golden colour. OK white head. The flavour is also citric, but with a good maltiness under it. Actually a good maltiness and mouthfeel for the relatively low ABV. I would not say it has a smoked flavour, more like stable or mild horse to me. Good, but not a beer I will be drinking cases of as long as their Rauchbier is readily available. 7 3 7 3 15

Bottle sample at Union Beer Trade Tasting, NYC. Light golden with a small white head. Aroma is an interesting blend of fresh lager - bready malt, grassy hops - and well-balanced smoke. Flavour is nice and fresh as well, with a good maltiness to balance the smoke, and some hops hitting the back of the tongue. Not as killer as the Marzen, but a nice diversion - I could imagine this as a good session beer, actually.

Sampled draught at Akkurat, Stockholm. bronze coloured with rich white head. Aroma of smoked pork, biscuiy malts and grass. Smokey and sakty flavour. with a firm bready malty base. Long smokey and crisp aftertaste that lingers on.

Clear medium gold. Medium head of crunchy white foam. Lots of carbonation bubbles after the pour, slows to a few steady streams as it sits and the cap fades. Ghostly thin lacing in inky stringed patterms.

Aroma is smokey with a clean, crisp, pale malt profile. Very distinct and peculiar with a tang of smoked meat and grain. Nice.

Taste is broad and lasting with a savory little spiceyness of grasses and beechwood. Topping taste in the middle of the smokey stuff that stays nicely weaved within a pale malt sweetness and mild, easy going tang. Perfect floating finish of leftover smokeyness and a feathery spiced hoppy dryness. 

Feel is bold, rounded, smooth, and solidly placed in a medium body. Nice little centering sweetness and one fantastic finish of spice and impressionable length.. 

One very solid, straight up goodalicious, Helles Lager!

From a 500 ml. stubby euro brown bottle with no freshness date.

Poured a clear lager golden with a foamy white head that settled into a thin sudsy lacing.

Smokey malt aromas with hints of grain, bread and floral hops.

Good carbonation and a crisp, slick, creamy smooth light-medium bodied mouthfeel.

Delicious tasting, toasted grain and sweet, slightly sugary malts mingled with smoked malts, a light spicy and floral hoppiness, the hop are have a soft bitterness, just enough to balance against the sweet, smoky malts, and a sweet grainy finish with a soft smokiness linger on the tongue.

The more beers I try from this brewery, the more Im impressed with their quality, you dont have to like smoke beers to find this very drinkable.

Light gold with a small, white and foamy head. Lightly smoky in the nose with a touch of fruitiness. Some grassy notes, but it is a little weak in the aroma department. The flavor is noticebly stronger in the smokiness. The fruits are a bit more along with the maltiness. Almost a lemon quality underlying the smoke. The body is light and refreshing and this is just smoked enough to pique your interest. I liked it.
THis beer was as good almost as the other before. BUt it was a Lager, BUt with this I do not care what Style is.
A light yellow pour. A clovish aroma slightly overpowers the paper aroma. A crisp clean taste that reminds me of a Kolsch but not hardly as dry. Not a great beer but not bad for what iit is.

Poured a clear light yellow color with a small white head.  Big smokey aroma.  The smell reminds me of the way band-aids smelled when I was young.  Not in a bad plastic beer flaw way though.  The flavor was lightly malty with pleasant smokey notes.  Light body.
[draught at GBBF 06] Grassy hop aroma with bready malts and a good dose of smoke. light and firm mouthfeel, dry finish.
UPDATED: SEP 17, 2006 clear gold.  medium sized creamy head.  honeyish malts with a hint of pepper and smoke in aroma.  flavor is quite similar.  a dry lager.  a good one from the smoke masters.
Thanks to hopdog.  Pours a translucent golden yellow with a smaller bubbly head.  Aroma of a chipolta mexican dish, refried beans and a very light smoke.  Flavor of the same a bit water and thin.

Bottle acquired in trade with The_Beer_God. This one was hard for me to nail down. It was all over the board as far as rating the categories. It poured a light golden color with a large sized white head. Looks like a Pale Lager. Then came the nice aromas of strong smoked meat, pepperoni, pork, beef jerky and had a refried bean aroma. The tastes were thin and almost non-existent with tastes of light smoke and a generic light sweetness. The tastes did not live up to the aromas.

Looks like your run of the mill lager.  Pale yellow, hin head with some residual lace.  Slightest hint of malt in the nose.  The smoke really comes through once you taste it.  Pure Bambergian woodsmoke.  I love it.  The hint of smoke is very nicely done.

ich German grainey malt and hop aroma, the subtle but distinct texture of the beechwood of Bamberg  is also there,quick malt and hop balanced taste,some smoke ,less then the aroma would indicate,and definitely less then the other Schlenkerlas ,slight bitterness at end, and abrupt drying sensation in the swallow,big enough body not to be a thirstquencher . Wonderful stuff

(Draught at GBBF, London, 4 aug) Colour is golden yellow with a small head. Nose is malty with a clean, fresh, grassy hop aroma, just a hint of smoke. Taste is malty and grassy, ending in a long finish with a nice, grassy hop character. Dry and bitter, very clean and fresh.

Bottle pours a slightly hazy light golden color with a small quick white head.  No lacing.  Aroma is pale malts and rather lagerish with a slightl smokey note per the com. description.   Running it through the dirty filters will do that to it i suppose.   Flavor was just the right amount of smoked character.  Light medium bodied, easy on the hops and a clean finish.  This is the kind of smoked beer I can get used to.

The pour reveals a clear golden color with lines of tiny, lazy bubbles going up and a thin bubbly white head. The aroma reminds me of fresh bread with some smoke and earthy hops. The flavor is very bready and crisp, the smoke is not as powerfull as other Schlenkerla so the gentle nature of this helles is not overpowered and it can express itself in all its fragile beauty, the earthy hops are there but again not too strong , the finish is dry and mildly bitter. The body has a medium thickness with a soft, oily texture and moderate carbonation.  I like this beer, I like Schlenkerla.

A lustrous golden straw body props a small and wispy white head.  More than a hint of smokyness comes across in the aroma, though it is quite tame as compared to other Heller-Trum offerings.  Plump, bready malts and earthy noble hops round out the simple, but inviting and clean, aroma.  Early in the flavor a delicate honey on toasted bread sweetness comes across, fading into a slightly sulfurous mid-palate and finally exposing crisp hops at the finish.  A smoky, charred flavor develops in reverse--starting at the far back of the tongue, migrating forward after each sip with a retronasal experience akin to exhaling after taking a big wiff of expertly prepared smoked prime rib.  The mouthfeel is sturdy, appropriate for the flavor levels, with a very smooth texture.  Carbonation could be a touch brisker, though.  Well played and intriguing, but it lacks the radiance of a great golden lager and the oomph of a full-on smoke beer by trying to be somewhere in the middle of the two.  500mL bottle, Burgundy glass.

Brilliant light gold body that holds up an average sized white head.
Noble hop aroma.
Slightly sweet flavor that is nicely bittered by the hops. Long, lingering dry palate with just a hint of smoke in the finish.  Creamy mouthfeel, easy drinking.

Bottle.  Pours gold with a weak smoke/lager skunk aroma.  Flavor is a sharp spike of smoke and a touch of lager in the finish.  Flavors spread evenly over the tongue.  Pretty good; Ill buy more, but its not the best this brewer has put out for tasting.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Rated to style and expectations, which were low as I had no idea this is smoked also until I poured it.  No, this is no bland typical lager.  ITs basically a lighter smoked but in the same vien as their other rauchbiers.  Its got a nice leathery beefy aroma.  Clear helles straw gold beer with snowy head.  Has a healthy touch of that meaty smokiness on the tongue, a pleasant surprise.  good malt-pure beer with modest bitter hops, a top compared to general lagers, and given its low alcohol, that is an appropriate comparison.  It tastes more like a normal lager as you drink it.  This is a beer to session when you want to have one fine-ass session.
Bottle sampled with Stegosaurus. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of smoke and toasted malts. Flavor is smoke, sweet, and slightly bitter. Good beer.

Bottle sampled with Beerded_one. pours clear orange\goldenwith a thin white head. Aroma of slight smoke and sweet malts. Flavor is smoke, sweet malts, slight hoppy bitterness. Decent body, decent brew.

Aroma:Light smoke aroma...
Appearance:Clear gold with a good white head...
Flavor:fruity,light smoked flavor,light bitterness....

Pours a crystal clear gold with a wispy thin ivory head. Some faint fine lacing. Smell is smoky. Smoked peat. Some lightly grassy malt.

Taste is smoky, of course and a rich grassy malt. Noble hop finish with a faint fruitiness. Mouth is crisp, if a bit thinnish. This is just so heavenly good. One of the better beers Ive had all year. Yummy!

Germanic pilsner malt and light spice hop aroma; lightly smokey and clean though very lightly fruity, balanced, simple flavor and watery texture; slightly dry finish; pretty subtle smokiness, and not on par with their other offerings.

Pale yellow with a largish, white and holding head. Soapy florals and clove-like smokiness comes across like incense in the aroma over toasty malts and mild vegetal notes that seem to defy the claim to Reinheitsgebot displayed so proudly on the label. Smokiness remains light yet steadfast in the flavor over the milky bittersweetness of a well-made lager. I prefer this brewers Märzen, but this was a pleasant, surprising treat.

(500 ml bottle from Belfast Co-op) This pours pale straw yellow with a tall somewhat foamy white head. Aroma is of malt, honey and sweet hay. As head recedes, on comes the aroma of smoked meat!  Sloppy foamy lacing. Mouthfeel smooth, full but a touch watery. Flavor is smoke overlaying  sweet honey malt. Pretty delicious. All rauchbier lovers should seek this out!

Aroma is smokey with a decent level of malt too, clear amber, pours a medium sized white head. Taste is lightly smoked malt, with just the right amount of hops. Very well balanced, lovely drinking, and the smokiness is most unique. Really fine! Ive wanted to try this one for a long time, Thank You for sharing mds!

Pristine clarity and a bright yellow-gold color underneath a sudsy, white foamy head riding upwards of an inch thick.  Formidable aroma is spelled out by slightly smoked applewood, lemon lightness, buttery sourdough with some charcoal fumes, and toasted & crisp maize and corresponding husks.  Flavor confirms that this is a helles at its best.  Toasty applewood and balsawood licked by flame.  Light pilsner base with a pillowy, curt lemon charm.  Baked corn in the husk paired with hearty and buttery sourdough. Medium-bodied, crisp and the posterchild of palate stopping power.  Slight and mild noble hop bite and a perfect symbiotic relationship from all contributors in this one beautiful bottle.  Small smoky trailings with crisp wood characteristics join with a fruit lemon and pils musk lightness in its final glory.  Absolutely incredible.

(on bottle)Very well balanced beer here. Has a present, but relaxed smoked aroma. The carbonation is perfect and tonesforward a good malting along with fine notes of coal, wood and rope. A very drinkable lager, with a hint of bondfire.

Bought this one because it looked very very german.  Smells a little sweet and floral.  Yellow body with thin, quickly dissipating white head.  Smoky.  Definitely can tell why its a smoked... Not many other strong flavors surface.  Thin, goes down easy.  An okay beer, but not something Id get all the time.

Pours to a watery golden body with champagne bubbles and a decently thick frothy white head.  The aroma is quite smokey.  Odd that they dont use smoked malts, it surely picks up a lot of the smoke aroma.  Smoked andouille sausage, floral rose hops, very unique.  I cant detach my nose from the glass.  The flavor is light floral hops, perhaps lavendar and tea leaves, corn-like sweet malt, light smoke.  The palate is surprisingly not too thin.  Very easy to drink.

Bright straw color with a moderate white bubbly head. Mild medicinal smoke aromas, with hints of floral hops and a touch of dry grain. Very light and soft of the tongue. Pale malt sweetness is taken away quickly by a light birch smoke flavor. Rather full bitterness in the finish and linger. Easy drinking smoked brew, perfect for that mid summers night grill out.

Pours a pale gold color with light carbonation, decent head and no lacing. The nose is sweet with some light residual smoke, peat, plum, clean pilsner malt. The flavor initially has a large amount of smoke, but the hop bitterness and malt sweetness quickly overcome that, then it slowly recedes back to reveal the remaining smoke. Clean and balanced, this accentuates the subtle smoke very nicely. The mouthfeel is nice, a bit tingly, but well rounded and easy to drink. The finish has a nice snappy hop bitterness on it. A good smoked beer and an even greater lager. I like things like this. It tastes like it even made the journey over quite well too.

Tryed this beer at Maxs, it is absolutly wonderful. very clean taste, the first sip really tasted smokey but that soon went away to reviel the flavor of hops and malt.
The beer overall is well ballenced, no one flavor hits you too strong.

Dem Bayerischen Reinheitsgebot entsprechend gebrautes" Say it, over and over again. Dont know what it means, though. Maybe "Mmm, mmm, good"?

Crystal clear pale yellow appearance, under a generous dollop of snowy white froth, slowly dwindling down, and leaving lace. Nice, classic look for the style.

Aroma is empty at first, with slight suggestions of pepper and grain. Dry, smoky malt. Well, this is Schlenkerla. 

Taste: smokey from the start, then crisp, clean malty flavor. Easy-going down the throat, light-bodied, meager, but appreciated fruity, malt character, and ever-present smoke. 

So easy to drink, and so refreshing. Classic lager, with the hit of smoke an extra treat. Yum, Im liking it better as I go. 

A unique offering, a terrific treat.

I wasnt really expecting this to be smokey, but it was. Apparently, its not something from the recipe, but lingering smoke in the brewery equipment. Its still rather strong, but I suspect thats because the beer is rather light. Good balance between lightly sweet malt and the husky smoke in the aroma and flavor. Just a touch of hop aroma and bitterness.

Bottle. Pours yellow fizz with a laughable white head, but you know what they say about judging by appearances. Some corn and malt in the nose--not very interesting. Great crisp clean super-drinkable body, though. As nice and refreshing a summer beer as you could ask for. Good thing its late June outside. Crisp, clean, dry finish--just a hint of smoke there at the end, not very prominent in the mid-palate unless you really swish it around. Easily the best pale lager Ive ever had.

Light gold, yellow, a bit fizzy even.  Pleasant, lightly smokey aroma with a touch of a spicy floral touch.  Flavor is a great balance of smokey light malts and a gentle, floral hop finish.  The smoke enhances here, rather than dominates as is so common in the Heller-Trum beers.  This was really good stuff.

Crystal clear golden color with thin white head. Aroma is mildly smoky with some sweet lager and grainy malts. Malty taste from the lightly roasted to sweeter malts. About midway a small bolt of smoke flavor surfaces and then disappears leaving a refreshing grainy malt flavor that lingers to the next sip. There is also a noticeable bitter hop presence throughout the taste profile. This beer manages to create a balance between the malts, hops and the smokiness. Excellent tasting beer. A great choice from Schlenkerla if youre in the mood for a mild smoky beer as opposed to the pure smoky, smoldering embers they have managed with a few other beers.

(05.19.06) 4.3% ABV. One pint. 0.9 oz brown bottle from DiCarlos, Mundelein, IL. Poured clear golden yellow with small white head. Soft carbonation. Smoky aroma. Light-to-medium bodied lager that starts dry with smoky malt flavor. Finishes dry with light hop bitterness.  An interesting smoky tasting lager and a pleasant surprise to find in a lager.

Bottle.  Pale golden beer, spritzy carbonation and a creamy white head.  Smokey beechwood aroma is the dominant note over a very clean pale malt backbone.  Flavour is well balanced as well, soft pale malt, light grassy noble hop flavour and a soft but insistent smokiness.  Who knew smoked could be refreshing.

Bottle. Pours a clear yellow-gold body with a fluffy/bubbly white medium head. The aroma is quite nice - earthy with woody smoke notes, even some light fruit, and then wafts of sweet malt. Lightish body with sweet and smoky malt. Interesting character and superbly drinkable.


Purchased at Merchants Fine Wines in Dearborn, MI in April 2006.
Golden with a small off white head.  Carbonation on the light side.  Aroma is smoky with some spicyness.  Taste is lightly smoky, with some spicyness showing in the palate, smooth watery finish.

The body was medium yellow with a thin white head. The aroma was lightly smoked with some carrots and a little bit of pork. The taste was smoky with some celery. There was also a little bit of black pepper spice. Decent beer, but I have had better from Schlenkerla.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2006 Any first impressions?
-A veil of head disappears into the pale yellow clarity.
-A timid aroma produces a slight hop accent, and mild wooden smoke.
-A rising herbal, leafy hop flavor buries the smoke residue.
-A very lean maltiness creates an aqueous mouthfeel aimed at long sessions.

What if you dig deeper?
-The herbal hop bitterness is proficient and moreover very pleasant.
-My bottle doesnt have much smoked character to it, with reason, since there is no smoked malt at all in here!
-Maltiness is quite underwhelming, and not nearly as well-developed as most basic Franconian lagerbiers Ive had over there.

Bottle bought at the brewery; best before August 06.

A second bottle, bought in the US recently, produced more smoke in the aroma and flavor, thus hinting this time at a smoked lager. But the nearly anemic maltiness and easy finish still couldnt wow me. 3.4/5, compared to the 3.2/5 I had in the first bottle, mostly aroma points going up.

Bottle purchased at Bottleworks in Seattle.  An appropriate breakfast beer for an East-coast schmuck like myself who is still jet-lagged.  Slight corn, malty aroma with some moderate smoked flavors, not unlike bacon.  There appears to be a slight DMS component.  An interesting aroma.  Transparent dark straw color with a small whitish head and nice lacing present.  Spritzy, peppery biscuit grainy malty start.  Finishes with some milder, subdued smoked flavors than the rest of the Schlenkerla beers.  This beer is very refreshing and balanced.  For once, the smokiness doesnt kill the other flavors of this beer.  Well-done.

Pale gold, with fizzy white top. Woody, grainy, gentle forest wood smoke like. Sweet malts behind, with light berry notes. Medium bodied, with gentle smoky overtone. Regular decent lager but with smoky character. Nice balance here. Refreshing and very drinkable "smoke".

Well, this one poured as expected, golden color, thin head, good lacing on the way down. Lots of carbonation rising in the glass. The aroma wasnt rauch-like at all, so I figured I just picked up a non-smoked straight helles product from the finest smoke brewer of the world. Some grass and honey in the aroma. Flavor, however was awesome, a nice helles / pilsner flavor with the low grassy hops also in the profile. However, the aftertaste had a firm hint of smoke in it, nothing like their other brews, very subtle in that sense, but man, just a very nicely done smoking for a "helles" or light lager beer. Mouthfeel was light, refreshing, and carbonated. Good stuff!!!

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2009 Ok so I hate pale lagers but I love smoked beer.   This is one of the worst looking beers in the world.  Looks like yellow water.  The smell is fainlty smoked.  The taste is very good cause its smoked.  Well, I like the smoke but the rest of it sucks.Its better on tap, still does not look appealing but the smoke level with the fresh lager beer works well.

text: God I love smoked beers. This one pours a pretty standard golden lager color with a thick and fluffy white head. Aroma of crisp apple with a significant dose of charred wood. What we have is a skillfully crafted Helles featuring a crisp hoppy flavor and a strong malt presence. What really sets this apart is the underlying smoky flavor that adds complexity to this outstanding brew without dominating everything with smoked meat flavors. A smoked session beer if there ever was one.
UPDATED: JUN 19, 2006 A great addition to the smoked beers. I love this Helles lager. Slightly smoked and refreshing as ever. Great for a summer bbq.

Wow, I didnt expect this one to be smoked, just an ordinary helles. Actually it comes across more like a pilsner, with its distinct hop bitterness. Begins with a bright golden, crystal clear color with a creamy 2 fingered head. Aroma has a touch of charred wood. Flavor is more smoke, with some rounded clean bready malts, which melds evenly into a full hoppy finish, with a resiny almost grapefruity character. This is really outstanding and characterful for a low gravity lager.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2017 Bottle.  Clear pale golden with a pillowy white head.  Amazing, still smells like smoke, though more subtle than the others from Schlenkerla.  Initially crisp, tastes mildly sweet and very malty with less smoke than in the nose, not overdone; balanced and light, with a long dry aftertaste and a note of final bitterness.  I have to wonder, was the smokiness intentional, or has every piece of equipment in the brewery been contaminated with that delicious Schlenkerla goodness?  Thanks to pivnizub for this treat! [2006.07.04: 3.5]I seem to recall having a bottle or two of this since pivnizubs treat, but heres one in the USA as an Easter treat: Smoke is much more reminiscent of raw bacon or even uncooked cured ham than the others in the portfolio -- less Maillard to get in the way?  Lighting has a lot to do with perception -- this can look anywhere from pale clearish yellow to neon yellow to dingy light golden, but clean with a large and extremely foamy bright white head.  Taste is subtle and dry, very smooth and relaxed flavor without punishing anywhere; malt is grainy but clean, deep, thin and theres a shade more citric  noble hopping than I remember.  Not as crisp as that normal Helles-Pilsner range, but also not flabby and much more drinkable -- carries with it some of that wooden / barrel character, rustic chic.  A gentler and occasionally preferable offering.  [2017.04.16: 4.1]

Lightest smokiness of all the smoked beers by these guys.   Easy-drinking and high quality lager...very refreshing on its own...but touched by hints of rich bacony smoke.   Another fine beer choice that would pair very well with robust or smoked foods and cheeses, without the fear of overwhelming them altogether.   Well done!
